sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Kuongezeka kwa kasi kwa visa vya ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona (COVID-19) katika Muungano wa Ulaya/Eneo la Kiuchumi la Ulaya na Uingereza, tarehe 1 Januari hadi tarehe 15 Machi 2020
en-mt: Rapid increase in COVID-19 cases in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Jumla ya matukio ya visa vya ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona (COVID-19) yanaonyesha mshabaha katika nchi za Muungano wa Ulaya/Eneo la Kiuchumi la Ulaya na Uingereza kuthibitisha kwamba, katika kiwango tofauti kwa kutegemea nchi husika, janga la COVID-19 linaendelea kua kwa kasi katika nchi zote.
en-mt: The total number of cases of COVID-19 shows a trend in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom to confirm that, at different levels depending on the respective countries, the COVID-19 pandemic continues to grow rapidly across countries.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Kulingana na hali ilivyo nchini Italia, mataifa, hospitali na vitengo vya kushughulikia wagonjwa mahututi vinapaswa kuongeza hali yao ya kuwa tayari kwa ongezeko la wagonjwa wa COVID-19 watakaohitaji matiababu na hasa hali mahututi.
en-mt: According to the situation in Italy, nations, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for the increase in COVID-19 patients who will need medical attention and especially critical conditions.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 31 Disemba 2019, kikundi cha visa vya nyumonia ambavyo vyanzo vyao havijulikani kiliripotiwa kule Wuhan, Mkoa wa Hubei, China.
en-mt: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases whose sources are unknown was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Tarehe 9 Januari 2020, Kituo cha Kudhibiti na Kuzuia Magonjwa cha China kiliripoti chanzo cha ugonjwa kuwa ni virusi vipya vya korona ambavyo kwa sasa vinafahamika kama matatizo mabaya ya pumu yaani sever acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: On January 9, 2020, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the cause of the disease as a new coronavirus, which is now known as severe asthma syndrome 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Hivyo, ugonjwa unaosababishwa na maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 umepewa jina ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona (COVID-19).
en-mt: Thus, the disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named COVID-19.

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Ushahidi uliopo hadi sasa ni kwamba 80% ya watu walio na COVID-19 wana hali ya wastani ya ugonjwa, yaani maambukizi ya njia ya pumu au bila nimonia na wengi wao walipona.
en-mt: The available evidence so far is that 80% of people with COVID-19 have a mild form of disease, i.e. an infection with or without pneumonia and most of them recovered.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Katika 14% ya visa, COVID-19 hukua kwa ugonjwa wa hali mbaya zaidi unaohitaji mtu kulazwa hopsitalini huku 6% ya visa vilivyosalia vikiwa vya hali mahututi vinavyohitaji matibabu ya hali mahututi.
en-mt: In 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease that requires a person to be admitted to the hospital, with the remaining 6% of cases being serious cases requiring intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Kiwango cha vifo vya wagonjwa waliolazwa kutokana na COVID-19 ni 4%.
en-mt: The death rate of hospitalized patients from COVID-19 is 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Katika utafiti huu, tunatathmini jumla ya matukio ya COVID-19 katika kila nchi ya Muungano wa Ulaya/Eneo la Kiuchumi la Ulaya (EU/EEA) na Uingereza (UK) na kulinganisha na hali katika Mkoa wa Hubei, China.
en-mt: In this study, we assess the total incidence of COVID-19 in each of the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) countries and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to the situation in Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Pia tulilinganisha idadi ya visa vya sasa vya COVID-19 katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza UK na idadi nchini Italia kuanzia tarehe 31 Januari–15 Machi 2020.
en-mt: We also compared the number of current COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA countries and the UK with the numbers in Italy from 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Visa vya COVID-19 katika mataifa ya EU/EEA na Uingereza
en-mt: COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Baada ya China, COVID-19 ilienea katika maeneo ya kijiografia na masuala ya janga la COVID-19 katika maeneo mengine ya ulimwengu kwa sasa yanafuata yale ya nchi hii.
en-mt: After China, COVID-19 spread across geographical areas and aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic in other parts of the world are currently following those of this country.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 11 Machi 2020, Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni (WHO) alitangaza COVID-19 kuwa janga kubwa.
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a major pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Katika toleo la tarehe 5 Machi la Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. waliripoti kuhusu visa vya kwanza kuthibitishwa vya COVID-19 kulingana na ufafanuzi wa kisa kwa mujibu wa WHO.
en-mt: In the March 5th issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first confirmed cases of COVID-19 based on the definition of a case according to WHO.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Katika EU/EEA, Vvisa vitatu vya kwanza kuthibitisha viliripotiwa na Ufaransa mnamo tarehe 24, Januari 2020 miongoni mwa watu waliorejea kutoka Wuhan, Mkoa wa Hubei, China.
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on January 24, 2020 among people returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 15 Machi 2020, visa vya COVID-19 vilikuwa vimegunduliwa katika mataifa yote 30 ya EU/EEA na Uingereza (UK), ambapo kati ya tarehe 31 Disemba 2019 pamoja na tarehe hiyo, visa 39,768 na vifo 1,727 vilikuwa vimeripotiwa, huku visa 17,750 na vifo 1,441 vikiwa Italia pekee.
en-mt: As of 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), with between 31 December 2019 plus that date, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths being in Italy alone.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Kupata jumla ya idadi na jumla ya matukio ya visa vya COVID-19
en-mt: Finding the total number and total incidence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: Katika kituo cha Kuzuia na Kudhibiti Ugonjwa ya Ulaya (ECDC), idadi iliyoarifiwa ya visa vya COVID-19 katika kila nchi duniani kote, iliyopatikana kutoka vyanzo vyovyote rasmi kama vile WHO, husasishwa kila siku saa 8:00 asubuhi.
en-mt: At the European Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC), the notified number of COVID-19 cases in each country around the world, obtained from any official sources such as WHO, is updated daily at 8:00 am.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Data hizi zilitumika kwa kutathmini masuala ya sasa ya COVID-19 katika EU/EEA na UK, kwa kuzilinganisha na za Italia.
en-mt: These data were used for assessing current COVID-19 issues in the EU/EEA and UK, by comparing them to those of Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Kama sehemu ya maambukizi ya visa vilivyopo vya COVID-19, tulipiga hesabu ya jumla ya matukio ya COVID-19 katika siku 14 zilizopunguzwa, hivyo kuzingatia chanzo asilia ya COVID-19, katika kila nchi ya EU/EEA na Uingereza, katika kipindi cha tarehe 1 Januari hadi 15 Machi 2020.
en-mt: As part of the transmission of existing COVID-19 cases, we calculated the total number of COVID-19 cases in the 14 days reduced, thus taking into account the original source of COVID-19, in each of the EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom, in the period from 1 January to 15 March 2020.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Pia tuliwasilisha idadi ya jumla ya visa vilivyoarifiwa vya kila nchi kufikia tarehe 15 Machi 2020 saa 8:00 asubuhi ikilinganishwa na ile ya nchi ya Italia kwa kipindi cha kuanzia tarehe 31 Januari–15 Machi 2020.
en-mt: We also presented the total number of reported cases of each country as of 15 March 2020 at 8:00 am compared to that of the Italian country for the period from 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Masuala ya sasa kuhusu COVID-19 katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza
en-mt: Current issues regarding COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Masuala ya sasa katika matukio ya visa vya COVID-19 katika siku 14 zilizopunguzwa katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza kwa jumla yalifuata yale ya Mkoa wa Hubei (China) (Picha ya 1).
en-mt: Current trends in the incidence of COVID-19 cases in the 14 days reduced in the EU/EEA countries and the UK overall followed those of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Kwa EU/EEA na Uingereza kijumla, jumla ya matukio ya COVID-19 yalianza kuongezeka mnamo tarehe 21 Februari na kuongezeka zaidi tarehe 28 Februari 2020 (Andiko la ziada).
en-mt: For the EU/EEA and the UK as a whole, the total number of COVID-19 cases began to rise on 21 February and rose further on 28 February 2020 (Additional Text).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Hii iliendeshwa zaidi na ongezeko la idadi ya visa vilivyoripotiwa kutoka nchini Italia, lakini kote katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza zilionyesha masuala swa ya ongezeko la matukio ya jumla ya COVID-19 (Andiko la ziada).
en-mt: This was mostly driven by the increase in the number of cases reported from Italy, but across the EU/EEA and UK countries showed issues of an increase in overall COVID-19 cases (Additional text).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Picha ya 2 inaonyesha jumla ya idadi ya visa vya COVID-19, katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza ikilinganishwa na ile ya Italia kwa kipindi cha tarehe 31 Januari-15 Machi 2020.
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the total number of COVID-19 cases, in the EU/EEA countries and the UK compared to that of Italy for the period 31 January-15 March 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Inaangazia kwamba, kufikia tarehe 15 Machi 8:00 asubuhi, nchi nyingine 15 za EU/EEA na Uingereza tayari ziliripoti idadi ya jumla ya visa inayoweza kulinganishwa na ile ya Italia katika muda wa wiki 3 awali au chini.
en-mt: It highlights that, as of 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of visas comparable to that of Italy in the previous 3 weeks or less.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Matokeo yetu yanaonyesha kwamba idadi ya visa vya COVID-19 vilivyoarifiwa inaongezeka pakubwa katika EU/EEA na Uingereza.
en-mt: Our results show that the number of COVID-19 cases notified is increasing significantly in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Masuala yaliyotazamwa katika jumla ya matukio ya COVID-19 yalipendekeza kwamba janga hili kubwa linaongezeka kwa kasi inayoweza kulinganisha katika nchi zote.
en-mt: The observed issues in the totality of COVID-19 events suggested that this major pandemic is growing at a comparable pace across countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Hii ni licha ya nchi tofauti kuwa katika viwango tofauti, tofauti katika jinsi kila afya ya umma inavyokabiliana na uwezekano wa ufafanuzi tofauti wa visa katika nchi na taratibu tofauti za kuchagua wagonjwa ambao ni lazima wapimwe kwa uthibitishaji wa COVID-19, ikiwa ni pamoja na upimaji wa watu.
en-mt: This is despite different countries being at different rates, differences in how each public health responds to the possibility of different definitions of cases across countries and different procedures for selecting patients who must be tested for COVID-19 verification, including testing of people.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Mapema Machi 2020, madaktari katika maeneo yaliyoathirika ya Italia walifafanua hali ambapo 10% ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 walihitaji tiba ya kina na vyanzo vya habari viliripoti kwamba hospitali na vitengo vya kushughulikia wagonjwa mahututi tayari vilikuwa vimejaa pomoni.
en-mt: In early March 2020, doctors in the affected areas of Italy described a situation where 10% of COVID-19 patients needed intensive therapy and informed sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units were already full of pomon.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Data kuhusu kulazwa kwa wagonjwa wa visa vya COVID-19 katika hospitali au kitengo cha kushughulikia wagonjwa mahututi kwa sasa zinapatikana kiwango cha EU/EEA kwa 6% na 1% ya visa mtawalia (data haijaonyeshwa).
en-mt: Data on hospitalizations of COVID-19 cases in hospitals or intensive care units are currently available at the EU/EEA rate at 6% and 1% of cases respectively (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Hata hivyo, zinapaswa kukusanywa kwa utaratibu maalum ili kutumika pamoja na data ya sasa ya uchunguzi inayoangazia idadi ya visa vilivyoripotiwa na idadi ya vifo.
en-mt: However, they should be compiled in a special order to be used alongside current diagnostic data that covers the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Utafiti uliofanywa 2010-11 ulionyesha tofauti kubwa katika upatikanaji wa vitanda vya matibabu ya hali mahututi na ya wastani barani Ulaya, kuanzia 29.2 nchini Ujerumani hadi vitanda 4.2 kwa kila idadi ya watu 100,000 nchini Ureno.
en-mt: A 2010-11 study showed significant differences in the availability of intensive and moderate treatment beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Hii inamaanisha kwamba nchi zinaweza kuwa na rasilimali chache au nyingi kuliko Italia (vitanda vya kulaza watu walio katika hali mahututi na matibabu ya wastani 12.5 kwa kila idadi 100,000 mwaka 2010-11).
en-mt: This means that countries may have fewer or more resources than Italy (intensive care beds and 12.5 average treatments per 100,000 population in 2010-11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Hali za kimuundo zinazohusiana na kulemewa kwa uwezo wa kushughulikia matibabu, kukiwa na makadirio ya kila nchi iliyo EU/EEA na Uingereza ya maambukizi watu walio na COVID-19 waliolazwa hospitalini wenye hatari ya > 90% ya kupita uwezo wa vitanda vilivyopo kushughulikia watu walio katika hali mahututi, umetolewa katika sasisho la sita la tathmini ya hatari ya haraka kuhusu COVID-19..
en-mt: Structural conditions related to overburdening the capacity to handle treatment, with estimates by each country in the EU/EEA and the United Kingdom of infection people with COVID-19 hospitalized with a 90% > risk of exceeding the capacity of existing beds to handle people in critical condition, have been released in the sixth update of the rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Kwa vile visa kwa sasa vimejumuishwa katika maeneo fulani katika nchi za EU/EEA na Uingereza, na hospitali na vitengo vya kushughulikia watu walio katika hali mahututi kikawaida huduma eneo la idadi maalum, taarifa kuhusu visa na vitanda vya kulazwa kwa watu walio katika hali mahututi inapaswa kupatikana katika vitengo vya kihimaya vya Kutoa majina kwa ajili ya takwimu ya kiwango cha 2 (NUTS-2).
en-mt: Since cases are currently included in certain areas in the EU/EEA and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units typically care in a specific population area, information about cases and beds for people in critical condition should be available in the Provisional Units for Level 2 (NUTS-2) statistics.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Hali iliyopo nchini Italia na masuala yanayoendelea sasa katika nchi nyingine yanaonyesha kwamba janga kubwa la COVID-19 linaongezeka kwa kasi katika EU/EEA na Uingereza.
en-mt: The prevailing situation in Italy and the issues currently underway in other countries indicate that the COVID-19 pandemic is rapidly accelerating in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Nchi, hospitali na vitengo vya kushughulikia wagonjwa mahututi hivyo vinapaswa kujiandaa kwa hali ya kuendelea kwa maenezi ya kijumuiya ya SARS-CoV-2 na ongezeko la idadi ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 wanaohitaji tiba na hasa matibatu ya watu walio katika hali mahututi, kama vile inayofanyika katika maeneo yaliyoathirika ya Italia.
en-mt: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should be prepared for the continued spread of SARS-CoV-2 and the increase in the number of COVID-19 patients in need of treatment and especially treatment of people in critical condition, such as that in the affected areas of Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Kama ilivyodokezwa katika tathmini ya hivi majuzi ya hatari ya kasi ya ECDC, mwelekeo wa haraka, unaohusisha watu na tondoti ni muhimu katika kuchelewesha kuenea kwa SARS-COV-2, kukiwa na mabadiliko kutoka mtazamo wa kiudhibiti hadi wa kukabiliana, kwa vile ongezeko linalotarajiwa la idadi ya visa huenda lisiwape wafanya maamuzi na hospitali muda wa kutosha kuelewa, kukubali na kuweka mikakati yao ya kukabiliana ipasavyo wasipotekeleza ipasavyo mapema.
en-mt: As pointed out in the recent ECDC accelerated risk assessment, fast-tracking, population-based and tondoti trends are critical in delaying the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a response perspective, as the expected increase in the number of cases may not give decision-makers and hospitals enough time to understand, accept and put their response strategies in place unless they implement them appropriately sooner.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Tathmini ya hatari ya haraka pia inaorodhesha hatua za afya ya umma ili kukabiliana na athari za janga kubwa.
en-mt: The Rapid Risk Assessment also lists public health measures to deal with the effects of a major pandemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Kuna nafasi ndogo ya fursa ambapo nchi zina uwezo wa kuongeza jitihada zao za udhibiti ili kupunguza kuenea kwa SARS-CoV-2 na kupunguza shinikizo kwenye matibabu.
en-mt: There is little room for opportunity where countries are able to step up their containment efforts to reduce the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reduce pressure on treatment.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Kukosa kufanya hivyo, kuna uwezekano wa mifumo ya tiba ya afya ya nchini nyingine za EU/EEA kukabiliwa na ongezeko la wagonjwa wanaohitaji tiba ya kina ndani ya siku au wiki zijazo.
en-mt: Failing to do so, it is likely that health treatment systems of other EU/EEA countries will face an increase in patients requiring intensive therapy within the coming days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Mkurupuko wa ugonjwa wa Virusi vya korona 2019 (COVID-19), unaosababishwa na matatizo mbaya ya pumu yaani severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), hivyo umewauwa zaidi ya watu 3,000 na kuwaambukiza zaidi ya 80,000 nchini China na kwigineko duniani, na kusababisha janga kwa binadamu.
en-mt: The 2019 COVID-19 outbreak, caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has killed more than 3,000 people and infected more than 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, causing a pandemic for humans.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Sawa na virusi vinavyofanana navyo, SARS-CoV, vilivyosababisha SARS miongoni mwa maelefu ya watu mwaka 2003, SARS-CoV-2 vinaweza pia kusambazwa kutoka kwa popo na kusababisha dalili sawa kupitia njia sawa.
en-mt: Similar to a similar virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS among thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 can also be transmitted from bats and cause similar symptoms through the same pathway.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Hata hivyo, COVID-19 ina hali ya chini ya ukali na viwango vya vifo kuliko SARS lakini uwezo mkubwa wa kupitishwa na kuambukiza watu wazee kuliko vijana na wanaume zaidi ya wanawake.
en-mt: However, COVID-19 has a lower severity and mortality rate than SARS but a greater ability to pass on and infect older people than younger people and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Katika kushughulikia hali ya ongezeko la idadi ya machapisho kuhusu ugonjwa huu unaoibuka, makala haya yanajaribu kutoa ukaguzi wa muda ufaao na tendeti wa mada hii ya utafiti inayokuwa kwa haraka.
en-mt: In addressing the growing number of publications about this emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and practical review of this rapidly evolving research topic.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Tutashughulikia masuala msingi kuhusu epidemiolojia, etiolojia, vairolojia, uchunguzi, matibabu, vyanzo vyake na uzuiaji wa ugonjwa.
en-mt: We will address fundamental issues regarding epidemiology, etiology, vairology, diagnostics, treatment, its sources and disease prevention.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Ingawa bado kuna maswali mengine yanayohitaji kujibiwa, tunatumai kuwa ukaguzi huu utasaidia katika kuelewa na kuondoa ugonjwa huu unaotisha.
en-mt: While there are still other questions that need to be answered, we hope that this review will help in understanding and eliminating this dreadful disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: Tamasha la Spring Festival mnamo tarehe 25 Januari 2020 limekuwa kumbukumbu ambalo halikutarajiwa lisiloweza kusahaulika kwa Wachina wote ambao walihimizwa kukaa nyumbani katika kipindi kizima cha likizo na kwa wiki nyingi baadaye kutokana na mkurupuko wa ugonjwa mpya unaoenezwa na virusi.
en-mt: The Spring Festival on 25 January 2020 has been an unforgettable memory for all Chinese who were encouraged to stay home throughout the holiday period and for many weeks afterwards due to a new outbreak of the virus.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Virusi hivyo vinafanana sana na virusi vya korona (CoV) vilivyosababisha mkurupuko wa matatizo mabaya ya pumu yaani sever acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) mwaka wa 2003; hivyo, Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni lilivipa jina SARS-CoV-2 mnamo tarehe 11, Februari 2020 na ugonjwa unaohusiana nao ulipewa jina la CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
en-mt: The virus is very similar to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused the outbreak of severe asthma (SARS) in 2003; Thus, the World Health Organization named SARS-CoV-2 on February 11, 2020 and the disease associated with it was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Janga hili kubwa lilianza kule Wuhani, China na kuenea haraka kote nchini na karibu nchi nyingine 50 kote ulimwenguni.
en-mt: The pandemic began in Wuhani, China and spread rapidly across the country and nearly 50 other countries around the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 2, Machi 2020, virusi hivi vimesababisha visa 80,000 vilivyothibitishwa vya COVID-19, huku zaidi ya wagonjwa 40,000 wakikubaliwa kurudi nyumbani na zaidi ya 3,000 waliaga dunia.
en-mt: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients admitted to home and more than 3,000 deaths.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: WHO inaonya kwamba COVID-19 ni “adui nambari 1 ya umma” na una uwezekano wa kuwa na nguvu zaidi ya ugaidi.
en-mt: The WHO warns that COVID-19 is "the public's number 1 enemy" and is likely to become more potent than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Kulingana na PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), katika muda wa chini ya miezi miwili, zaidi ya makala 200 yamechapishwa kuhusu COVID-19 ikiwa ni pamoja na vairolojia, epidemiolojia, etiolojia, uchunguzi na matibabu tangu ripoti ya kwanza tarehe 7 Januari, 2020 iliyobaini mfululizo wa utengani wa virusi kutoka kwa wagonjwa wengi.
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, more than 200 articles have been published about COVID-19 including vairology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnostics and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that identified a series of viral isolates from many patients.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Ukaguzi huu unajaribu kutoa muhtasari wa maendeleo ya utafiti katika eneo mada mpya inayokua kwa haraka.
en-mt: This review attempts to provide an overview of research developments in a rapidly growing new topic area.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Panapowezekana, tutajaribu kulinganisha COVID-19 na SARS na ugonjwa mwingine unaosababishwa na CoV, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, na mkurupuko mnamo 2012).
en-mt: Where possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 and SARS with another disease caused by CoV, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, with an outbreak in 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Pia, tutajadili mambo ambayo tumejifunza kufikia sasa kuhusiana na uzuiaji na chanzo cha ugonjwa pamoja na baadhi ya maswali ambayo bado hayajajibiwa.
en-mt: We will also discuss what we have learned so far in relation to prevention and the source of disease as well as some of the questions that remain unanswered.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: Virusi vya CoV kijadi vimezingatiwa kuwa virusi visivyo hatari kwa binadamu, ambavyo hasa husababisha takriban 15% ya mafua ya kawaida 4.
en-mt: CoV viruses have traditionally been considered to be a virus not harmful to humans, which mainly causes approximately 15% of the common influenza 4.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Hata hivyo, katika karne hii, tumekumbana na CoV vya binadamu vinavyosambazwa zaidi na virusi mara mbili, yaani, SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, ambavyo vilisababisha mkurupuko nchini China mwaka 2003 na Saudi Arabia mwaka 2012, mtawalia, na punde vikaenea haraka katika mataifa mengine mengi vikiwa na hali ya juu ya kuwa ugonjwa na viwango vya vifo.
en-mt: However, in this century, we have encountered human CoVs transmitted mostly by the double virus, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused outbreaks in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread rapidly to many other countries with high disease and mortality rates.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Kwa hivyo, mkurupuko wa sasa wa COVID-19 ndio mkurupuko wa tatu wa CoV katika historia iliyorekodiwa ya binadamu.
en-mt: Thus, the current COVID-19 outbreak is the third CoV outbreak in recorded human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Kama ilivyoonyeshwa kwenye ​Picha ya 1,1, mikusanyiko ya nimonia ambayo chimbuko lake halikujulikana iliripotiwa mara ya kwanza kutoka Wuhani tarehe 31 Disemba 2019 kwa Tume ya Kitaifa ya Afya nchini China.
en-mt: As shown in Figure 1,1, pneumonia collections whose origin was unknown were first reported from Wuhan on 31 December 2019 to the National Health Commission in China.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Siku saba baadaye, msururu wa CoV ulizinduliwa.
en-mt: Seven days later, the CoV series was launched.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Tarehe 15 Januari 2020, kisa cha kwanza kibaya zaidi kutoka Wuhani kiliripotiwa.
en-mt: On January 15, 2020, the first serious case from Wuhani was reported.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Kwa sasa, janga hili lilienea haraka katika miji, mikoa na nchi jirani.
en-mt: By now, the pandemic spread quickly to cities, regions and neighboring countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Tarehe 20 Januari, maambukizi miongoni mwa watoa huduma ya matibabu yaliripotiwa, na kuashiria kuwa maambukizi kutoka kwa binadamu hadi binadamu yaliwezekana.
en-mt: On January 20, infections among medical providers were reported, suggesting human-to-human transmission was possible.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Tarehe 23 Januari, shughuli za kawaida jiji Wuhani zilifungwa na usafiri wa umma kusitishwa.
en-mt: On January 23, normal operations in Wuhani were shut down and public transport halted.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Tarehe 24 Januari, utafiti wa kwanza wa kimatibabu kuhusu ugonjwa huu uliripotiwa, kati ya wagonjwa 41 waliokuwa na visa vilivyothibitishwa, 21 pekee ndio walikuwa wamegusana moja kwa moja na soko la vyakula vya baharini la Wuhan ambalo lilizingatiwa kuwa eneo ambapo maambukizi yalianza kutoka kwa chanzo cha mnyama asiyejulikana.
en-mt: On 24 January, the first medical study of the disease was reported, of the 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market which was considered the location where the infection began from an unknown animal source.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 30 Januari, WHO ilitangaza mkurupuko huu kuwa dharura la afya ya ulimwengu.
en-mt: On 30 January, the WHO declared this outbreak a global health emergency.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Kufikia wakati wa kuchapishwa kwa ripoti hii, ugonjwa huu tayari umeenea kote nchini China na karibu nchi nyingine 50 kote ulimwenguni (Picha. (Picha.2). 2).
en-mt: As of the time of the publication of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and nearly 50 other countries around the world (Photo. (2). 2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Kadri hali ikiendelea kua, upeo wa mwisho na hali ya athari ya mkurupuko huu bado haujabainiwa.
en-mt: As the situation continues to develop, the final scope and impact status of this outbreak remains undetermined.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Mmano tarehe 11 Februari 2020, utafiti wa vituo anuwai wa wagonjwa 8,866 wakiwemo 4,021 ambao walithibitishwa kuwa na COVID-19 uliwasilisha taswira iliyosasishwa zaidi ya janga hili kama ifuatavyo (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study of 8,866 patients including 4,021 who were confirmed to have COVID-19 presented the most updated picture of the pandemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: Virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 viliathiri watu wa umri wote, lakini wengi wa kati ya miaka 30-65.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV-2 virus affected people of all ages, but most of the 30-65 year old.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Takribani nusu (47.7%) ya watu walioambukizwa walikuwa na zaidi ya miaka 50, wachache walikuwa chini ya miaka 20 na watu 14 pekee ndio walikuwa na umri wa chini ya miaka 10.
en-mt: About half (47.7%) of those infected were over 50, a few were under 20 and only 14 were under 10.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 iliathiri wanaume wengi zaidi (0.31/100,000) kuliko (0.27/100,000).
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 affected more men (0.31/100,000) than (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 ilipanuka katika makundi hasa katika na karibu na Hubei.
en-mt: COVID-19 expanded into clusters mainly in and around Hubei.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 ilichukua idadi ya wastani ya siku 5 (siku 2-9) kutoka mwanzo mwa uchunguzi.
en-mt: COVID-19 took an average number of 5 days (2-9 days) from the beginning of the investigation.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Kipindi cha wastani cha kuatamia kwake kilikuwa siku 4.8 (3.0-7.2).
en-mt: His average period of parole was 4.8 days (3.0-7.2).

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Kipindi cha wastani cha kuanzia kwake hadi kifo kilikuwa siku 9.5 (4.8-13).
en-mt: The average period from his death was 9.5 days (4.8-13).

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Idadi msingi wa kizazi (R0) ilikuwa 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), na R0 iliyobadilishwa ilikuwa 2.23-4.82.
en-mt: The baseline number for generation (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Idadi ya watu walioambukizwa iliongezeka kabla ya tarehe 23 Januari 2020, ikilingana na muda wa usafiri wa watu wengi kabla ya Tamasha ya Spring Festival nchini China.
en-mt: The number of people infected increased before January 23, 2020, matching the mass transit time before the Spring Festival in China.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Kiwango cha vifo vya wagonjwa waliothibitishwa kuwa na visa kilikuwa 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), na kiwango kilichobadilishwa cha vifo vya wagonjwa kilikuwa 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
en-mt: The mortality rate of confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10–1.86%), and the adjusted inpatient mortality rate was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02–4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: Vigezo vitatu vikuu vya hatari ya COVID-19 vilikuwa ngono (mme), umri (≥60), na hali mbaya ya nimonia.
en-mt: The three main COVID-19 risk factors were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoV ni familia ndogo ya virusi vikubwa na vilivyofungamanishwa vilivyo na msururu mmoja wa RNA.
en-mt: CoV is a small family of large and tightly bound viruses containing a single RNA sequence.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: Vinaweza kugawanywa katika aina nne, yaani, alpha, beta, gamma na delta, ambapo aina za alpha- na beta za CoV zinafahamika kuambukiza binadamu.
en-mt: They can be divided into four types, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma and delta, where the alpha- and beta-coV strains are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: Mfungamano wa glycoprotini (S) unafunga vitambuzi vya seli zake vya angiotensini vinavyobadilisha enzaimu 2 (ACE2) na dipeptdyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) ya SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, mtawalia kisha muunganisho wa utando kutokea.
en-mt: The glycoprotein (S) chain binds its angiotensin cell receptors replacing the enzaimu 2 (ACE2) and dipeptdyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively then membrane connectivity occurring.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Jenomu ya RNA ya virusi inaachiliwa kwenye saitoplasimu; baada ya kuzalishwa kwa jenomu ya virusi, RNA ya kijenomu pamoja na glaikoprotoni zilizofungamanishwa na protini za nucleacapsidi kutengeneza vilengelenge vilivyo na virioni, ambavyo kisha vinaunganishwa na utando wa plasma ili kuachilia virusi.
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is released into the saxophone; After the production of the viral genome, the genomic RNA together with the glucoprotons attached to nucleacapsidi proteins to form the vitriolic-containing lazynegas, which are then attached to the plasma membrane to release the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Msururu wa kwanza wa kijenomu wa SARS-CoV-2 iliripotiwa tarehe 10 Januari 2020.
en-mt: The first genome sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on 10 January 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ilipatikana kuwa aina mpya ya beta-CoV yenye zaidi ya 99.98% ya utambulisho wa kijenetiki miongoni mwa sampuli 10 zilizofuatilizwa zilizokusanywa kutoka eneo asili la mkurupuko huu, soko la Huanan Seafood la Wuhani.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new strain of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 traceable samples collected from the original location of this outbreak, Wuhani's Huanan Seafood Market.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: Virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vinafanana zaidi na SARS-CoV kijenetiki kuliko MERS-CoV.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is more genetically similar to SARS-CoV than MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Kupitia uchunguzi wa usambazaji kielektroniki, vipande vya SARS-CoV-2 vilipatikana kwenye vijisehemu vyembamba zaidi vya njia ya hewa ya binadamu.
en-mt: Through electronic distribution testing, SARS-CoV-2 fragments were found in the narrowest segments of the human airway.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: Human ACE2 ilipatikana kuwa kitambuzi cha SARS-CoV-2 sawa na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Human ACE2 was found to be a SARS-CoV-2 antagonist similar to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hata hivyo, protini S ya SARS-CoV-2 inaunganisha kwenye human ACE2 kwa njia dhaifu zaidi kuliko SARS-CoV, jambo linaloambatana na ukweli kwamba virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 husabisha hali isiyo mbaya zaidi ya maambukizi kwa wagonjwa vikilinganishwa na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: However, the SARS-CoV-2 protein binds to human ACE2 in a much weaker way than SARS-CoV, which coincides with the fact that the SARS-CoV-2 virus causes a much less severe state of infection in patients compared to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 pia inaweza kuunda protini fupi mpya yenye msimbo orf3b na protini inayozalishwa yenye msimbo orf8.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a new short protein containing the code orf3b and a reproducible protein containing the code orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: Kiambajengo cha orf3b cha SARS-CoV-2 kinaweza kuchukua nafasi katika hali ya virusi kusababisha magojwa na kuzuia kujitokeza kwa IFNβ; hata hivyo, orf8 haina kikoa chochote kinachojulikana kinachofanya kazi.
en-mt: The orf3b compound of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in viral conditions causing convulsions and preventing the emergence of IFNβ; However, ORF8 does not have any known functional domain.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 18 Februari, 2020, Zhou na wenzake, waliripoti muundo wa cryo-EM wa urefu kamili wa human ACE2 kuwa ubainifu wa 2.9 Å kwa uchangamano na kisafirishi cha amino asidi B0AT1.
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Zhou and his colleagues, reported the cryo-EM structure of full-length human ACE2 to be a 2.9 Å specification for fusion with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Waligundua kwamba uchangamano huo, uliokuwa na pande wazi na funge za kuendana, ulikusanywa kama molekuli mbili na uchangamano wa ACE2-B0AT1 unaweza kuunganisha protini mbili za S, jambo linalotoa ushahidi wa utambuzi na maambukizi ya CoV.
en-mt: They found that the complexion, with open sides and matching binders, was assembled as two molecules and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex could link the two S proteins, a phenomenon that provides evidence for the identification and transmission of CoV.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 inaweza kuwa kilengwa ya kimatibabu kwa ajili ya uchunguzi wa dawa ya kudidimiza maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: B0AT1 may be a potential therapeutic target for drug testing to neutralize SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Chimbuka na mbebaji virusi wa kati
en-mt: Origin and intermediate virus carrier

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: Imekuwa ikifahamika kwamba SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV vina chimbuko kutoka kwa popo na vilisambazwa kwa binadamu kupitia paka ngawa na ngamia, mtawalia.
en-mt: It has been known that SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have origins from bats and were transmitted to humans through cats and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Kupitia mlinganisho wa kifilojenetiki wa SARS-CoV-2 na CoV vingine, popo walizingatiwa kuwa wabebaji wa SARS-CoV-2 kwani virusi hivi vinafanana kwa 96% na CoV vinavyofanana na SARS kutoka kwa popo vinavyoitwa bat-SL-CoVZX45 na SL-CoVZX21.
en-mt: Through the phytogenetic analogy of SARS-CoV-2 and other CoV, bats were considered carriers of SARS-CoV-2 as these viruses are 96% identical to SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and SL-CoVZX21.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Hata hivyo, mbebaji wa kati aliyesaidia virusi hivi kuhamia kwa binadamu kutoka kwa kizuizi cha aina hiyo ya mnyama bado hajulikani na njia ya usambazaji wake bado haijapambanuliwa.
en-mt: However, the intermediate carrier that helped this virus migrate to humans from a block of that type of animal remains unknown and the route of its transmission has yet to be determined.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji na wenzake, walipendekeza nyoka kuwa wabebaji virusi kutoka kwa popo hadi kwa binadamu jambo lililohusisha ujumuishaji tena unaofanana ndani ya protini ya S.
en-mt: Ji and his colleagues, suggested snakes being carriers of viruses from bats to humans that involved a corresponding re-integration within the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa utafiti fulani, watafiti walio Guangzhou, China, walipendekeza kwamba kakakuona mwenye pua refu, wanyama wanaokula mchwa ambao wametumika kijadi kama dawa ya Kichina - wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kubeba virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 kulingana na 99% ya homojia ya kijenetiki katika CoV vilivyogunduliwa ndani ya kakakuona na SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: According to a study, researchers based in Guangzhou, China, suggested that long-nosed kakaona — ants that have traditionally been used as Chinese medicine — are more likely to carry SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% of the genetic homogenous in CoV detected within the kakaona and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Hata hivyo utofauti wa maenezi wa 1% miongoni mwa jenomu mbili bado ni tofauti kubwa; hivyo, matokeo kamilifu kwa ajili ya ushahidi thabiti bado yanasubiriwa (Picha. (Picha 33).
en-mt: Yet the 1% propagation difference between the two genomes is still a significant difference; thus, a perfect outcome for solid evidence is still pending (Picture. (Photo 33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Sifa za kifisio-kemia za SARS-CoV-2 bado hazijulikani pakubwa.
en-mt: The physiological properties of SARS-CoV-2 are still largely unknown.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV vinaweza kua ndani ya tubu za vipimo kwa saa 48 katika mazingira pakavu na hadi siku 5 chini ya nyuzi 20 °C na 40%-50% za hali ya unyevunyevu.
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can be contained in test tubes for 48 hours in dry environments and up to 5 days below 20°C and 40%-50% of humidity conditions.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 inaweza kuwa na sifa sawa.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar characteristics.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: Imeripotiwa kwamba SARS-CoV-2 huathirika pakubwa na miale ya utraviolet na nyuzi joto ya 56 °C kwa dakika 30; ether, 75% ya ethanol, kisafishaji kilicho na klorini, asidi ya peracetic, chloroform na vimumunyisho vingine vya mafuta, lakini sio chlorhexidine, vinaweza kulemaza virusi hivi kwa ufanisi.
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is highly susceptible to utraviolet rays and temperatures of 56°C for 30 minutes; Ether, 75% ethanol, a purifier containing chlorine, peracetic acid, chloroform and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively neutralize this virus.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Binadamu wote kwa ujumla hawana kinga mwilini dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2 na hivyo wamo hatarini kupata virusi hivi vipya.
en-mt: All humans are generally immune to SARS-CoV-2 and are therefore vulnerable to the new virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kwa sasa, hakuna utafiti wa kina ambao umeripoti kuhusiana na makabiliano ya kinga ya mwili dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: At present, no comprehensive study has been reported in relation to antibody response to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Kwa hivyo, tunaweza tu kurejelea tafiti za awali kuhusu CoV vingine, haswa SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV (Picha. ​(Picha ya.4).4).
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to previous studies about other CoV, specifically SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (pictured. (Photo of 4.4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Kwa ujumla, baada ya virusi kumvamia anayevibeba, kwanza vinatambuliwa na mfumo wa kinga ya mwili usiohai wa anayevibeba kupitia vipokezi vya kutambua ruwaza (PRR) ikiwa ni pamoja na vitambuzi vya C-type vya aina ya lectin, vitambuzi vya aina ya Toll (TLR), vitambuzi aina ya NOD (NLR), na vitambuzi vya aina ya RIG-I (RLR).
en-mt: Generally, after the virus invades the carrier, they are first identified by the non-living immune system of the carrier through patterns recognition (PRR) receptors including lectin-type C-type identifiers, Toll-type (TLR) identifiers, NOD type identifiers (NLR), and RIG-I type (RL) identifiers.

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Kupitia njia tofauti, virusi vinasababisha kuwepo kwa elementi zinazosababisha kuchomeka kwa tishu, kukomaa kwa seli za dendraiti na kuzalishwa kwa protini aina ya I interferons (IFNs) ambayo hudhibiti kuenea kwa virusi na kuharakisha kuzalishwa kwa protini zinazopigana na virusi.
en-mt: Through different mechanisms, the virus leads to the presence of elements that lead to tissue burning, the maturation of dendraitic cells and the production of type I interferons (IFNs) proteins that control viral spread and accelerate the production of virus-fighting proteins.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Hata hivyo, protini ya N ya SARS-CoV inaweza kusaidia virusi kukwepa makali ya kinga ya mwili.
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus evade the body's immune response.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Baada ya muda mfupi, kinga ya mwili inajiunga katika kupambana na virusi.
en-mt: Soon after, the body's immune system joins in fighting the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: Seli nyeupe za damu za aina ya T ikiwa ni pamoja na CD4+ na CD8+ seli aina ya T zinaweza kuwa na jukumu muhimu katika kukinga mwili.
en-mt: White blood cells of type T including CD4+ and CD8+ type T cells can play an important role in shielding the body.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: Seli za T za aina ya CD4+ huchochea seli za B kuzalisha antibodi zinazokabiliana na virusi mahususi na seli aina ya T za CD8+ huuwa seli zilizoathirika na virusi moja kwa moja.
en-mt: CD4+ type T cells stimulate B cells to produce antibodies that respond to specific viruses and CD8+ T cells kill virus-affected cells directly.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Seli za T helper huzalisha molekuli za saitokini zinazosaidia hali ya kuchomeka ili kusaidia kulinda seli.
en-mt: T helper cells produce saturation molecules that support the insertion state to help protect cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Hata hivyo, CoV huweza kuzuia utendakazi wa seli za T kwa kusababisha kuuawa kwa seli za T.
en-mt: However, CoV can inhibit the functioning of T cells by causing the killing of T cells.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Kinga mwilini mwa binadamu ikiwa ni pamoja na viziada kama vile C3a na C5a na antibodi mbalimbali pia ni muhimu katika kukabiliana na maambukizi ya virusi.
en-mt: Human antibodies including complements such as C3a and C5a and various antibodies, are also important in dealing with viral infections.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa mfano, antibodi zilizotolewa kwa mgonjwa aliyepona ziliangamiza MERS-CoV.
en-mt: For example, antibodies given to a recovered patient destroyed MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, kinga ya mwili inapozalisha antibodi kupita kiasi inaweza kusababisha madhara mabaya ya mapafu na viungo vingine, na katika hali mbaya zaidi, viungo vingi kukosa kufanya kazi na hata kifo.
en-mt: On the other hand, when the immune system produces excessive antibody can cause serious lung and other organ damage, and in the most extreme cases, many organs malfunction and even death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2, yaliyoangaziwa mwanzo yana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuathiri watu wazee walio na magonjwa mengine na wanawake wajawazito.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infections, initially highlighted are more likely to affect older people with other illnesses and pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Ni jambo la kawaida kwamba kwa watu waliomo katika hatari ya kupata idadi kubwa ya virusi au ambao kinga zao za mwili ni dhaifu, wana nafasi kubwa zaidi ya kuambukizwa na wengine.
en-mt: It's common sense that for people who are at risk of developing large numbers of viruses or whose immune systems are weak, they have a higher chance of being infected by others.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Kipindi cha wastani kilichokadiriwa cha kuatamia kwa SARS-CoV-2 ni siku 1-14, mara nyingi siku 3-7 kulingana na utafiti wa visa 425 vya kwanza kule Wuhani.
en-mt: The estimated median period of exposure to SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, often 3-7 days according to a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Hata hivyo, uchunguzi kwenye visa 1,099 unaonyesha kwamba kipindi cha kuatamia kwake kilikuwa siku 3 kwa wastani na kilikuwa kati siku 0 hadi 24.
en-mt: However, a survey of 1,099 cases shows that the period of his parole was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa hivi punde zaidi kama ilivyofafanuliwa hapa juu unaonyesha kwamba kipindi cha kuatamia kilikuwa siku 4.8 (3.0-7.2) kulingana na demografia ya visa 8,866.
en-mt: The latest analysis as detailed above shows that the duration period was 4.8 days (3.0-7.2) based on a demography of 8,866 cases.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Ni muhimu kwa mamlaka ya afya kurekebisha muda faafu wa karantini kulingana na kipindi sawa zaidi cha kuatamia, hivyo kuzuia watu walioambukizwa wasioonyesha dalili kusambaza virusi kwa wengine.
en-mt: It is important for health authorities to adjust the appropriate quarantine time to the same time frame, thus preventing infected people who show no symptoms from spreading the virus to others.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Kama kitendo cha kawaida, watu waliomo hatarini au walioambukizwa na virusi kwa kawaida wanahitajika kuwa kwenye karantini kwa siku 14.
en-mt: As a normal practice, people who are vulnerable or infected with the virus are usually required to be in quarantine for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Je, muda wa karantini unapaswa kuongezwa hadi siku 24?
en-mt: Should the quarantine period be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Joto jingi mwilini ndiyo dalili kuu na mara nyingi ya awali ya COVID-19, ambayo inaweza kufuatwa na kutokuwepo kwa dalili au dalili nyinginezo kama vile kikohozi kikavu, ugumu wa kupumua, maumivu ya misuli, kisunzi, kuumwa na kichwa, kuwashwa na koo, mafua, maumivu ya kifua, kuendesha, kifechuchefu na kutapika.
en-mt: High temperatures in the body are the main and most common initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be followed by a lack of symptoms or other symptoms such as dry cough, difficulty breathing, muscle aches, soreness, headaches, sore throat, fever, chest pain, driving, vomiting and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Baadhi ya wagonjwa walikuwa na ugumu wa kupumua na/au kiwango cha chini cha hewa safi mwilini mwanzoni mwa ugonjwa.
en-mt: Some patients had difficulty breathing and/or low levels of fresh air in the body at the onset of the disease.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Katika hali mbaya zaidi, wagonjwa waliendelea kuwa na matatizo mabaya ya kupumua, hali inayosababisha viungo vya mwili kutofanya kazi, asidi nyingi mno mwilini na hali ya damu kushindwa kuganda.
en-mt: In the worst-case scenario, patients continued to have severe breathing problems, resulting in malfunctioning organs, too much acid in the body and blood clots.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Wagonjwa walio na homa na/au dalili za pumu na homa kali, hata bila matatizo ya njia za kupumua wanapaswa kuchunguzwa kwa virusi katika uchunguzi wa mapema.
en-mt: Patients with fever and/or symptoms of asthma and high fever, even without respiratory tract problems should be screened for the virus in early screening.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa kidemografia mwishoni mwa Disemba 2019 ulionyesha asilimia ya dalili zilikuwa 98% kwa homa, 76% kwa kikohozi kikavu, 55% kwa ugumu wa kupumua na 3% kwa kuendesha; 8% ya wagonjwa waliohitaji msaada wa mashine za kupumua.
en-mt: A demographic survey in late December 2019 showed the percentage of symptoms was 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for difficulty breathing and 3% for driving; 8% of patients needed ventilators.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Matokeo sawa na hayo yaliripotiwa katika tafiti mbili za hivi majuzi za sampuli ya familia na sampuli iliyosababisha na mtu ambaye hakuonyesha dalili za ugonjwa.
en-mt: Similar results were reported in two recent studies of a family sample and a sample led by a person who showed no signs of illness.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Kiulinganifu, utafiti kwa kidemografia mwaka 2012 ulionyesha kwamba wagonjwa wa MERS-CoV pia walikuwa na homa (98%), kikohozi kikavu (47%) na ugumu wa kupumua (55%) kama dalili zao kuu.
en-mt: In contrast, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%) and difficulty breathing (55%) as their main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Hata hivyo, 80% yao walihitaji mashine za kusaidia kupumua, kuliko wagonjwa wa COVID-19 na hii inaoana na hali ya ukali wa MERS kuliko COVID-19.
en-mt: However, 80% of them needed ventilators, rather than COVID-19 patients and this is more in line with the severity of MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Kuendesha (26%) na koo kuuma (21%) pia kulionekana miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa MERS.
en-mt: Running (26%) and throat soreness (21%) were also seen among MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Kwa wagonjwa wa SARS, imebainika kwamba joto jingi mwilini (99%-100%), kikohozi kikavu (29%-75%), ugumu wa kupumua (40%-42%), kuendesha (20-25%) na koo kuuma (13-25%) zilikuwa dalili kuu na mashine za kusaidia kupumua zilihitajika kwa 14%-20% ya wagonjwa.
en-mt: For SARS patients, it has been found that high body temperature (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), difficulty breathing (40%-42%), running (20-25%) and sore throat (13-25%) were the main symptoms and breathing aids were needed in 14%-20% of patients.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 14 Februari, kiwango cha vifo kutokana na COVID-19 kilikuwa 2% wakati visa vilivyothibitisha vilifika 66,576 kote ulimwenguni.
en-mt: As of February 14, the death rate from COVID-19 was 2% as confirmed cases reached 66,576 worldwide.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Ikilinganishwa, viwango vya vifo kutokana na SARS kufikia Novemba 2002 kilikuwa 10% ya visa 8,096 vilivyothibitishwa.
en-mt: Compared, death rates from SARS as of November 2002 were 10% of the 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: Kwa MERS, kulingana na utafiti wa kidemografia mnamo mwezi Juni 2012, viwango vya vifo vilikuwa 37% kati ya visa 2,494 vilivyothibitishwa.
en-mt: For MERS, according to a demographic survey in June 2012, mortality rates were 37% out of 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: Utafiti wa hapo awali uliripoti kuwa R0 ya SARS-CoV-2 ilikuwa juu kwa kiwango cha 6.47 kwa kiwango cha 95% kiwango cha usahihi (CI) cha 5.71-7.23, ambapo R0 ya SARS-CoV ilikuwa kwa masafa ya 2 hadi 4 pekee.
en-mt: Previous studies reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was higher at a rate of 6.47 to a 95% accuracy rate (CI) of 5.71–7.23, whereas R0 of SARS-CoV was at only 2 to 4 frequencies.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: Ulinganisho wa SARS-CoV-2 na MERS-CoV na SARA-CoV kuhusiana na dalili zao, viwango vya kifo na R0 umeonyeshwa kwenye Jedwali ​Jedwali la 1.1.
en-mt: Comparisons of SARS-CoV-2 and MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV with respect to their symptoms, death rates and R0 are shown in Table Table 1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: Takwimu zilizo hapa juu zinaonyesha kwamba SARS-CoV-2 vina uwez wa juu zaidi kuenea kulika MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV lakini makali yake ni ya chini kuliko hivo vingine viwili.
en-mt: The data above shows that SARS-CoV-2 has the highest prevalence of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV but its intensity is lower than the other two.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa hivyo kuna changamoto kubwa ya kudhibiti janga kubwa la SARS-CoV-2 kuliko za kudhibiti MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: So there is a greater challenge of controlling a larger SARS-CoV-2 epidemic than of controlling MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Inapozuka mwanzo, mara nyingi hufanyika katika familia sawa au kutoka kwa mkusanyiko au gari sawa kama vile meli.
en-mt: When it breaks out at the beginning, it often happens in the same family or from a similar collection or vehicle such as a ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Wagonjwa mara nyingi wana historia ya kusafiri au kuishi mjini Wuhani au maeneo mengine yaliyoathirika au kugusana na watu au wagonjwa walioathirika katika wiki mbili zilizopita kabla ya kuanza.
en-mt: Patients often have a history of traveling or living in Wuhani or other affected areas or contact with affected people or patients in the last two weeks before they started.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Hata hivyo, imeripotiwa kwamba watu wanaweza kubeba virusi hivi bila dalili kwa muda zaidi ya wiki mbili na wagonjwa waliopona walioruhusiwa kurudi nyumbani wanaweza kubeba virusi hivi tena, jambo linalotoa tahadhari la kuongezwa kwa muda wa karantini.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms for more than two weeks and recovered patients discharged home can carry the virus again, prompting an extension of quarantine.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Wagonjwa wana idadi ya kawaida au iliyopungua ya seli nyeupe za damu za pembeni (hasa lymphocytes) katika awamu ya awali.
en-mt: Patients have normal or decreased numbers of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) in the initial phase.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kwa mfano, hali ya upungufu wa seli nyeupe za damu < 4×109/L ikiwa ni pamoja na idadi ya lymphocyte < 1×109/L na viwango vilivyoogezwa vya aspartate aminotransferase na viremia vilipatikana kwa wagonjwa 1,099 wa COVID-19.
