sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: Wagonjwa wa COVID-19 wanasambaza virusi hata wakati hawaonyeshi dalili zozote huku wagonjwa wa SARS wakiwa wanafanya hivyo wakiwa katika hali mbaya sana, jambo linalosababisha ugumu zaidi wa kudhibiti kuenea kwa COVID-19 kuliko SARS.
en-mt: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they show no symptoms while SARS patients are doing so in a very serious condition, which makes it more difficult to control the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hii inaeleza kwa upande ni kwa nini SARS-CoV-2 huenea kwa haraka na katika eneo pana zaidi kuliko SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This explains in turn why SARS-CoV-2 spreads faster and across a wider area than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Jaribio la kawaida la RNA ya SARS-CoV-2 linaweza kutokea hasi kwa baadhi ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19.
en-mt: A routine RNA test for SARS-CoV-2 may turn up negative in some COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, wagonjwa waliotibiwa wanaweza kupatikana na virusi hivi tena.
en-mt: On the other hand, treated patients may be exposed to this virus again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: Matokeo haya yanaongeza pakubwa hatari ya kuenea kwa virusi.
en-mt: These findings significantly increase the risk of viral spread.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: Kutokana na kuendelea kwa kasi kwa utafiti kuhusu COVID-19, masuala mengi muhimu bado hayajatatuliwa, kama ifuatavyo:
en-mt: Due to the continued pace of research on COVID-19, many important issues remain unresolved, as follows:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: Virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vilitoka wapi?
en-mt: Where did the SARS-CoV-2 virus come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: Ingawa mfanano wa kijenetiki wa 96% ulipatikana kati ya SARS-CoV-2 na CoV mbili vya SARS vinavyotokana na popo, bado hatuwezi kuhitimisha kwamba SARS-CoV-2 vinatokana na popo.
en-mt: Although 96% genetic similarities were found between SARS-CoV-2 and two SARS CoVs derived from bats, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 originates from bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: Ni mnyama yupi alikuwa wa kati kuvibeba na kusambaza virusi kutoka kwa mbebaji virusi asilia, kwa mfano kutoka kwa popo hadi kwa binadamu?
en-mt: Which animal was the medium to carry and transmit the virus from the original virus carrier, for example from bats to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: Bila kufahamu majibu ya maswali ya #1 na 2, hatuwezi kukatisha usambazaji kwa ufanisi na mkurupuko huu unaweza kutokea tena wakati wowote.
en-mt: Without knowing the answers to questions #1 and 2, we cannot effectively cancel distributions and this outbreak could occur again at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: Ingawa miundo ya kimolekuli na majaribio ya kibayokemia yameonyesha kwamba SARS-CoV-2 hunata na kuwa ACE2, ni vipoi haswa virusi hivi huingia kwenye seli za njia ya kupumua na kusababisha mabadiliko yanayofuata ya kipatholojia?
en-mt: Although molecular structures and biochemical experiments have shown that SARS-CoV-2 sticks to ACE2, is it exactly how this virus enters the cells of the respiratory tract and causes the next pathological changes?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: Je, virusi hivi pia vinaunganisha seli zinazoonyesha ACE2- katika viungo vingine?
en-mt: Do these viruses also synthesize cells expressing ACE2- in other organs?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: Bila majibu bayana kwa maswali haya, hatuwezi kuafikia upimaji haraka na sahihi na matibabu faafu.
en-mt: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve rapid and accurate testing and appropriate treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: Je, janga hili litadumu kwa muda gani?
en-mt: How long will this pandemic last?

sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: Je, virusi hivi vinakua vipi kijenetiki kwa wakati wa kusambazwa kutoka kwa binadamu?
en-mt: How does this virus grow genetically in time to be transmitted from humans?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: Je, utakuwa janga la ulimwenguni kote, utakufa kama SARS au kutokea tena muda baada ya muda kama vile mafua?
en-mt: Will it be a worldwide pandemic, will it die like SARS or reappear time after time like influenza?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: Ni muhimu lakini unaweza kuchukua muda kutafuta majibu ya maswali yaliyo hapa juu na maswali mengine mengi.
en-mt: It's important but you can take the time to look for answers to the questions above and many other questions.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: Hata hivyo, licha ya gharama yake, hatuna budi ila kukomesha janga hili haraka iwezekanavyo na kurejesha maisha katika hali ya kawaida.
en-mt: However, despite its cost, we have no choice but to put an end to this pandemic as soon as possible and bring life back to normal.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: Asili ya magonjwa ya wanyama ya virusi vya korona vya binadamu
en-mt: Origin of animal diseases of human coronaviruses

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: Mabadiliko ya mwili na hali za kukabiliana na mazingira zimechangia kukua kwa virusi vya korona (CoVs) na wabebaji wake, ikiwa ni pamoja na binadamu kwa maelfu ya miaka.
en-mt: Physical changes and adaptive conditions have contributed to the growth of the novel coronavirus (CoVs) and its carriers, including humans for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: Kabla ya 2003, virusi viwili vya CoVs (HCoVs) vya binadamu vilijulikana kusababisha ugonjwa usio kali, kama vile homa ya kawaida.
en-mt: Prior to 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) viruses were known to cause less severe illness, such as the common cold.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: Mikurupuko ya ugojwa wa sindromu mbaya kali ya kupumua (SARS) na sindromu ya kupumua ya Mashariki ya Kati (MERS) imebadilisha mambo na kudhihirisha jinsi maambukizi ya HCoV yanaweza kuwa hatari na kutishia maisha.
en-mt: Outbreaks of severe acute respiratory sindrium (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have changed things and demonstrated how dangerous and life-threatening HCoV infections can be.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kuibuka kwa SARS-CoV-2 katika China ya kati mwishoni mwa 2019 kumevifanya virusi vya CoVs kuangaziwa kwa mara nyingine na kutushangaza kwa uwezekano wake wa juu wa kuenezwa lakini vikapunguza hali ya kusababisha ugonjwa ikilinganishwa na virusi vinavyofanana nayo vya SARS-CoV.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has made the CoVs the spotlight once again and surprised us with its high susceptibility to transmissible but reduced pathogenic susceptibility compared to a similar SARS-CoV virus.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: Maambukizi ya HCoV yanatokana na wanyama na kuelewa asili ya maambukizi ya HCoV kutoka kwa wanyama kunaweza kutusaidia.
en-mt: HCoV infection originates from animals and understanding the nature of HCoV transmission from animals can help us.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: Virusi vingi vya HCoV vilitoka kwa popo ambapo havikuwa na uwezo wa kusababisha ugonjwa.
en-mt: Most HCoV viruses came from bats where they were not capable of causing disease.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: Wabebaji wa kati wa baadhi ya HCoV pia wanajulikana.
en-mt: The intermediate carriers of some HCoV are also known.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: Kutambua mnyama mbebaji kunahusishwa moja kwa moja katika kuzuia magonjwa ya binadamu.
en-mt: Identifying a carrier animal is directly linked to the prevention of human diseases.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: Kuchunguza miingiliano ya mbebaji wa CoV kwa wanyama pia kunaweza kusaidia sana kupata utambuzi muhimu kuhusu uwezo wa CoV kusababisha ugonjwa miongoni mwa binadamu.
en-mt: Investigating the interactions of the CoV carrier in animals can also be very helpful in obtaining important insights about the ability of CoV to cause disease among humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Katika ukaguzi huu, tunawasilisha muhtasari wa ujuzi uliopo kuhusu aina saba za HCoV, kwa kuangazia historia ya kugunduliwa kwake pamoja na chanzo chake kwenye wanyama na kuenezwa kwake kutoka kwa aina moja ya mnyama hadi nyingine.
en-mt: In this review, we present an overview of the available knowledge about the seven species of HCoV, focusing on the history of its detection as well as its origin in animals and its transmission from one animal species to another.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: Muhimu sana, tunalinganisha na kutofautisha aina tofauti za HCoV kwa mtazamo wa ugeukaji wa virusi na kujumuishwa tena kwa jinomu.
en-mt: Very importantly, we compare and contrast different types of HCoV in view of viral turnaround and reintegration of the genome.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
targetString: Ugonjwa wa sasa wa janga la CoV 2019 (COVID-19) umejadiliwa katika muktadha huu.
en-mt: The current epidemic of CoV 2019 (COVID-19) has been discussed in this context.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: Pia, mahitaji ya kufanikiwa kwa kubadilika kwa mbebaji na athari ya ukuaji wa virusi kwa uzito wa ugonjwa pia yameangaziwa.
en-mt: Also, the requirements for successful carrier flexibility and the effect of viral growth on disease weight have also been highlighted.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: Virusi vya korona (CoV) vinatokana na familia ya Coronaviridae, inayojumuisha kikundi cha virusi vilivyofungamanishwa, vilivyo na hisi chanya na RNA ya namna moja.
en-mt: The CoV virus is derived from the family Coronaviridae, consisting of a group of paired, positive viruses with single-stranded RNA.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: Virusi hivi vilivyo na jinomu kubwa zaidi ya kilobesi 26 hadi 32 miongoni mwa virusi vya RNA viliitwa “CoVs” kutokana na umbo lao kama la taji chini ya uchunguzi wa kielektroniki.
en-mt: These viruses with larger genomes than 26 to 32 kilobases among RNA viruses were called "CoVs" due to their crown-like shape under electronic surveillance.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: Kimuundo, virusi vya CoV vina jenomu ambazo hazina vijisehemu vilivyo na mpangilio sawa.
en-mt: Structurally, CoV viruses have genomes that do not contain the same sequences.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: Takriban thuluthi mbili za jinomu zina fremu mbili kubwa zinazolandana zilizo wazi (ORF1a na ORF1b), zinazobadilika na kuwa protini ya namna ya pp1a na pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
en-mt: About two-thirds of the genome consists of two large parallel open frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), converting into pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: Poliprotini huchakatwa zaidi ili kuzalisha protini 16 zisizo za kimuundo, zilizosanifiwa kama nsp1~16.
en-mt: Poliproteins are further processed to produce 16 non-structural proteins, coded as nsp1~16.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: Sehemu iliyosalia ya jinomu ina ORF za protini za kimuundo, ikiwa ni pamoja na spike (S), envelope (E), membreni (M) na nukleoprotini (N).
en-mt: The remainder of the genome contains ORFs of structural proteins, including spike (S), elasticity (E), membrane (M) and nucleus (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: Idadi fulani ya protini zilizo mahususi kikizazi zimesimbwa na vizazi tofauti vya CoV.
en-mt: A certain number of genetically specific proteins are encoded by different generations of CoV.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: Kulingana na tofauti katika misururu ya protini, Virusi vya CoV vinmeainishwa katika aina nne (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV na delta-CoV), kati yavyo, aina ya beta-CoV genera huwa na virusi vya HCoV vingi zaidi na imegawanya katika vizazi vinne (A, B, C na D).
en-mt: Based on differences in protein sequences, CoV viruses are classified into four types (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which, the beta-CoV genera species contain the most HCoV viruses and are divided into four generations (A, B, C and D).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: Ushahidi wa kifilogenetiki umeonyesha kwamba popo na wanyama wagugunaji hutumika kama vyanzo vya jeni ya alpha-CoV na beta-CoV nyingi, huku ndege wakiwa ndio wahifadhi wakuu wa gamma-CoV na delta-CoV.
en-mt: Physiological evidence has shown that bats and mammals serve as sources of the alpha-CoV gene and most beta-CoV, with birds being the main reservoirs of gamma-CoV and delta-CoV.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
targetString: Kwa maelfu ya miaka, virusi vya CoV vimeendelea kupita vizuizi vya aina ya wanyama na vingine vimeibuka kuwa visababisha vikuu vya magonjw vya wanadamu.
en-mt: For thousands of years, CoV viruses have progressed past the barriers of animal species and have emerged as the main cause of human swarms.

sourceString: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
targetString: Hadi leo, kuna aina saba za virusi vya CoV (HCoV) vya binadamu vinavyojulikana.
en-mt: To date, there are seven types of human CoV virus (HCoV) known.

sourceString: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
targetString: Miongoni mwao HCoV-229E na HCoV-NL63 ni alpha-CoV.
en-mt: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoV.

sourceString: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Aina nyingine tano za beta-CoV ni pamoja na HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, virusi vya korona (SARS-CoV) vya sindromu hatari kali ya kupumua, Virusi vya korona vya sindromu ya kupumua vya Mashariki ya Kati (MERS-CoV) na SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The other five types of beta-CoV include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, coronavirus (SARS-CoV) of the high-risk respiratory syndrome, Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
targetString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 na HCoV-NL63 mara nyingi husababisha dalili za kiasi, kama vile homa ya kawaida na/au kuendesha.
en-mt: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 often cause mild symptoms, such as a common cold and/or drive.

sourceString: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
targetString: Kinyume chake, virusi vya SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV na vilivyotambuliwa vipya vya SARS-CoV-2 ni viini vilivyo na uwezo mkubwa wa kusababisha ugonjwa, vinavyosababisha mambukizi mabaya katika njia ya chini ya kupumua kwa wagonjwa zaidi walio na uwezekano mkubwa wa kupata ugonjwa wa sindromu ya matatizo kali ya kupumua (ARDS) na matatizo yasiyo ya nje ya mapafu.
en-mt: Conversely, the SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and newly identified SARS-CoV-2 viruses are germs with a high potential to cause disease, causing serious infections in the lower respiratory tract in more patients more likely to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and non-extra-acute lung problems.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
targetString: Aina ya kwanza ya HCoV-229E, B814, ilitolewa kutoka kwa majimaji yatokayo puani za wagonjwa waliokuwa na homa ya kawaida katikati ya miaka ya 1960.
en-mt: The first type of HCoV-229E, B814, was extracted from fluids coming from the noses of patients with the common cold in the mid-1960s.

sourceString: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
targetString: Tangu wakati huo, maarifa zaidi yalikusanywa kupitia utafiti wa kina kuhusu virusi vya HCoV-229E na HCoV-OC43, vyote vikiwa ambavyo husababisha dalili za udhaifu wa kibinafsi.
en-mt: Since then, more knowledge was gathered through extensive research on the HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 viruses, both of which cause symptoms of personal weakness.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Hakika, dhana hiyo ilikuwa imekubalika miongoni mwa wengi kwamba maambukizi ya HCoV kijumla hayana madhara hadi mkurupuko wa SARS ulipotokea.
en-mt: Indeed, the concept had been accepted among many that HCoV infection was generally harmless until the SARS outbreak occurred.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: Mkurupuko wa SARS uliotokea 2003 ni moja ya mikurupuko mbaya zaidi katika historia ya sasa, ukiambukiza zaidi ya watu 8,000 ukiwa na kiwango kibaya cha vifo kwa takriban 10%.
en-mt: The 2003 SARS outbreak is one of the worst outbreaks in modern history, infecting more than 8,000 people with a fatality rate of approximately 10%.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: Miaka kumi baadaye, mkurupuko wa virusi vya sindromu ya kupumua ya Mashariki ya Kati (MERS) ulisababisha janga lililoendelea katika Peninsula ya Kiarabu huku vikienea sehemu nyingine ulimwenguni.
en-mt: Ten years later, an outbreak of Middle East respiratory syndrome virus (MERS) caused a pandemic that developed in the Arab Peninsula as it spread elsewhere in the world.

sourceString: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
targetString: Virusi vipya vya 2019 vya HCoV (2019-nCoV), ambavyo baadaye vilipewa jina SARS-CoV-2, ndivyo ajenti sababishi wa janga linaloendelea la ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona 2019 (COVID-19), ambalo limewauwa zaidi ya watu 3,120 na kuwaambukiza zaidi ya watu 91,000 kufikia tarehe 3 mwezi Machi 2020.
en-mt: The new 2019 HCoV virus (2019-nCoV), later renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the agent responsible for the ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has killed more than 3,120 people and infected more than 91,000 as of March 3, 2020.

sourceString: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Tahadhari imekuwepo na ulimwengu ni lazima ujiandae kwa janga linalokuja la SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Precautions have been in place and the world must prepare for the coming SARS-CoV-2 pandemic.

sourceString: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
targetString: Virusi vyote saba vya HCoV vina asili ya kutoka kwa popo, panya au wanyama wa nyumbani.
en-mt: All seven HCoV viruses have originated from bats, mice or domestic animals.

sourceString: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
targetString: Maelezo mengi ya ushahidi yanaunga mkono asili ya ukuaji wa virusi vyote vya HCoV kutoka kwa popo, ambapo virusi vinazoeleka na havina uwezo wa kusababisha magonjwa lakini vinaonyesha hali anuwai ya kijenetiki.
en-mt: Most evidence descriptions support the growth nature of all HCoV viruses from bats, where viruses are common and are not capable of causing disease but exhibit a variety of genetic conditions.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.
targetString: Janga la COVID-19 limewasilisha changamoto kubwa za kimatibabu, kisayansi, kijamii na kimaadili nchini China na ulimwenguni.
en-mt: The COVID-19 pandemic has presented significant medical, scientific, social and ethical challenges in China and globally.

sourceString: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
targetString: Kufuatilia chanzo cha HCoV kutoka kwa wanyama hutoa utaratibu wa kuelewa historia asilia, msukumo na vigezo vya uzuiaji wa ugonjwa kusambaa baina ya aina za wanyama.
en-mt: Tracing the source of HCoV from animals provides a mechanism for understanding the natural history, motivation and determinants of disease spread between animal species.

sourceString: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
targetString: Hii pia inaweza kuongoza au kuwezesha utafutaji wa hifadhi, wabebaji wa kati na wanyama wabebaji wanaosambaza SARS-CoV-2, kukiwa na athari ya kuzuia maenezi kupindukia siku zijazo.
en-mt: This could also guide or facilitate the search for reservoirs, intermediate carriers and carriers spreading SARS-CoV-2, with the effect of preventing future overpopulation.

sourceString: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.
targetString: Katika ukaguzi huu tunawasilisha muhtasari wa asili ya wanyama, usambazaji miongoni mwa aina ya wanyama na uwezo wa HCoV kusababisha magonjwa.
en-mt: In this review we present an overview of animal origin, distribution among animal species and the potential for HCoV to cause disease.

sourceString: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of HCoVs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
targetString: Hususan, tunaangazia na kujadili mada ya kawaida kwamba virusi vizalishaji vya HCoV kawaida havina uwezo wa kusababisha magonjwa ndani ya wabebaji wake asilia lakini huwa na uwezo wa kusababisha ugonjwa baada ya kusambazwa baina ya aina ya wanyama hadi kwa mbebaji mpya.
en-mt: In particular, we highlight and discuss the common theme that HCoV breeding viruses are usually not capable of causing disease within their original carriers but are capable of causing disease after being transmitted between animal species to a new carrier.

sourceString: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
targetString: Pia tunakagua masuala ya sasa ya ukuaji wa HCoV ambapo ongezeko la uwezo wa kuambukizana mara nyingi huambatana na kupungua kwa uwezo wa kusababisha magonjwa.
en-mt: We also review current HCoV growth issues where increases in the ability to infect one another are often accompanied by decreases in the ability to cause disease.

sourceString: The outcome of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
targetString: Matokeo ya mkurupuko unaoendelea wa SAR-CoV-2 pia yamejadiliwa katika muktadha huu.
en-mt: The consequences of the ongoing SAR-CoV-2 outbreak have also been discussed in this context.

sourceString: Animal CoVs have been known since late 1930s.
targetString: Virusi vya CoV vya wanyama vimejulikana tangu miaka ya mwishoni mwa 1930.
en-mt: Animal CoV viruses have been known since the late 1930s.

sourceString: Before the first isolation of HCoV-229E strain B814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different CoVs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
targetString: Kabla ya kutolewa kwa aina ya kwanza ya HCoV-229E aina ya B814 kutoka kwa majimaji yaliyotoka puani mwa wagonjwa waliopata homa kali, virusi mbalimbali vya CoV vimetoewa katika wanyama mbalimbali walioambukizwa, wakiwemo bata mzinga, panya, ng'ombe, nguruwe, paka na mbwa.
en-mt: Prior to the release of the first type of HCoV-229E B814 from fluid from the noses of patients who have developed high fever, various CoV viruses have been released in a variety of infected animals, including turkeys, mice, cattle, pigs, cats and dogs.

sourceString: In the past decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.
targetString: Katika miongo iliyopita, virusi saba vya HCoV vimetambuliwa.
en-mt: In the past decades, seven HCoV viruses have been identified.

sourceString: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table ​1) would be informative and instructive.
targetString: Muhtasari wa historia ya ugunduzi wa HCoV katika utaratibu wa muda (Jedwali la 1) unaweza kuwa wa kuelimisha na kuelekeza.
en-mt: An overview of the history of HCoV discovery in the temporal order (Table 1) can be informative and instructive.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.
targetString: Aina ya kwanza ya HCoV-229E ilitolewa kwa njia ya kupumua ya wagonjwa waliokuwa na maambukizi ya sehemu ya juu ya njia ya kupumua katika mwaka wa 1966, na baadaye iliendelea kukua katika mikondo ya seli za mapafu ya WI-38.
en-mt: The first type of HCoV-229E was given to the respiratory tract of patients with an upper respiratory tract infection in 1966, and later continued to develop in the pulse cell currents of WI-38.

sourceString: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.
targetString: Wagonjwa walioambukizwa HCoV-229E walionyesha dalili za homa ya kawaida, ikiwa ni pamoja na maumivu ya kichwa, kupiga chafya, uchovu na koo inayouma, huku joto jingi na kikohozi kikionekana katika visa 10~20%.
en-mt: Patients infected with HCoV-229E showed symptoms of the common cold, including headache, sneezing, fatigue and sore throat, with high temperature and cough appearing in 10~20% of cases.

sourceString: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
targetString: Baadaye katika mwaka wa 1967, virusi vya HCoV-OC43 vilitolewa kutoka kwa ukuzaji wa kiungo na upandikishaji katika bongo za panya walionyonyesha.
en-mt: Later in 1967, the HCoV-OC43 virus was extracted from organ development and transplantation in the brains of breastfed mice.

sourceString: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.
targetString: Vipengele vya kimatibabu vya maambukizi ya HCoV-OC43 huonekana kuwa sawa na vile vinavyosababishwa na HCoV-229E, ambavyo haviwezi kutofautishwa kidalili na vile vya maambukizi kutoka kwa virusi vingine vya njia ya kupumua kama vile virusi vya influenza A na rhinoviruses.
en-mt: The medical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which cannot be distinguished symptomatically from those of infection from other respiratory tract viruses such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.

sourceString: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
targetString: Virusi vya HCoV-229E na HCoV-OC43 vimeenea kote duniani, na huonekana kuenea zaidi wakati wa msimu wa kipupwe katika hali ya hewa kiasi.
en-mt: The HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 viruses are widespread around the world, and appear to spread more frequently during the monsoon season in temperate climates.

sourceString: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
targetString: Kijumla, muda kati ya kuambukizwa na kujitokeza kwa virusi hivi ni chini ya wiki moja na, ukifuatwa na ugonjwa wa takriban wiki 2.
en-mt: Generally, the time between infection and the emergence of the virus is less than one week and, followed by an illness of approximately 2 weeks.

sourceString: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed mild common cold.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa utafiti wa kujitolea kwa binadamu, wahudumu wa afya walioambukizwa HCoV-229E walikuwa na homa kiasi ya kawaida.
en-mt: According to a study of human volunteers, healthcare workers infected with HCoV-229E had a relatively mild fever.

sourceString: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
targetString: Wagonjwa wachache pekee ambao kinga zao za mwili ni dhaifu ndio walioonyesha maambukizi kali ya sehemu ya chini ya njia ya kupumua.
en-mt: Only a few patients whose immune systems are weak showed severe infections of the lower respiratory tract.

sourceString: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.
targetString: Virusi vya SARS, ambavyo pia vinafahamika kama “nimonia isiyo ya kawaida”, vilikuwa janga la kwanza lililosababishwa na HCoV katika historia ya binadamu vilivyonakiliwa vyema na ajenti wa kietiolojia ni virusi vya SARS-CoV, virusi vya tatu vya HCoV kugunduliwa.
en-mt: The SARS virus, also known as "abnormal pneumonia", was the first epidemic caused by HCoV in human history properly documented by an etiological agent is the SARS-CoV virus, the third HCoV virus to be detected.

sourceString: The first case of SARS can be traced back to late 2002 in Guangdong Province of China.
targetString: Kisa cha kwanza cha SARS kinaweza kufuatiliwa hadi mwishoni mwa 2002 katika Mkoa wa Gaungdong nchini China.
en-mt: The first case of SARS can be traced to late 2002 in China's Gaungdong Province.

sourceString: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
targetString: Janga la SARS lilisababisha visa 8,096 vilivyoripotiwa na vifo 774, na kuenea katika nchi nyingi na mabara mengi.
en-mt: The SARS pandemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases and 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.

sourceString: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
targetString: Kando na vienezi vikuu, ilikadiriwa kwamba kila kisa kingeibua takriban visa viwili vya pili na kipindi kati ya kuambukizwa na kujitokeza cha siku 4 hadi 7 na upeo wa kiwango cha virusi ukionekana siku ya 10 ya ugonjwa.
en-mt: Apart from the main spreaders, it was estimated that each case would trigger approximately two second cases with the period between infection and emergence of 4 to 7 days and the maximum of the virus level appearing on day 10 of the disease.

sourceString: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
targetString: Wagonjwa walioambukizwa SARS-CoV awali huonyesha dalili za maumivu kwenye misuli, maumivu ya kichwa, joto jingi, uchovu na kijibaridi, kisha matatizo ya kupumua, kikohozi na matatizo ya kupumua kama dalili za baadaye.
en-mt: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially show signs of muscle pain, headaches, high temperatures, fatigue and chills, then respiratory problems, coughs and breathing problems as later symptoms.

sourceString: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.
targetString: Kupungua kwa seli za limfositi katika damu, uchunguzi wa utendakazi wa ini lililoharibika, na ongezeko la kinase ya kriatini ni uchunguzi usio wa kawaida wa kimahabara wa SARS.
en-mt: The decrease of limfositi cells in the blood, the screening of the functioning of the damaged liver, and the increase of kriatin kinase are the most unusual empirical observations of SARS.

sourceString: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.
targetString: Kuharibika kwa alveola, kuongezeka kwa seli za epithelia na ongezeko la makrofeji pia huonekana kwa wagonjwa wa SARS.
en-mt: Damage to the alveola, increased cell epithelia and increased macroscopic are also seen in SARS patients.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
targetString: Takriban 20-30% ya wagonjwa baadaye huhitaji tiba ya kina na mashine za kusaidia kupumua.
en-mt: Approximately 20-30% of patients later require extensive therapy and ventilators.

sourceString: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
targetString: Pamoja na njia ya chini ya kupumua, viungo vingi ikiwa ni pamoja na njia ya gesi za utumbo, ini na figo pia vinaweza kuambukizwa katika visa hivi mbaya, kwa kawaida vikiambatana na mlipuko wa saitokini, jambo linaloweza kuwa hatari hasa kwa wagonjwa ambao kinga zao za mwili zimeathirika.
en-mt: As well as the lower respiratory tract, many organs including the digestive tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these serious cases, usually accompanied by a salmonella outbreak, which can be particularly dangerous for patients whose immune systems are compromised.

sourceString: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.
targetString: Virusi hivi vilitolewa mara ya kwanza kutoka katika uchunguzi wa upasuaji wa mapafu wa jamaa wa mgonjwa ambaye alisafiri kutoka Hong Kong kuenda Guangzhou.
en-mt: The virus was first released from the lung surgical examination of a relative of a patient who had travelled from Hong Kong to Guangzhou.

sourceString: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.
targetString: Tangu wakati huo, jitihada za dhati zimewekwa katika utafiti wa HCoV.
en-mt: Since then, sincere efforts have been put into HCoV research.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.
targetString: Virusi vya HCoV-NL63 vilitolewa kutoka kwa Mtoto wa umri wa miezi -7 nchini Uholanzi mwishoni mwa 2004.
en-mt: The HCoV-NL63 virus was extracted from a baby aged -7 months in the Netherlands in late 2004.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
targetString: Mwanzoni viligunduliwa kusambaa miongoni mwa watoto wadogo, watu wazee na wagonjwa ambao kinga zao za mwili zimeathirika waliokuwa na magonjwa ya kupumua.
en-mt: They were initially found to spread among young children, elderly people and patients whose immune systems have been compromised who have respiratory illnesses.

sourceString: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Kuonekana kwa mafua, inflamesheni ya konjaktiva ya jicho, joto jingi na bronkiolitisi ni kawaida katika ugonjwa unaosababishwa na HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: The appearance of influenza, inflamement of the eye's congenitals, high temperature and broncholysis are common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.
targetString: Utafiti mwingine huru ulifafanua kutolewa kwa virusi sawa kutoka kwa sampuli za puani kutoka kwa mvulana wa umri wa miezi -8 aliyekuwa akiugua ugonjwa wa nimonia nchini Uholanzi.
en-mt: Another independent study defined the release of the same virus from nasal samples from a -8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
targetString: Ingawa vilitambuliwa nchini Uholanzi, vilisambaa ulimwenguni.
en-mt: Although they were recognized in the Netherlands, they spread worldwide.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
targetString: Imekadiriwa kwamba HCoV-NL63 inachangia 4.7% ya magonjwa ya kawaida ya kupumua na hutokea sana nyakati za kipindi cha awali cha kiangazi, mapukutiko na kipupwe.
en-mt: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for 4.7% of common respiratory diseases and occurs most commonly during the early summer, spring and spring periods.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
targetString: Virusi vya HCoV-NL63 vinahusishwa na kuchomeka kwa koo kunakoziba koo, pia iitwayo kifaduro.
en-mt: The HCoV-NL63 virus is associated with throat burning, also called a sedative.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
targetString: Mwaka huo huo, virusi vya HCoV-HKU1 vilitolewa kutoka kwa mwanaume wa miaka 71-ambaye alikuwa amelazwa hospitalini akiwa ameugua ugonjwa wa nimonia na kuziba kwa njia za hewa kwenye mapafu kule Hong Kong.
en-mt: That same year, the HCoV-HKU1 virus was extracted from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and blocked airways in the lungs in Hong Kong.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
targetString: Kando na nimonia inayosambazwa kijamii na kuziba kwa njia za hewa kwenye mapafu, HCoV-HKU1 iliripotiwa kuhusishwa na ongezeko kali la kufungana kwa pumu.
en-mt: Aside from pneumonia being socially transmitted by the clotting of airways in the lungs, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with a severe increase in asthma binding.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
targetString: Virusi sawa na HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E na HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 vilipatikana ulimwenguni kote na kusababisha magonjwa ya kiasi pumu.
en-mt: Viruses similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 were found around the world and caused moderate to severe asthma.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: Virusi hivi vyote vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii vimepata njia ya kukaa ndani ya binadamu vyema na vina uwezekano mdogo wa kubadilika ili kusabaisha ugonjwa wa virusi, ingawa ajali zilitokea kwa sababu zisizojulikana kama ilivyo katika visa nadra vya aina ndogo yenye virusi zaidi ya HCoV-NL63, ambavyo hivi majuzi viliripotiwa kusababisha maambukizi kali ya sehemu ya chini ya njia ya kupumua nchini China.
en-mt: All of these socially-transmitted HCoV viruses have found a way to stay in humans well and are less likely to evolve to cause viral illness, although accidents occurred for unknown reasons as in rare cases of a subtype with more highly transmissible HCoV-NL63 virus, which recently reportedly caused severe infection of the lower respiratory tract in China.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: Kijumla, virusi hivi vya HCoV vikishapata uwezo wa kusambaza kwa ufanisi na kuendelea kujidumisha ndani ya binadamu, pia uwezo wao wa virusi au wa kipathogenetiki unapungua.
en-mt: Overall, once these HCoV viruses have gained the ability to effectively transmit and continue to maintain themselves within humans, their viral or pathogenic capacity decreases.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Virusi vya MERS-CoV vilitolewa kwa mara ya kwanza katika mwaka wa 2012 kutoka kwa mgonjwa wa mapafu wa umri wa miaka 60 ambaye alipata ugonjwa wa nimonia kali na kufeli kwa njia ya kupitisha mkojo nchini Saudi Arabia.
en-mt: MERS-CoV virus was first released in 2012 from a 60-year-old lung patient who developed severe pneumonia and urinary bypass failure in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: Ingawa visa vingi vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara vilitokea Mashariki ya Kati, visa kutoka nchi za nje vilivyoenea mara kwa mara kwa watu wengine hadi kwa watu waliotangamana nao kwa karibu vimeripotiwa katika nchi za Ulaya na Tunisia.
en-mt: Although most of the confirmed cases in the region occurred in the Middle East, cases from foreign countries that spread frequently from other people to people with close contact have been reported in Europe and Tunisia.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
targetString: Mkurupuko mwingine wa pili ulitokea nchini Korea Kusini mnamo 2015 kukiwa na visa 186 vilivyothibitishwa.
en-mt: The second outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
targetString: Ishara za kimatibabu za MERS zinafanana na zile za SARS, zikiwa na sifa ya nimonia kali inayoendelea.
en-mt: The medical signs of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by persistent acute pneumonia.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
targetString: Tofauti na SARS, wagonjwa wengi wenye MERS pia walipata kufeli kwa njia ya mkojo, jambo ambalo ni la kipekee sana kwa MERS miongoni mwa magonjwa yanayosababishwa na HCoV.
en-mt: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also experienced urinary tract failure, which is very unique to MERS among HCoV-derived diseases.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
targetString: Zaidi ya 30% ya wagonjwa huonyesha kuwa na dalili za matatizo ya tumbo, kama vile kuendesha na kupatika.
en-mt: More than 30% of patients show they have symptoms of stomach problems, such as driving and being intubated.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 14 Februari 2020, zaidi ya visa 2500 vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara viliripotiwa kukiwa na viwango vya juu vya visa vya vifo kwa 34.4%, na kufanya MERS-CoV mojawapo ya virusi vibaya zaidi vinavyojulikana na binadamu.
en-mt: As of February 14, 2020, more than 2,500 confirmed cases in the country were reported with a high mortality rate of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the deadliest viruses known to humanity.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Katika kipindi cha katikati hadi mwishoni wa mwezi Disemba 2019, mkusanyiko wa wagonjwa wa nimonia ambao awali ulifahamika kuhusishwa na maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 uligunduliwa kule Wuhan, Mkoa wa Hubei, China.
en-mt: In the mid- to late-December period of 2019, a collection of pneumonia patients previously known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection was discovered in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani lilitangaza mkurupuko unaoendelea wa maambukizi ya njia ya chini ya kupumua unaosababishwa na SARS-CoV-2 kuwa Dharura ya Afya ya Umma ya Wasiwasi wa Kimataifa na pia likaupa jina ugonjwa huu kuwa COVID-19.
en-mt: The World Health Organization declared an ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infections caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also renamed the disease COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 3 Machi 2020, visa 90,053 vimethibitishwa kote ulimwenguni na kiwango cha kutisha cha vifo cha 3.4%.
en-mt: As of 3 March 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed globally with an alarming 3.4% mortality rate.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: Ni dhahiri kwamba, kiwango cha visa vya vifo Mkoani Hubei, China ni 4.2%, ilhali huku nje ya mkoa huo ni 1.2%.
en-mt: The death rate in Hubei Province, China, is 4.2%, while outside the province is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 husababisha maambukizi kali ya kupumua sawa na SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, yanayodhihirika kama joto jingi mwilini, kikohozi na ugumu wa kupumua.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infections similar to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, manifesting as high body temperatures, cough and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: Kuendesha pia hudhihirika kwa baadhi ya wagonjwa.
en-mt: Driving is also evident in some patients.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Nimonia ni mojawapo ya dalili kali zaidi na inaweza kuendelea kukua kwa haraka na kuwa sindromu kali ya matatizo ya kupumua.
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can develop rapidly into severe respiratory problems.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: Ingawa virusi vya SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2 hufanana kwa karibu kutokana na mfululizo wa juu unaofanana wa nukleotidi wa 82%, huunganika na kuwa matawi tofauti katika mchoro wa kifilogenetiki.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 viruses are closely related due to a high correspondance of 82% nuclei, they are linked to each other as separate branches in the phylogenetic diagram.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: Ni wazi kwamba SARS-CoV-2 haina uwezo mkubwa wa kusababisha ugonjwa lakini usambazaji wake ni wa juu ikilinganishwa na SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV.
en-mt: It is clear that SARS-CoV-2 does not have much potential to cause disease but its distribution is high compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
targetString: Watu wasioonyesha dalili za ugonjwa walioambukizwa virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 wameripotiwa na wanaweza kuchangia katika kuenea kwake haraka kote duniani.
en-mt: People showing no symptoms of the disease infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and can contribute to its rapid spread around the world.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: Kulinganisha na kutofautisha SARS-CoV-2 na aina nyingine sita za HCoV kumeibua mfanano na tofauti zinazovutia sana.
en-mt: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with six other HCoV strains has raised some very interesting similarities and differences.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: Kwanza, kipindi kati ya kuambukizwa na kujitokeza na kipindi cha kuwepo kwa ugonjwa wa HCoV ni sawa.
en-mt: First, the period between infection and emergence and the period of presence of HCoV disease are the same.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: Kutokana na hili, virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 hufuata hali inayovuma ya kawaida ya virusi vingine vya HCoV.
en-mt: Due to this, the SARS-CoV-2 virus follows the trending normality of other HCoV viruses.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: Pili, uzito wa dalili za COVID-19 huwa kati ya SARS-CoV na virusi vinne vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii (yaani. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 na HCoV-NL63).
en-mt: Second, the seriousness of COVID-19 symptoms tends to be between SARS-CoV and the four HCoV viruses being transmitted socially (ie. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: Kwa upande mmoja, maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 huonyesha sifa ambazo kwa kawaida huonekana wakati wa maambukizi ya virusi vya kuambukizana kijamii vya HCoV, ikiwa ni pamoja na kuonyesha dalili zisizo mahususi, kiasi au hata kutokuwepo kwa dalili zozote.
en-mt: On the one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits traits typically seen during the transmission of the HCoV social contagion virus, including showing nonspecific symptoms, moderation or even absence of any symptoms.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, kijikundi kidogo cha visa kali vya COVID-19 pia kinaweza kuonekana kama ilivyo katika kisa cha maambukizi ya SARS-CoV, ingawa vipimo ni vya chini zaidi.
en-mt: On the other hand, a small cluster of severe COVID-19 cases can also be seen as in a case of SARS-CoV infection, although the tests are much lower.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Tatu, usambazaji wa SARS-COV-2 pia unaonyesha ruwaza ya kuvutia ya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijumuiya na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Third, the distribution of SARS-COV-2 also shows an interesting pattern of HCoV distributed communally by SARS-CoV.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Kwa upande mmoja, uwezo wa kusambazwa kwa SARS-CoV-2 angalau uko juu kama ule wa virusi vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii.
en-mt: On the one hand, the potential for SARS-CoV-2 transmission is at least as high as that of the socially-transmitted HCoV virus.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, itasalia kuthibitishwa iwapo uwezo wa kusambazwa kwa ugonjwa wa SARS-COV-2 hupungua baada ya kupitishwa kwa binadamu kama ilivyo katika visa vya SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV.
en-mt: On the other hand, it will remain to be determined whether the potential for SARS-COV-2 transmission decreases after human adoption as in SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV cases.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: Hatimaye, sawa na virusi vingine vya HCoV, virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vinaweza kugunduliwa kwenye sampuli ya kinyesi.
en-mt: Finally, similar to other HCoV viruses, the SARS-CoV-2 virus can be detected in a stool sample.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: Iwapo kusambazwa kwa SARS-CoV-2 kupitia kinyesi kwenye midomo huwa na jukumu muhimu kama ilivyo katika kisa cha SARS-CoV angalau chini ya hali fulani kunasalia kuwekwa wazi kupitia utafiti wa siku zijazo.
en-mt: Whether the spread of SARS-CoV-2 through feces on the lips plays as important a role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under certain circumstances remains to be clarified through future research.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Pia ni jambo la kuvutia kuona iwapo virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vinaweza kutokea kwa misimu kama ilivyo katika visa vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii.
en-mt: It is also interesting to see if SARS-CoV-2 viruses can occur slang as in the cases of socially transmitted HCoV.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: Licha ya hayo, vipengele vya SARS-CoV-2 ikiwa ni pamoja na uwezo wa kusambazwa, uwezo wa kuambukiza na kuendelea kusambaa baada ya kupitishwa kwa binadamu vitakuwa na ushawishi kwenye hatima ya mkurupuko unaoendelea wa COVID-19.
en-mt: Despite this, SARS-CoV-2 features including the ability to be transmitted, the ability to infect and continue to spread after human adoption will have an influence on the fate of the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: Virusi vyote vinne vya HCoVs vinavyosambazwa kijamii vinavyosababisha dalili za wastani vimezoea binadamu.
en-mt: All four of the socially-transmitted HCoVs viruses that cause mild symptoms have been adapted to humans.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: Kwa mtazamo mwingine, pia huenda ikawa ni ukweli kwamba binadamu wamezoea virusi hivi vinne vya HCoV.
en-mt: From another perspective, it may also be the fact that humans are accustomed to these four HCoV viruses.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: Yaani, huenda wote wakawa wasaliaji wa majanga ya zamani ya HCoV.
en-mt: That is, they may all be survivors of past HCoV tragedies.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: Virusi vya HCoV vinavyosababisha magonjwa kali kwa binadamu na binadamu waliopata magonjwa kali ya HCoV wameondolewa.
en-mt: HCoV viruses that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who have acquired severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: Ndio hii ifanyike, virusi vya HCoV lazima vizalishwe ndani ya binadamu kwa kiwango toshelevu cha kuruhusu mkusanyiko wa mabadiliko yanayoweza kupambana na vigezo vya udhibiti vya mbebaji virusi.
en-mt: Yes this is to be done, the HCoV virus must be produced in humans at a sufficient rate to allow for a collection of mutations that can combat the regulatory parameters of the virus carrier.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: Kwa mantiki hii, kadri mkurupuko wa SARS-CoV-2 unavyondelea na jinsi watu zaidi wanavyoambukizwa, ndivyo kuna uwezekano mkuu kwamba utazoeleka kwa binadamu.
en-mt: In this sense, the more the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak develops and the more people are infected, the more likely it will be to humans.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: Ikiwa virusi hivi vitazoeleka vyema, uenezi wake kwa binadamu unaweza kuwa vigumu kudhibiti kupitia karantini au hatua zingine za kudhibiti maambukizi.
en-mt: If the virus is well-adapted, its spread to humans can be difficult to control through quarantine or other infection control measures.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: Kwa miaka mingi, virusi vinne vya CoV vinavyoenezwa kijamii vimesambaa miongoni mwa watu, na kuchochea homa ya kawaida miongoni mwa watu/wanyama walio na kinga thabiti.
en-mt: Over the years, four socially transmitted CoV viruses have circulated among people, fueling the common cold among people/animals with strong immune systems.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: Virusi hivi havihitaji hifadhi ndani ya mnyama.
en-mt: This virus does not need shelter inside the animal.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: Kinyume chake, virusi vya SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV ambavyo husambazwa zaidi havijazoeleka vyema kwa binadamu na uenezi wake miongoni mwa binadamu hauwezi kudhibitiwa.
en-mt: On the contrary, the SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV viruses that are most commonly transmitted are not well-adapted to humans and their spread among humans cannot be controlled.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: Vinahitaji kudumisha na kuendeleza hifadhi zao ndani ya wanyama na kutafuta nafasi ya kusambaa kwa wanadamu wanaolengwa walio hatarini, pengine kupitia kibebaji cha pili na kinachoeneza.
en-mt: They need to maintain and sustain their reservoirs within animals and find room to spread to vulnerable target humans, perhaps through a second and spreading carrier.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vina sifa sawa na za virusi vya SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV na HCoV nne vinavyosambazwa kijamii.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV-2 virus has the same characteristics as that of the SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV virus with four socially transmitted HCoV.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: Vina uwezekano mkubwa wa kusambazwa kama vile virusi vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii, angalau kwa sasa.
en-mt: They are more likely to be transmitted as the socially-transmitted HCoV virus, at least for now.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: Hata hivyo, inasababisha ugonjwa kuliko virusi vya HCoV vinavyosambazwa kijamii na uwezo wake wa kusababisha ugonjwa ni wa chini kuliko SARS-CoV au MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, it causes disease than the socially transmitted HCoV virus and its ability to cause disease is lower than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: Itasalia kuonekana iwapo vitazoeleka kikamilifu kwa binadamu na kusambaa ndani ya binadamu bila hifadhi au mnyama mbebaji.
en-mt: It will remain to be seen whether it will be fully normalized in humans and spread into humans without a shelter or a carrier animal.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: Kabla ya kujadili asili zinazotokana na wanyama za HCoV, itakuwa vyema kwetu kujadili ufafanuzi na sifa za kibebaji cha kiukuaji, asilia,hifadhi na mbebaji wa uenezi wa HCoV.
en-mt: Before discussing the animal-derived origins of HCoV, it would be advisable for us to discuss the definition and characteristics of the promoter, nature, reservoir and carrier of HCoV propagation.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Mnyama hutumika kama kibebaji cha HCoV cha kiukuaji ikiwa amehifadhi ukoo wa karibu unaofanana katika kiwango cha mfululizo wa nukliotidi.
en-mt: An animal serves as a developmental HCoV carrier if it has retained a closely matched lineage at the level of the nuclear series.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: Virusi vya kiukoo kwa kawaida vimezoeleka na havina uwezo wa kusababisha ugonjwa ndani ya mbebaji huyu.
en-mt: Viruses are naturally common and have no ability to cause disease within this carrier.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: Vilevile, mbebaji ambaye ni hifadhi huwa na HCoV kila mara na kwa muda mrefu.
en-mt: Similarly, a carrier that is a reservoir tends to have HCoV consistently and for a long time.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: Katika hali zote, vibebaji virusi huambukizwa kiasilia na ni wabebaji asili wa HCoV au virusi vyake ambavyo ni vizazi.
en-mt: In all cases, virus carriers are transmitted naturally and are the natural carriers of HCoV or its viruses that are generations.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: Kinyume chake, ikiwa virusi vya HCoV vimeingia kwa mara ya kwanza ndani ya mbebaji wa kati kabla au karibu kuingia kwake kwa binadamu, huwa havijazoeleka vyema katika mazingira hayo mapya na mara nyingi husababisha ugonjwa.
en-mt: Conversely, if the HCoV virus has first entered the intermediate carrier before or about to enter it in humans, it tends not to be well adapted in that new environment and often causes disease.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: Mbebaji huyu wa kati anaweza kutumika kama chanzo kutokana na wanyama cha maambukizi kwa binadamu na hutekeleza jukumu la mbebaji msambazaji kwa kuruhusu virusi kuzalishwa na kisha kusambazwa kwa binadamu ili kuzidisha kiwango cha maambukizi kwa binadamu.
en-mt: This intermediate carrier can serve as an animal-derived source of transmission to humans and performs the role of the transmitter carrier by allowing the virus to be produced and then transmitted to humans to increase the rate of transmission to humans.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: Virusi vya HCoV vinaweza kupitia maambukizi yasiyo na athari ikiwa haviwezi kudumisha usambazaji wake ndani ya mbebaji wa kati.
en-mt: The HCoV virus can undergo an inadvertent infection if it cannot maintain its distribution within a central carrier.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, virusi vya HCoV vinaweza pia kuzoeleka ndani ya mbebaji wake wa kati na hata kuunda hali ya ugonjwa wa muda mrefu.
en-mt: On the other hand, the HCoV virus can also metastasize within its central carrier and even create chronic disease conditions.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: Katika hali hii, mbebaji wa kati anakuwa mbebaji asilia anayehifadhi virusi.
en-mt: In this case, the intermediate carrier becomes the natural carrier harboring the virus.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: Data ya kiepidimiolojia iliyofichua kwa njia ya kurudi nyuma kwamba faharasa ya kisa cha SARS kilikuwa na historia ya kutangamana na wanyama wa porini.
en-mt: The epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the SARS case index had a history of contact with wild animals.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: Uchunguzi uliofuata wa kiwango cha maambukizi uliashiria kuwa wafanyabiashara ya wanyama walikuwa na kiwango cha juu cha anti-SARS-CoV igG ikilinganishwa na idadi ya jumla ya watu.
en-mt: Subsequent studies of infection rate indicated that pet traders had a higher level of anti-SARS-CoV igG compared to the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ngawa wenye uso wa barakoa (Paguma larvata) na mbwa wa rakuni waliomo katika masoko ya wanyama hai walitambuliwa kwanza kubeba virusi vinavyofanana na SARS-CoV ambavyo vinakaribia kufanana na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Mask-faced pigeons (Paguma larvata) and rakuni dogs contained in live animal markets were first identified to carry a SARS-CoV-like virus that is almost identical to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: Hii iliungwa mkono kwa njia isiyo ya moja kwa moja na ukweli kwamba hakuna visa zaidi vya SARS vilvyoripotiwa baada ya kuuawa kwa ngawa wote waliokuwa sokoni.
en-mt: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS cases were reported after the killing of all the wingers that were in the market.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hata hivyo, imeripotiwa kwamba ngawa wenye uso wenye barakoa kutoka porini au mashambani bila kutangamana na wanyama wanaouzwa sokoni wengi wao hawakupatikana na SARS-CoV, na kuashiria kwamba ngawa wenye uso wa barakao wanaweza tu kutumika kama wabebaji wa kati wa kueneza lakini sio hifadhi asili wa SARS-CoV.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that mask-faced winged wingers from the wild or in the countryside without contact with animals sold in the market many of them were not exposed to SARS-CoV, suggesting that the mask-faced winged wingers can only serve as intermediate carriers of spreading but are not the natural reservoir for SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: Itabainika kwamba, kwa vile 80% ya wanyama tofauti katika masoko ya Guangzhou wana antibodi zinazopambana na SARS-CoV, uwezekano kwamba aina nyingi za mamalia wadogo pia wanaweza kutumika kama wabebaji wa kati waenezi wa SARS-CoV hauwezi kupuuzwa.
en-mt: It will be noted that, since 80% of the different animals in Guangzhou markets have SARS-CoV-fighting antibodies, the possibility that many species of small mammals may also serve as intermediate carriers of SARS-CoV spreaders cannot be ignored.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hawa wote wanaonekana kuwa wabebaji wasio na athari wa SARS-CoV.
en-mt: These all appear to be untraceable carriers of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: Utafutaji uliofuata wa mnyama ambaye ni mbebaji asili wa SARS-CoV ulionyesha kuwa virusi vya CoV vinavyohusiana kwa karibu na popo, viitwavyo SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), vinavyopatikana ndani ya popo wa Kichina wa horsehoe.
en-mt: A subsequent search for an animal that is a natural carrier of SARS-CoV showed that a CoV virus closely related to bats, called SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), found within Chinese horsehoe bats.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: Popo hawa wana antibodi dhidi ya SARS-CoV na msururu wa jinomu wa SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
en-mt: These bats have antibodies against SARS-CoV and the SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3 gene sequence.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Virusi hivi na vingine vya popo vya CoV huwa na msururu 88-92% unaofanana wa nukleotidi ulio na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This and other CoV bat viruses contain 88-92% identical nucleated sequences containing SARS-CoV.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: Utafiti huu umeweka msingi wa dhana mpya kwamba popo hubeba virusi vinavyoibuka vya binadamu.
en-mt: This research has laid the groundwork for a new hypothesis that bats carry emerging human viruses.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: Virusi kadhaa vya Cov (SL-CoVs) vinavyofanana na SARS pia vimetambuliwa kwenye popo, lakini hakuna kati yavyo isipokuwa WIV1 vinavyoweza kutengwa kama virusi hai.
en-mt: Several Cov viruses (SL-CoVs) similar to SARS have also been identified in bats, but none of them except WIV1 can be isolated as living viruses.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Homoni ya binadamu inayosababisha shinikizo la damu inayobadilisha enzaimu 2 (ACE2) inafahamika kuwa kipokezi cha SARS-CoV.
en-mt: The human hormone that causes hypertension that alters enzymes 2 (ACE2) is known to be a SARS-CoV receptor.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: Virusi vya WIV1 viliyotolewa kwenye sampuli ya kinyesi ya popo vilionyeshwa kutumia popo, ngawa na ACE2 ya binadamu kama kipokezi cha kuingia kwenye seli.
en-mt: The WIV1 virus extracted from a stool sample of bats was shown to use bats, bats and human ACE2 as a cell-entry receptor.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: Cha kushangaza, seramu kutoka wagonjwa wanaopona wa SARS ziliweza kuangamiza WIV1.
en-mt: Interestingly, serum from SARS recovered patients was able to destroy WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Kufikia sasa, virusi vya WIV1 vinawakilisha kizazi cha karibu sana cha SARS-CoV kwenye popo, vikiwa na 95% za msururu wa nukleotidi unaofanana.
en-mt: So far, the WIV1 virus represents the closest generation of SARS-CoV in bats, containing 95% of the corresponding nucleus sequence.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa mfanano mkubwa kati ya virusi hivi, inaaminika kwa jumla kwamba WIV1 si virusi vizalishaji vya kati vya SARS-CoV na popo sio wabebaji wa kati wanaohifadhi SARS-CoV.
en-mt: With the strong similarities between these viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the intermediate carriers of SARS-CoV and bats are not intermediate carriers harboring SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: Uchanganuzi wa kifilogenetiki unaweka pamoja MERS-CoV kwenye kikundi sawa na virusi vya CoV-HKU4 vya popo na virusi vya CoV-HKU5 vya popo.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis puts together MERS-CoV in the same group as the CoV-HKU4 virus of bats and CoV-HKU5 viruses of bats.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: Virusi vya CoV-HKU4 vya popo na MERS-CoV hutumia vipokezi sawa vya mbebaji, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), kwa ajili ya kuingia kwa virusi.
en-mt: The CoV-HKU4 virus of bats and MERS-CoV use the same carrier receptors, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for viral entry.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Misururu ya RNA- tegemezi ya polimerisi ya RNA ya MERS-CoV inakaribia kufanana kifilojenetiki na iliyo ndani ya virusi vya beta-CoV vya popo vilivyotambuliwa barani Ulaya na Afrika.
en-mt: The RNA-dependent sequences of MERS-CoV polymerases are almost identical in morphology to the domesticated beta-CoV viruses of bats identified in Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Kufikia sasa, hakuna virusi hai vya MERS-COV vinavyoweza kupatikana ndani ya popo wa porini.
en-mt: So far, no living MERS-COV virus can be found within wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV na jamii yake ya karibu zaidi ya virusi vya CoV-HKU25 vya popo vina mfanano wa 87% tu wa msururu wa nukleotidi.
en-mt: MERS-CoV and its closest category of CoV-HKU25 virus bats have only 87% similarity of the nucleated sequence.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kwa hivyo, popo huenda wasiwe wabebaji wa kati wahifadhi wa MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Therefore, bats may not be intermediate carriers of MERS-CoV reserves.
