en-mt: Continued investigation in this field will distinguish the growth pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with the key impact being in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Kusasisha utaratibu wa upimaji wa “kisa kinachoshukiwa” na “kisa kilichothibitishwa” cha COVID-19 ni muhimu
en-mt: Updating the testing regimes for "suspected case" and "confirmed case" of COVID-19 is essential

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 6 Februari 2020, timu yetu ilichapisha mwongozo wa ushauri wa haraka wa uchunguzi na matibabu ya maambukizi ya virusi vipya vya korona 2019 (2019-nCoV), na mwongozo ulitoa uzoefu wetu na kuweka marejeleo mema kwa ajili ya kupigana na janga hili kubwa kote duniani.
en-mt: On 6 February 2020, our team published a quick advice guide for the diagnosis and treatment of the new coronavirus infection 2019 (2019-nCoV), and the guidance provided our experience and put good references in place for fighting this devastating pandemic around the world.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Hata hivyo, ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona 2019 (COVID-19) ni ugonjwa mpya, ufahamu na ujuzi wetu unaendelea kua kulingana na matokeo ya utatifi unaoendelea na uzoefu wa matendo ya kimatibabu; hivyo, mikakakti ya upimaji na matibabu pia inaendelea kusasishwa.
en-mt: However, COVID-19 is a new disease, our knowledge and knowledge continue to grow based on the results of ongoing treatment and medical experience; Therefore, the testing and treatment regimes are also being updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Katika barua hii, tulijibu maoni moja kwenye mwongozo wetu na tukatoa utaratibu mpya zaidi wa upimaji wa "kisa kinachoshukiwa" na "kisa klichothibitishwa" kulingana na Miongozo ya hivi punde ya Upimaji na Matibabu ya COVID-19(toleo la saba) iliyotolewa na Kamati ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Jamhuri ya Watu wa China.
en-mt: In this letter, we responded to one comment on our guide and issued the newest testing procedure for "suspected case" and "confirmed case" based on the latest COVID-19 Testing and Treatment Guidelines (seventh edition) issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Mnamo Disemba 2019, virusi vipya vya korona vya 2019 (2019-nCoV) vimesababisha mkurupuko, ambao sasa unaitwa rasmi kama ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona 2019 (COVID-19) na virusi vyake vimepewa jina la severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: In December 2019, the new 2019 coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially called coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and its virus has been renamed severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 11 Machi 2020, WHO iliainisha COVID-19 kuwa ni janga kubwa.
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, the WHO classified COVID-19 as a major pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Ili kupambana na maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2, timu yetu imeunda mwongozo wa ushauri wa haraka na umechapishwa mtandaoni kwenye Utafiti wa Kimatibabu wa Jeshi tarehe 06 Februari 2020.
en-mt: To combat SARS-CoV-2 infections, our team has developed a rapid consultation guide and it has been published online at the Army Medical Survey on 06 February 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Umevutia umakinifu mkubwa tangu kuchapishwa kwake.
en-mt: It has attracted a lot of attention since its publication.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Hata hivyo, kumbuka kwamba COVID-19 ni ugonjwa mpya, ufahamu na ujuzi wetu unaongezeka kulingana na matokeo ya utafiti unaoendelea na uzoefu wa huduma za kimatibabu, hivyo, mikakati ya uchunguzi na matibabu pia inaendelea kusasishwa.
en-mt: However, keep in mind that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is increasing based on the results of ongoing research and experience of medical care, thus, diagnostic and treatment strategies also continue to be updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Kwa mfano, Miongozo ya Upimaji na Matibabu ya COVID-19 iliyotolewa na Kamati ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Jamhuri ya Watu wa China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), kati ya tarehe 16 Januari 2020 hadi tarehe 3 Machi 2020, imetoa jumla ya matoleo saba huku baadhi ya miktadha ikibadilishwa maudhui.
en-mt: For example, the COVID-19 Testing and Treatment Guidelines issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), between 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, have released a total of seven editions with some contexts being modified content.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Sasa mwongozo wetu ulipokea maoni kutoka Zhou na wenzake., walileta pendekezo rahisi la kupata alaa kulingana na uzoefu wao wa kimatibabu.
en-mt: Now our guide received feedback from Zhou and his colleagues., they brought a simple proposal to get alaa based on their medical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Kazi yao iliongeza ushahidi mpya kwa mwongozo wetu na pia kufanya rejeleo la thamani kwa janga hili kote ulimwenguni.
en-mt: Their work added new evidence to our guidance as well as making valuable reference to this pandemic around the world.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Tunapendekeza kazi yao muhimu na kutoa shukrani zetu.
en-mt: We recommend their important work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Hata hivyo, kazi yao pia inahitaji kusasishwa kulingana na Mwongozo wa hivi punde wa Upimaji na Matibabu wa COVID-19 (Toleo la jaribio la saba) na utafiti wa hivi majuzi.
en-mt: However, their work also needs to be updated in line with the latest COVID-19 Testing and Treatment Guidelines (Seventh test edition) and recent research.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Kulingana na toleo la saba (tarehe 3 Machi 2020), kuthibitisha visa vinavyoshukiwa kunahitaji kujumuisha kipengee chochote kimoja cha vipengele vya historia ya kiepidimiolojia na vipengee viwili vya udhihirishaji wa kimatbabu ili kufanya uchunguzi tondoti au mahitaji ya kukidhi vipengee vitatu vya udhihirisho wa kimatibabu ikiwa hakuna historia wazi ya kiepidimiolojia:
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), verifying suspected cases requires including any one item of epidemiological history elements and two items of medical manifestation in order to perform a medical examination or a requirement to meet three items of medical manifestation if there is no clear epidemiological history:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Historia ya kiepidimiolojia: (1) historia ya kusafiri au kuishi Jijini Wuhan na maeneo ya karibu au jamii zingine ambapo visa vya COVID-19 vimeripotiwa katika siku 14 zilizopita kabla ya kuanza kwa dalili; (2) historia ya kugusana na visa vya maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 (kwa vipimo chanya vya asidi ya nyuklea); (3)historia ya kugusana na wagonjwa walio na dalili za joto jingi au pumu kutoka jiji la Wuhan na maeneo ya karibu au jamii zingine ambapo COVID-19 iliripotiwa katika siku 14 zilizopita kabla ya kuanza kwa dalili; (4) historia ya kugusana na mkusanyiko wa visa viliyothibitishwa (visa 2 au zaidi vya joto jingi mwili na/au dalili za pumu zilizotokea ndani ya wiki 2 katika maeneo madogo, kama vile nyumbani, ofisi, darasa shuleni. n.k).
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) history of travel or residence in Wuhan and nearby areas or other communities where COVID-19 cases have been reported in the last 14 days prior to the onset of symptoms; (2) history of contact with cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection (for positive tests of nucleic acid); (3) history of contact with patients with mild or asthmatic symptoms from Wuhan city and nearby areas or other communities where COVID-19 was reported in the last 14 days prior to the onset of symptoms; (4) history of contact with a collection of confirmed cases (2 or more cases of body temperature and/or asthma symptoms occurring within 2 weeks in small spaces, such as home, office, classroom at school. etc).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Udhihirisho wa kimatibabu: (1) joto jingi mwilini na/au dalili za pumu; (2)sifa zinazoonekana za maambukizi ya COVID-19; (3) idadi ya jumla ya seli nyeupe za damu zinazoonyesha idadi ya kawaida, iliyopungua ya seli nyeupe za damu katika awamu wa mapema.
en-mt: Medical manifestations: (1) high temperature in the body and/or symptoms of asthma; (2) observable characteristics of COVID-19 infection; (3) the total number of white blood cells reflecting the normal, decreased number of white blood cells in the early phase.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Upimaji wa kisa kilichothibitishwa unapaswa kutegemea kisa kukiwa na kisa kinachoshukiwa chenye kipengee chochote cha ushahidi wa ugnojwa au serolojia ifuatavyo: (1) kupatikaka kwa virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 kwa muda halisi kupitia vipimo vya PCR; (2)msururu mzima wa genome ya virusi unaoonyesha mfanano mkubwa na virusi vipya vya korona vinavyofahamika; (3)kuwepo kwa antibodi mahususi ya IgM na IgG kwa SARS-CoV-2 katika kipimo cha serami; au kubadilika kwa antibodi mahususi ya IgG ya SARS-CoV-2 kutokuwepo hadi kuwepo au kuongezeka kwa mara 4 na zaidi katika awamu ya kupona zaidi ya awamu ya hali mbaya ya ugonjwa.
en-mt: Testing for a confirmed case should be based on a case with a suspected case containing any element of evidence of schizophrenia or serology follows: (1) the transmission of the SARS-CoV-2 virus in real time through PCR tests; (2) whole viral genome sequences showing strong similarities to newly identified coronaviruses; (3) the presence of IgM and IgG-specific antibodies for SARS-CoV-2 in the serami dose; or flexibility of SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody absent until the presence or increase 4-fold and greater in the recovery phase beyond the acute disease status phase.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Tunaweza kuona kwamba kipimo cha muda halisi cha PCR kwa asidi ya kinyuklia kwenye njia ya kupumua au sampuli ya damu kiliongezwa kwenye toleo la pili la (Tarehe 18 Januari 2020) na la tatu (Tarehe 22 Januari 2020).
en-mt: We can see that a real-time PCR test for nuclear acid in the respiratory tract or blood sample was added to the second edition of (January 18, 2020) and the third (January 22, 2020).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Ugunduzi wa kipathogeni wa sampuli ya damu uliongezwa kwenye toleo la nne (tarehe 27 januari 2020) na toleo la tano (tarehe 8 Februari 2020); na ushahidi wa kiserolojia uliongezwa kwenye toleo la saba.
en-mt: The pathogen discovery of the blood sample was added to the fourth edition (on 27 January 2020) and the fifth edition (on 8 February 2020); and the serological evidence was adduced to the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Marekebisho haya kulingana na watafiti yaliendeleza kazi ya kutafuta kifurushi bora cha kugundua asidi ya nyuklea kwa ajili ya upimaji haraka, pamoja na sampuli kutoka kwa njia ya pumu ikiwa ni pamoja na sampuli wa damu, ambayo iliongeza upatikanji wa sampuli tofauti na kusaidia kuletwa kwa matokeo chanya ya antibodi mahususi katika utaratibu uliothibitishwa.
en-mt: This revision according to the researchers furthered the task of finding the best package for detecting nucleic acid for rapid testing, as well as samples from the asthma tract including blood samples, which increased the sequencing of different samples and helped to be brought to a positive antibody specific result in a validated procedure.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Kando na hayo, kuna ushihidi mwingi zaidi unaotukumbusha kutahadhari na wagonjwa walio na dalili kwa njia isiyo ya kawaida na wale ambao hawana na dalili.
en-mt: Besides, there are many more evidences that remind us to be careful with patients who have unusual symptoms and those who do not have symptoms.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Hivyo, chati ya Zhou na wenzake inapaswa kusasishwa, kwa sababu iliainisha mtu bila dalili za kimatibabu kuwa ni wa “hatari ya chini”.
en-mt: Thus, the chart of Zhou and his colleagues should be updated, because it classified a person without medical symptoms as being of "low risk".

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Mfumo wa alama pia unahitaji kuthibitishwa katika matendo na utafiti wa kimatibabu wa baadaye.
en-mt: The score system also needs to be validated in future medical practices and research.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Kukamilisha, tunatumai ushahidi wa moja kwa moja zaidi utaibuka na tunawarai wasomaji kutoa maoni yao.
en-mt: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence emerges and we urge readers to give their opinion.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Kwa upimaji wa "kisa kinachoshukiwa" na "kisa kilichothibitishwa", tunapendekeza kufuatwa na utiifu wa miongozo mipya ya nchi zao za nyumbani.
en-mt: For "suspected case" and "confirmed case" testing, we recommend compliance with the new guidelines for their home countries.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Timu yetu pia itasasisha kwa muda ufaao mwongozo wetu ili kutoa msaada.
en-mt: Our team will also update in due course our guidance to provide support.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangladesh iliripoti vifo vipya vya watu watano kutokana na COVID-19, visa vya juu zaidi kuripotiwa kila siku
en-mt: - Bangladesh reports five new deaths from COVID-19, the highest daily reported cases

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Jana, Bangladesh ilithibitisha vifo vipya vitano kutokana na COVID-19 kwa siku hiyo.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 in that day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Hii ndiyo idadi ya juu zaidi ya vifo vinavyotokea kwa siku kutokana na virusi.
en-mt: This is the highest daily death toll from the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Kufikia jana, Taasisi ya Epidimiolojia ya Bangladesh, Udhibiti wa Magonjwa na Utafiti (IEDCR) iliripoti idadi ya visa vilivyorekodiwa vya maambukizi vilivyojumuisha visa 114 vilivyopo na visa 33 vya watu waliopona waliokuwa wakiishi nyumbani.
en-mt: As of yesterday, Bangladesh Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded cases of infection comprising 114 existing cases and 33 cases of recovered persons living at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Jumla ya vifo 17 vilirekodiwa.
en-mt: A total of 17 deaths were recorded.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Katika taarifa ya habari ya mtandaoni, mkurugenzi wa IEDCR, Dkt Meerjady Sabrina Flora alisema kuwa vifo vilijumuisha wanaume wanne na mwanamke mmoja.
en-mt: In an online news release, IEDCR director Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora said the deaths included four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Kulingana na Dkt. Meerjady, visa viwili vilikuwa vya watu wenye umri wa zaidi ya miaka 60, wawili kati ya miaka 51 na 60 na mmoja miaka 41-50.
en-mt: According to Dr. Meerjady, two cases were in people over the age of 60, two between 51 and 60 years old and one aged 41-50.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Pia alisema wawili kati ya waathiriwa walikuwa wa kutoka Dhaka.
en-mt: He also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani (WHO) lilitangaza COVID-19 kuwa janga kubwa tarehe 11 Machi.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a major pandemic on March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Afisa wa hospitali aliliambia Shirika la Anadolu, shirika la habari la ndani kwamba mmoja wa waliopoteza maisha yao alikuwa Jalal Saifur Rahman, mkurugenzi katika Tume ya Kupambana na Ufisadi nchini Bengani, ambaye alitibiwa katika Hospitali ya Kuwait Maitree.
en-mt: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news agency, that one of those who lost their lives was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director at the Bengani Anti-Corruption Commission, who was treated at Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: Siku ya Jumamosi, katika tangazo la video mtandaoni, Waziri wa Uchukuzi wa Bangladesh Obaidul Quader alisema usafiri wa umma ungefungwa kwa muda zaidi ya ilivypangwa awali, hadi Jumamosi hii ijayo.
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladesh Transport Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be closed for longer than originally planned, until this coming Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Kufungwa kwa usafiri huu wa umma kulikuwa kumeanza awali mnamo 26 Machi na ulipangwa kuisha mnamo Jumamosi, tarehe 4.
en-mt: The closure of this public transport had originally begun on 26 March and was scheduled to end on Saturday, the 4th.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Usafirishaji wa bidhaa muhimu -- za kimatibabu, fueli na vyakula -- bado uliruhusiwa.
en-mt: Shipments of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- were still permitted.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Matukio ya kwanza ya maambukizi ya COVID-19 nchini Bangladesh yalikuwa tarehe 8 Machi, kwa watu wawili ambao walirejea kutoka Italia na pia mke wa mmoja wao.
en-mt: The first cases of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who had returned from Italy as well as the wife of one of them.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 19 Machi, watu hawa watatu hawa tayari walikuwa wamepona.
en-mt: By March 19, these three men had already recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: Virusi vya SARS-CoV-2 vinazidi maambukizi milioni moja kote ulimwenguni
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 virus exceeds one million infections worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Siku ya Alhamisi, jumla ya idadi ya visa vya maambukizi ya virusi vya korona SARS-CoV-2 ilipita milioni moja kote ulimwenguni, data kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Johns Hopkins ilionyesha hivyo.
en-mt: On Thursday, the total number of cases of coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 passed one million worldwide, data from Johns Hopkins University showed that.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Angalau vifo elfu 52 vilihusishwa na COVID-19, ugonjwa unaosababishwa na virusi vya korona.
en-mt: At least 52,000 deaths were attributed to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Upeo huu ulifikiwa siku hiyo hiyo ambapo nchi ya Malawi ilithibitisha maambukizi yake ya kwanza ya visa vya korona na Zambia ilithibitisha kifo cha kwanza kilichohusiana na virusi vya korona.
en-mt: This high was reached on the same day that Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus case and Zambia confirmed its first coronavirus-related death.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: Korea Kaskazini ilitangaza, kufikia Alhamisi, kuwa ilikuwa mojawapo ya nchi chache ambazo hazikuwa na maambukizi ya virusi vya korona.
en-mt: North Korea announced, as of Thursday, that it was one of the few countries that had no coronavirus infections.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Kufikia jana, Shirika la Afya Duniani liliripoti visa 1,051,635 vilivyothibitishwa, ikiwa ni pamoja na visa 79,332 katika saa ishirini na nne kabla ya 10 asubuhi, Saa za Ulaya ya Kati (0800 UTC) mnamo tarehe 4 Aprili.
en-mt: As of yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty-four hours before 10 a.m., Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Nchini Marekani, zaidi ya visa elfu 244 vya virusi vya korona vilirekodiwa, vikiunganisha angalua vifo 5,900.
en-mt: In the United States, more than 244,000 coronavirus cases were recorded, linking at least 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: CBS News iliripoti, ikitaja data ya Chuo Kikuu cha Johns Hopkins, kulikuwa na zaidi ya vifo 1,000 nchini Marekani siku ya Jumatano vilivyosababishwa na maambukizi virusi vya korona.
en-mt: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were more than 1,000 deaths in the U.S. on Wednesday attributed to coronavirus infections.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Kote duniani, nchi mbalimbali zilitangaza hatua madhubuti zaidi ili kuzuia ugonjwa huu kuenea.
en-mt: Around the world, various countries announced more effective measures to prevent the disease from spreading.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Siku ya Alhamisi, Sergei Sobyanin, meya wa Moscow, aliendelezwa kufungwa kwa shughuli za jiji hadi tarehe 1 Mei.
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, maintained the closure of city operations until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Kitaifa, Rais Vladimir Putin alitangaza kwamba Wananchi wa Urusi wataendelea kulipwa bila kuenda kazini hadi tarehe 30 Aprili.
en-mt: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin announced that Russians will continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Bunge la Ureno lilipiga kura ili kuongeza hali ya dharura ya kitaifa kwa siku 15; kura hiyo ilipita kwa kura 215 za uungwaji mkono, kumi za wabunge waliochagua kutoshiriki kura na kura moja ya aliyepinga.
en-mt: Portugal's parliament voted to extend the national emergency for 15 days; The vote passed with 215 votes of support, ten abstentions of MPs who chose not to participate and one vote for the opposer.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Saudi Arabia iliongeza siku ya kafyu katika miji mitakatifu ya Mecca na Medinaili kuendelea kwa siku nzima; awali, muda wa kafyu ulikuwa kati ya saa 3 jioni na 6 asubuhi.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia extended the day of kafyu in the holy cities of Mecca and the Medinail to continue for the rest of the day; Initially, Kafyu time was between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Thailand ilipanga kutekeleza kafyu kati ya saa 10 jioni na 4 asubuhi.
en-mt: Thailand planned to implement the kafyu between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Gavana wa Ohio, Mike DeWine alitangaza kuwa jimbo hilo liliongeza muda wa agizo la watu kukaa nyumbani hadi tarehe 1 Mei.
en-mt: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine announced that the state extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Maduka nchini Australia yalipunguza idadi ya karatasi shashi ambazo mtu angeweza kununua
en-mt: Shops in Australia reduced the number of paper slips one could buy

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Jioni ya siku za Jumapili na Jumamosi, maduka makubwa ya Australia ya Woolworths na Coles yalipunguza vikomo vyao vya ununuzi wa karatasi shashi hadi vifurishi viwili na kimoja mtawalia kwa kila muamala katika maduka yote katika ngazi ya kitaifa.
en-mt: On the evening of Sundays and Saturdays, Australian supermarkets Woolworths and Coles reduced their paper-based shopping spree limits to two and one package respectively per transaction across stores at national level.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI pia ilizindua kikomo cha kifurushi kimoja, siku ya Jumatatu.
en-mt: ALDI also unveiled a one-pack limit, on Monday.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Vikomo hivi vilichapishwa kama ujumbe katika maeneo ya malipo na kwenye kurasa za Facebook za maduka.
en-mt: These handouts were posted as messages in payment sites and on the mall's Facebook pages.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Wanunuzi waliripotiwa kununua bidhaa kwa wingi kutokana na hofu ya COVID-19 endapo watu wanahitaji kujitenga.
en-mt: Shoppers reportedly bought goods in bulk due to COVID-19 fears in case people need to self-isolate.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Siku ya Jumatano, Woolsworth pia iliweka vikomo kwa ununuzi wa karatasi shashi kutoka uwasilishaji nyumbani hadi kifurushi kimoja kwa kila agizo.
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolsworth also set limits on the purchase of paper slips from delivery at home to one package per order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Mabadiliko haya yalifuata vikomo vya awali vya vifurushi vinne kwa kila muamala vilivyowekwa na Woolsworths na Coles tarehe 4 na 5 Machi mtawalia.
en-mt: These changes followed the previous four package limits per transaction set by Woolsworths and Coles on 4 and 5 March respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Coles, katika taarifa yake kwa vyombo vya habari tarehe 8 Machi, iliripoti kwamba hata baada ya kuweka vikomo vya kifurushi cha karatasi nne, "maduka mengine bado yalikuwa yanauza bidhaa zote za karatasi ndani ya saa moja ya kuwasilishwa", na kutaja hitaji hilo kuwa "lisilotarajiwa", huku ALDI, kwenye chapisho la Facebook siku ya Jumanne ikilitaja kuwa "lisilotarajiwa".
en-mt: Coles, in a press release on March 8, reported that even after setting four paper package limits, "some stores were still selling all paper products within an hour of being delivered", calling the demand "unexpected", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday called it "unexpected".

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Mauzo yaliongezeka "kwa ongezo la juu" wiki jana, kulingana na mnenaji wa Wolsworths.
en-mt: Sales rose "at an all-time high" last week, according to a Wolsworths spokesman.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Duka la Costco kule Canberra pia liliweka vikomo kiwango kinachoruhusiwa kuwa vifurushi viwili wiki jana.
en-mt: The Costco store in Canberra also set the limit allowed to two packages last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Ili kukabiliana na upungufu, Coles waliangiza vifurushi vikubwa kutoka kwa bidha na kuongeza kwa mara ya kuwasilisha bidhaa, Woolworths waliagiza bidhaa za ziada, huku ALDI walitengeneza bidhaa kwa ajili ya mipango ya Jumatano maalum mapema zaidi.
en-mt: To cope with the shortage, Coles axed large packages from bidha and added to the delivery times, Woolworths ordered additional products, while ALDI developed products for special Wednesday plans much earlier.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman, mkurugenzi mtendaji wa Shirika la Wauzaji Rejareja nchini Australia, alisema kwamba wauzaji rejareja wajaribu kuongeza bidhaa, lakini vizuizi vya baraza la mitaa kuhusu wakati wa kuwasilisha bidhaa kwa gari vililemaza rai yake.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers should try to add products, but local council restrictions on when to deliver goods by car hampered his appeal.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Anatarajia kupanda kwa gharama za uzalishaji, huku wasambazaji bidhaa wakijaribu kukidhi mahitaji na mipango michache maalum.
en-mt: He expects rising production costs, with product distributors trying to meet demand with fewer specific initiatives.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Siku ya Jumanne, ALDI ilitangaza kwamba kutolewa mapema kwa bidhaa, baadhi ya maduka hayawezi kuendesha mpango wa Jumatano maalum.
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that the early release of products, some stores cannot run a Wednesday special program.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Kwenye ripoti ya News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, mtaalamu wa mauzo ya rejareja kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Teknolojia cha Queensland, alisema kwamba maduka yao hujaza bidhaa kila usiku.
en-mt: In the News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, a retail sales specialist from Queensland University of Technology, said that their stores fill up with goods every night.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Alitaja kwamba karatasi shashi ni bidhaa kubwa, inayosababisha idadi ndogo ya bidhaa na zikiuzwa, huacha sehemu kubwa za rafu zao zikiwa tupu na kuongeza hisia ya upungufu.
en-mt: He pointed out that paper shelves are a big commodity, resulting in a small number of products and when sold, they leave large portions of their shelves empty and add to the feeling of scarcity.

sourceString: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: Coles na Woolworths zina mtazamo kwamba ikiwa kulikuwa na bidhaa za kutosha kwenye rafu, ikiwa bidhaa kama vile karatasi shashi na kieuzi zingeweza kununuliwa na zipatikane kwa wingi, kuna uwezekano wa kupunguza wasiwasi, alisema Russell Zimmerman kwa mujibu wa ABC News.
en-mt: Coles and Woolworths are of the view that if there were enough products on the shelves, if products such as paper and kielbs could be purchased and made available in bulk, it would likely ease concerns, Russell Zimmerman said according to ABC News.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Kampuni inayotengeneza karatasi shashi kutokana na karatasi zilizotumika Who Gives a Crap ilisema siku ya Jumatano iliyopita kwamba waliuza bidhaa zao zote.
en-mt: A company that makes paper shashi from used paper Who Gives a Crap said last Wednesday that they sold all their products.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: Kimberly-Clark, kampuni inayotengeneza Kleenex Toilet Tissue na Solaris Paper inayotengeneza Sorbent, zilisisitiza kwamba zilizkuwa zinafanya kazi saa 24/7 ili kudumisha usambazaji wa bidhaa, kulingana na ripoti ya News.com.au.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, the company that manufactures Kleenex Toilet Tissue and Solaris Paper that manufactures Sorbent, insisted they were working 24/7 hours to maintain supply of products, according to the News.com.au report.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com, eneo la makazi, iliripoti kwamba baadhi ya wauzaji wa mali walitoa karatasi shashi kwa dalali wa kwanza katika mnanda kule Melbourne, wakati minada michache ilifanywa kwa sababu ya wanunuzi kupata likizo kutokana na wikendi mrefu wa Siku ya Leba.
en-mt: Domain.com, a residential area, reported that some property sellers gave a paper sash to the first broker at a tavern in Melbourne, while fewer auctions were held due to buyers getting holidays due to the long Labor Day weekend.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Toleo la Alhamisi la NT News, gazeti linalochapishwa kila siku kule Darwin, lilijumuisha sehemu yenye kurasa nane za kukatwa na kutumika kama karatasi shashi.
en-mt: Thursday's edition of the NT News, a daily newspaper in Darwin, included an eight-page cut-out section and used as a sash sheet.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Maduka awali hayakutaka kuweka vizuizi, kulingaa na ripoti kutoka ABC Australia tarehe 3 Machi ambapo walisema kwamba hawana mipango ya kuweka vizuizi vya ununuzi.
en-mt: Stores initially did not want to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to impose restrictions on shopping.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman aliongeza kwamba bidhaa nyingine pia zina hitaji la juu, ikiwa ni pamoja na barakoa, vieuzi, vyakula vikavu, sabuni kuosha mikono na unga.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other products also have a higher need, including masks, solvents, dry foods, soap to wash hands and flour.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Vilevile, nje ya Australia, siku ya Jumapili jioni, duka la mtandaoni la Uingereza Ocado lilionekana kupunguza ununuzi wa karatasi shashi za Andres hadi vifurishi viliwi vya karatasi 12.
en-mt: Similarly, outside Australia, on Sunday evening, UK online store Ocado appeared to limit Andres' paper purchases to 12 paper packs.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani limetangaza ugonjwa ulioenea sana wa COVID-19
en-mt: The World Health Organization has declared COVID-19

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Jumatano, Shirika la Afya Duniani lilitangaza kuendelea kuzuka kwa COVID-19 — ugonjwa unaosababishwa na virusi vya korona SARS-CoV-2 — kuwa janga kubwa.
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization declared the continued outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — a major pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Ingawa neno "janga kubwa" linaashiria jinsi ugonjwa ulivyoenea sana, sio jinsi hatari visa maalum vilivyo, Shirika la Afya Duniani liliona umuhimu wa kuhimiza mataifa kuchukuwa hatua:
en-mt: Although the term "big pandemic" refers to how widespread the disease is, not how dangerous the specific cases are, the World Health Organization saw the importance of encouraging nations to act:

sourceString: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: Nchi zote zinaweza bado kubadilisha mkondo wa janga hili kubwa.
en-mt: All countries can still change the course of this great tragedy.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Ikiwa nchi zitatambua, pima, tibu, tenga, fuatilia na kuhamasisha watu wao katika itikio, alisema Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Mkurugenzi-Mkuu wa Shirika la Afya Duniani.
en-mt: If countries identify, measure, treat, isolate, monitor and mobilize their populations in response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Director-General of the World Health Organization.

sourceString: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
targetString: Tunahangaiko kubwa na viwango vya maambukizi na ukali na viwango vya kuogofya ya kutotenda.
en-mt: We are deeply concerned with infection rates and the severity and alarming levels of inaction.

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa Dkt. Tom Frieden, aliyekuwa mkurugenzi wa Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa wa Marekani, janga hili kubwa "halina kifani."
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, former director of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, this major pandemic is "unparalleled."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Alisema, katika maoni yaliyochapishwa na CNN Februari, "bali na homa ya mafua, hakuna virusi vyovyote vya kupumua vilivyofuatiliwa kutoka kuenea hadi kuendelea kuenea kimataifa."
en-mt: He said, in an opinion piece published by CNN in February, "other than the flu, none of the respiratory viruses have been traced from spread to continued global spread."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus alitoa maoni sawa na hayo, akisema "hatujawahi kuona janga kubwa lililosababishwa na virusi vya korona hapo awali."
en-mt: Ghebreyesus made a similar comment, saying "we have never seen a pandemic caused by the coronavirus before."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Aliendelea, "na hatujawahi kuona janga kubwa linaloweza kudhibitiwa kwa wakati mmoja."
en-mt: He continued, "and we've never seen a major manageable pandemic at the same time."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Hali mpya kama janga kubwa inafuatia uamuzi wa Shirika la Afya Duniani katika Januari kutangaza kuzuka kwa ugonjwa huu kuwa hali ya dharura wa afya ya umma ya hangaiko la kimataifa.
en-mt: The new status as a major pandemic follows the World Health Organization's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Mkurugenzi wa Taasisi ya Kitaifa wa Mzio na Ugonjwa wa Kuambukiza, Dkt. Anthony Fauci, alisema kuhusu kuzuka kwa ugonjwa, "cha msingi, inaenda kuwa mbaya zaidi."
en-mt: The director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "fundamentally, it's going to get worse."

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Kufikia Alhamisi, Shirika la Utangazaji Marekani iliripoti kulikuwa na angalau visa 126,000 ya COVID-19 ulimwenguni, iliyosababisha vifo zaidi ya 4,600.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the U.S. Broadcasting Corporation reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Janga kubwa la 2019–20 la virusi ya korona ni janga kubwa linaloendelae ya ugonjwa wa virusi ya korona 2019 (COVID-19), inayosababishwa na ugonjwa wa matatizo mabaya ya kupumua virusi vya korona 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is a major ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Kuzuka kwa ugonjwa ilitambuliwa Wuhan, Uchina, Desemba 2019, lilitangazwa kuwa Hangaiko ya Hali ya Dharura ya Afya ya Umma wa Kimataifa tarehe 30 Januari 2020, na kutambuliwa kama janga kubwa tarehe 11 Machi 2020.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared a Global Public Health Emergency on 30 January 2020, and identified as a major epidemic on 11 March 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 10 Aprili 2020, takriban visa milioni 1.61 vya COVID-19 vimeripotiwa katika mataifa na himaya 210, na kusababisha takriban vifo 97,000.
en-mt: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million COVID-19 cases have been reported in 210 nations and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Takriban watu 364,000 wamepona.
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Viwango vha Visa vya vifo imekadiriwa kuwa 4% Uchina, ilhali kimataifa ni tofauti kutoka 13.04% Algeria hadi .08% New Zealand.
en-mt: The death rate is estimated at 4% in China, while globally it varies from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Dalili za kawaida ni pamoja na joto jingi, kikohozi na kushindwa kupumua vizuri.
en-mt: Common symptoms include high temperature, cough and inability to breathe properly.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Matatizo yanaweza kuwa ni pamoja na mchochota wa pafu na ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu yaliyofungana.
en-mt: Complications can include a strained lung and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Wakati kutoka kuambukizwa hadi kuonekana kwa dalili kwa kawaida ni karibu siku tano, lakini huenda ikawa kati ya siku mbili hadi kumi na nne.
en-mt: The time from infection to symptomatic appearance is usually about five days, but it may be between two and fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Hakuna chanjo inayojulikana au matibabu maalum ya kinzavirusi.
en-mt: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Matibabu ya msingi ni kutibu dalili ya ugonjwa na tiba saidizi. Hatua zilizopendekezwa vya kuzuia ni pamoja na kuosha mikono, kufunika mdomo wako unapokohoa, kudumisha umbali na watu wengine, na ufuatiliaji na kujitenga mwenyewe kwa watu wanaoshuku wameambukizwa.
en-mt: The primary treatment is to treat the symptoms of the disease with supportive therapy. Recommended preventive measures include washing hands, covering your mouth when you cough, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and isolating yourself for people who suspect they are infected.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Mashirika ulimwenguni wamechukuwa hatua kwa kuweka vikwazo dhidi ya kusafiri, kuweka karantini, vipindi vya kutotembea, vizuizi vya hatari kazini, na kufungwa kwa majengo.
en-mt: Organizations around the world have taken action by imposing restrictions on travel, quarantines, periods of no movement, hazardous restrictions at work, and building closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Janga hili kubwa limesababisha machafuko makubwa ya kijamii na kiuchumi, kuahirishwa au kukatishwa kwa matukio ya spoti, ya kidini, kisiasa na kitamaduni, na kuenea kwa upungufu wa bidhaa kutokana na ununuzi kwa hofu.
en-mt: This great tragedy has led to great social and economic unrest, postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of goods due to panic buying.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Shule na vyuo vikuu zimefungwa katika msingi wa kimataifa au la eneo husika katika nchi 193, na kuathiri takriban asilimia 99.4 ya idadi ya wanafunzi duniani.
en-mt: Schools and universities are closed on a global or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent of the world's student population.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Uwongo kuhusu virusi imeenea mtandaoni, na kumekuwa na matukio ya ubaguzi wa watu kutoka nchi zingine na ubaguzi dhidi ya Wachina, watu wengine kutoka maeneo ya Mashariki na Kusini-mashariki ya Asia au kuwa na mwonekano huo, na wengine kutoka maeneo yaliyo na visa vingi ya virusi.
en-mt: Rumours about the virus have spread online, and there have been instances of discrimination by people from other countries and discrimination against the Chinese, some people from Eastern and South-East Asian areas or having the same visibility, and some from areas with high cases of the virus.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Kufuatia usafiri uliopungua na kufungwa kwa viwanda vikubwa, kumekuwa na upungufu wa uchafuzi wa hewa na uzalishaji wa kaboni.
en-mt: Following reduced transport and the closure of large factories, there has been a reduction in air pollution and carbon emissions.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Mashirika ya Afya Wuhan, Uchina (mji mkuu wa mkoa wa Hubei) waliripoti visa vya mchochota wa pafu zisizo na chanzo inayojulikana tarehe 31 January 2019, na uchunguzi ulianzishwa mwanzo wa January 2020.
en-mt: Health Agencies in Wuhan, China (capital of Hubei province) reported cases of undetected particulate carcinoma on 31 January 2019, and the investigation was launched in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Visa hivyo zilihusiana na Soko la Vyakula vya Baharini la Jumla la Huanan na kwa hivyo virusi inadhaniwa kuwa na chanzo cha kusambazwa kutoka wanyama kwa binadamu.
en-mt: The cases were related to the Huanan Wholesale Seafood Market and therefore the virus is thought to have a source of transmission from animals to humans.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Virusi vilivyosababisha kuzuka kwa ugonjwa vinajulikana kama SARS-CoV-2, virusi vipya vilivyogunduliwa na vinavyohusiana na virusi vya korona vya popo, virusi vya korona vya kakakuona, na SARS-CoV.Mtu wa kwanza kujulikana na dalili alitambuliwa kuugua tarehe 1 Desemba 2019, na mtu huyo hakuwa na uhusiano unaoonekana na yeyote katika soko hilo.
en-mt: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered and related virus of bat coronavirus, cocoa coronavirus, and SARS-CoV.The first known person with symptoms was identified as sick on December 1, 2019, and the person had no visible connection to anyone in the market.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Katika matukio ya hapo mbeleni zilizoripotiwa Desemba 2019, theluthi mbili zilipatikana kuwa na uhusiano na soko hilo.
en-mt: In the past incidents reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to be related to the market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Tarehe 13 March 2020, ripoti isiyoweza kuthibitishwa kutoka Gazeti la Uchina Kusini ya Asubuhi ilisema kuwa kuna kisa kilichofuatiliwa hadi 17 Novemba 2019, katika mtu mwenye umri wa 55 kutoka mkoa wa Hubei, huenda ikawa kisa cha kwanza.Tarehe 26 Februari 2020, Shirika la Afya Duniani iliripoti kuwa, jinsi visa vipya vinavyosemekana zilizidi kupungua Uchina lakini zikazidi Italia, Irani, na Korea Kusini, idadi ya visa vipya nje ya Uchina ilizidi nambari ya visa vipya katika Uchina kwa mara ya kwanza.
en-mt: On 13 March 2020, an unconfirmed report from South China Morning newspaper said that a case traced to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old man from Hubei province, may be the first case. On February 26, 2020, the World Health Organization reported that, as new cases were said to have decreased in China but exceeded Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China exceeded the number of new cases in China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Huenda kukawa kutoripotiwa kwa kesi vikubwa, hasa kati ya walio na dalili hafifu.
en-mt: There may be a lack of serious cases, especially among those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Kufikia 26 Februari, angalau visa vichache viliripotiwa katika vijana, wale walio na umri 19 na chini wakiwa hadi 2.4% ya visa ulimwenguni.Mshauri Mkuu wa Kisayansi wa Uingereza, Patrick Vallance, alikadiria kuwa 60% ya idadi ya Uingereza watahitaji kuambukizwa kabla ya kinga fanifu itapatikana kupitia chanjo.
en-mt: As of 26 February, at least a handful of cases were reported in young people, those aged 19 and under accounting for up to 2.4% of cases globally. The UK's Chief Scientific Adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the UK population would need to be infected before effective immunity could be achieved through vaccination.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Visa inamaanisha idadi ya watu waliopimwa kwa COVID-19, na kipimo chao kuthibitishwa kuwa chanya kulingana na itifaki rasmi.
en-mt: Cases mean the number of people who have tested positive for COVID-19, with their test confirmed positive according to official protocol.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Kufikia 23 Machi, hakuna nchi iliyopima zaidi ya 3% ya idadi ya watu, na nchi nyingi zimekuwa na sera rasmi kutopima wale walio na dalili hafifu tu, kama Italia, Uholanzi, Uhispania, na Uswisi.
en-mt: As of March 23, no country has tested more than 3% of the population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Utafiti uliochapishwa tarehe 16 Machi iligundua kuwa China, kufikia tarehe 23 Januari, idadi inayokadiriwa kuwa 86% ya maambukizi ya COVID-19 hayakuwa yamegunduliwa na kwamba maambukizi haya ambayo hayakuwa yamenakiliwa yalikuwa chanzo cha maambukizi kwa 79% za visa vilivyonakiliwa.
en-mt: A study published on 16 March found that in China, as of 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected and that these undocumented infections were the source of infection in 79% of documented cases.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa takwimu iliyochapishwa 30 Machi ilikadiria kuwa nambari ya maambukizi Italia zilikuwa zaidi sana kuliko visa vilivyoripotiwa.
en-mt: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that Italy's infection numbers were significantly higher than the reported cases.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Makisio ya hapo awali ya nambari msingi wa uzalishaji (R0) wa COVID-19 ulikuwa 1.4 hadi 2.4.
en-mt: The previous numerical estimate based on production (R0) for COVID-19 was 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Uchunguzi uliochapishwa na Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa Marekani imekata kauli kuwa inaweza kuwa 5.7.
en-mt: A study published by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has ruled out that it could be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Watu wengi walio na COVID-19 hupona.
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Kwa wale ambao hawaponi, muda kutoka kuonekana kwa dalili hadi kifo imekuwa kati ya siku 6 na 41, nambari za siku ya kawaida ikiwa 14.
en-mt: For those who do not recover, the time from symptomatic appearance to death has been between 6 and 41 days, the normal day numbers being 14.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Kufikia 10 Aprili 2020, takriban vifo 97,000 zilihusishwa na COVID-19.
en-mt: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths were attributed to COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Katika Uchina, kufikia 5 Februari kadri 80% ya vifo zilikuwa kwa wale walio na umri zaidi ya 60, na 75% walikuwa na hali za kiafya hapo awali pamoja na magonjwa ya moyo na mishipa na kisukari.Takwimu rasmi ya vifo kutokana na janga kubwa la COVID-19 kwa ujumla humaanisha watu waliofariki ambao walipimwa na kuwa chanya kwa COVID kulingana na itifaki rasmi.
en-mt: In China, as of 5 February 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had previously diagnosed health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes. The official death count from the major COVID-19 pandemic generally refers to people who died who tested positive for COVID according to official protocol.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Nambari ya hakika ya vifo kutoka COVID-19 huenda ikawa zaidi, kwa vile huenda isijumuishe watu wanaofariki bila kupimwa - k.m. nyumbani, katika vyumba vya uuguzi, n.k.
en-mt: The definitive death toll from COVID-19 is likely to be higher, as it may not include people who die untested — e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Data ya kiasi fulani tu kutoka Italia ilipata kuwa nambari ya vifo ya ziada katika janga kubwa ilizidisha takwimu rasmi ya vifo vya COVID kwa kipengele cha 4-5x.
en-mt: Only somewhat quantitative data from Italy found that the excess death toll in a major pandemic exceeded the official COVID death figure by a factor of 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Msemaji wa Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa Marekani alikiri "Tunafahamu kuwa [takwimu iliyotajwa ya vifo] ni kadirio la chini", kauli inayothibitishwa na ripoti zilizothibitishwa ya kuhesabu duni katika Marekani. Kadirio la chini mara nyingi hutokea katika janga kubwa, kama ugonjwa wa mlipuko wa homa ya mafua ya nguruwe ya 2009 H1N1.Kifo cha kwanza iliyothibitishwa ilikuwa Wuhan tarehe 9 Januari 2020.
en-mt: A spokesman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention acknowledged "We know that [the cited mortality figure] is a low estimate", a statement corroborated by verified reports of poor counting in the US. Low estimation often occurs in a major pandemic, like the 2009 H1N1 swine flu outbreak. The first confirmed death was Wuhan on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Kifo cha kwanza nje ya Uchina Bara ilitokea tarehe 1 Februari katika Ufilipino, na ya kwanza nje ya Asia ilikuwa Ufaransa tarehe 14 Februari.
en-mt: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first outside Asia was in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Kufikia 28 Februari, nje ya Uchina Bara, zaidi ya vifo kadhaa zilirekodiwa Irani, Korea Kusini, na Italia.
en-mt: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Kufikia 13 Machi, zaidi ya nchi arobaini walikuwa wameripoti vifo, katika kila bara isipokuwa Antaktika.Hatua kadhaa hutumika kuhesabu vifo.
en-mt: By 13 March, more than forty countries had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are used to count deaths.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Nambari hizi hutofautiana na eneo na wakati unapozidi, huathiriwa na kiwango cha kupima, ubora wa mfumo wa utunzaji wa afya, aina ya matibabu, wakati wa kutokea kwa kwanza, na hali ya idadi ya watu kama umri, jinsia, na hali ya afya kwa ujumla.Kiwango cha kifo hadi kisa huonyesha nambari ya vifo ikigawanywa na nambari ya visa vilivyotambuliwa katika muda fulani.
en-mt: These numbers vary by location and when they are overweight, influenced by the rate of testing, quality of the health care system, type of treatment, when they first occur, and demographic status such as age, gender, and overall health status. The death-to-case rate reflects the death toll divided by the number of cases identified in a given time frame.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Kulingana na takwimu ya Chuo Kikuu cha Johns Hopkins, uwiano wa kimataifa ya kifo-hadi-kisa ni 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) kufikia 10 Aprili 2020.
en-mt: According to Johns Hopkins University data, the global death-to-death ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Idadi inatofautiana kulingana na eneo.
en-mt: The number varies depending on the area.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Nchini China, makadirio ya kiwango cha vifo kikilinganishwa na kisa yalipungua kutoka 17.3% (kwa watu waliokuwa na dalili kuanzia tarehe 1–10 Januari 2020) hadi 0.7% (kwa watu waliokuwa na dalili kuanzia tarehe 1 Februari 2020).Vipimo vingine ni pamoja na kiwango cha vifo kwa kila kisa (CFR), ambacho kinaangazia asilimia ya watu waliopimwa ambao wanakufa kutokana na ugonjwa, kiwango cha vifo kutokana na maambukizi (IFR), ambacho kinaangazia asilimia ya watu walioambukizwa (waliopimwa na ambao hawakupimwa) wanaokufa kutokana na ugonjwa.
en-mt: In China, the estimated death rate compared to the case decreased from 17.3% (for people who had symptoms from 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for people who had symptoms as of 1 February 2020). Other metrics include the mortality rate per case (CFR), which highlights the percentage of tested people who die from the disease, the rate of deaths from infection (IFR), which highlights the percentage of infected people (tested and untested) dying from the disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Takwimu hizi hazifungiwi na kigezo cha muda na zinafuata idadi mahususi ya watu kuanzia tukio la maambukizi hadi kutatuliwa kwa kisa.
en-mt: These data are not bound by a time parameter and follow a specific population from the occurrence of infection to the resolution of the case.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Idadi ya wasomi wamejaribu kuhesabu nambari hizi kwa idadi ya watu maalum.
en-mt: A number of scholars have tried to account for these numbers for specific populations.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: Kituo cha Dawa Zinazotegemea Ushahidi cha Chuo Kikuu cha Oxford kinakadiria kwamba viwango vya vifo kutokana na maambukizi kwa ajili ya janga kubwa kikamilifu ni kati ya 0.1% na 0.39%.
en-mt: Oxford University's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that death rates from infection for a fully serious epidemic range from 0.1% to 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Makadirio ya juu ya asilimia hii inalingana na matokeo kutoka kupimwa kwa nasibu Kwa COVID-19 Ujerumani, na uchunguzi wa takwimu kuchunguza athari ya kupima kwa makadirio ya CFR.
en-mt: The highest estimate of this percentage corresponds to results from Random Testing For COVID-19 Germany, and a statistical study examining the effect of testing on CFR estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani yadai kuwa janga hili kubwa linaweza kudhibitiwa.
en-mt: The World Health Organization claims that this massive epidemic can be controlled.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Kilele cha na muda hatimaye wa kuzuka kwa ugonjwa huu haijulikani na huenda ikatofautiana na eneo.
en-mt: The peak and duration of the outbreak is unknown and may vary by region.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Boni wa Chuo Kikuu cha Penn State alisema, "Zisipofuatiliwa, kuzuka kwa maambukizi kwa kawaida huendelea kisha huanza kupungua wakati ugonjwa inaishiwa watu wa kuambukizwa.
en-mt: Maciej Boni of Penn State University said, "Unless tracked, the outbreak usually continues and then begins to subside when the disease runs out of people to be infected.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Lakini ni vigumu kukadiria au kuwa na makadirio elekevu kwa sasa kuhusu wakati huo ni lini".
en-mt: But it's hard to estimate or have a rough estimate at the moment about when that is."

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Mshauri mkuu wa serikali ya Uchina Zhong Nanshan alisema kuwa "huenda ikakoma kufikia Juni" ikiwa nchi zote huweza kuhamasishwa kufuata ushauri wa Shirika la Afya Duniani kwa hatua za kukoma kuenea kwa virusi.
en-mt: China's top government adviser Zhong Nanshan said it would "probably cease by June" if all countries could be encouraged to follow World Health Organization advice for measures to stop the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Tarehe 17 Machi, Adam Kucharski Taasisi ya London ya Usafi wa Kiafya & Tiba ya Kitropiki alisema kuwa SARS-CoV-2 "itaendelea kuenea, kuna uwezekano wa mwaka moja au mbili".
en-mt: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski at the London Institute for Hygiene & Tropical Medicine said that SARS-CoV-2 "will continue to spread, likely in a year or two".

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa uchunguzi wa Chuo cha Imperial inayoongozwa na Neil Ferguson, kudumisha umbali na watu na hatua zingine zitahitajika "hadi chanjo ipatikane (kuna uwezekano wa miezi 18 au zaidi)".
en-mt: According to an Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, maintaining distance from people and other measures will be required "until a vaccine is available (likely 18 months or more)".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner wa Chuo Kikuu cha Vanderbilt University alisema, "Nadhani hakuna uwezekano kuwa hii virusi vya korona—kwa sababu inambukizwa kwa urahisi—itapotea kabisa" na huenda ikawa "ikawa ugonjwa wa msimu, ikitokea kila mwaka".
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University said, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so easily contagious—will disappear completely" and it will likely "become a seasonal disease, occurring every year."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Hali ya kuwa sugu wa kurejea itategemea chanjo kupatikana na kiwango cha mabadiliko ya virusi.
en-mt: The nature of being resistant to relapse will depend on a vaccine being found and the level of mutation of the virus.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Dalili za COVID-19 huweza kuwa si maalum na watu waliambukizwa huweza kuwa hawaonyeshi dalili yoyote.
en-mt: COVID-19 symptoms may not be specific and infected people may not show any symptoms.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Dalili za kawaida mbili ni joto jingi (88%) na kikohozi kavu (68%).
en-mt: The two most common symptoms are high temperature (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Dalili zisizo za kawaida ni pamoja na uchovu, utoaji wa kikohozi ya kupumua (kohozi), kupoteza hisia ya kunusa, kushindwa kupumua vizuri, maumivu wa misuli na viungo, maumivu ya koo, kuumwa na kichwa, kuhisi baridi, kutapika, kukohoa damu, kuendesha, au ngozi kuwa na rangi ya samawati. Shirika la Afya Duniani inasema kuwa takriban mtu moja kati ya sita huugua sana na huwa na shida kupumua.
