en-mt: Unusual symptoms include fatigue, the release of a respiratory cough (cough), loss of a sense of smell, failure to breathe properly, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, feeling cold, vomiting, coughing blood, running, or skin becoming blue. According to the World Health Organization, about one in six people get seriously ill and have trouble breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa Marekani huoredhesha dalili za dharura kama kushindwa kupumua vizuri, maumivu wa kifua inayoendelea au mbano, wasiwasi ya ghafla, ugumu kutembea, uso au midomo ya rangi ya samawati; matibabu ya haraka inashauriwa ikiwa dalili hizi zipo.Kuendelea kwa ugonjwa huweza kusababisha mchochota wa pafu mbaya, ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu yaliyofungana, maambukizi ya viungo mwilini, mshtuko na kifo.
en-mt: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention classifies emergency symptoms such as failure to breathe properly, persistent chest pain or hemorrhage, sudden anxiety, difficulty walking, face or pale lips; Immediate treatment is recommended if these symptoms are present. The continuation of the disease can lead to a serious snoring, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, organ infections, seizures and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Wengine kati ya watu walioambukizwa huenda wasionyeshe dalili zozote, bila dalili zozote za kimatibabu lakini matokeo yao ya kupimwa yanathibitisha kwamba wameambukizwa, kwa hivyo watafiti wametoa ushauri kwamba wale waliogusana na watu ambao wamethibitishwa kuambukizwa wanapaswa kufuatiliwa na kuchunguzwa ili kuondoa hofu ya maambukizi.
en-mt: Some of the infected people may not show any symptoms, without any medical symptoms but their test results confirm they are infected, so researchers have issued advice that those who have come into contact with people who have been confirmed infected should be monitored and screened to allay fears of infection.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: Wachina wanakadiria safu ya kipimo cha watu wasioonyesha dalili kuanzia chache hadi 44%.
en-mt: The Chinese estimate a measured range of people showing no symptoms ranging from a few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Kipindi cha kawaida ya kuwepo kwa dalili za ugonjwa (kipindi kati ya kuambukizwa na kuonekana kwa dalili) huanzia siku moja hadi 14; kwa kawaida ni siku tano.Kwa mfano wa kutokuwa na hakika, kadirio ya sehemu ya watu walio na COVID-19 waliopoteza hisia yao ya kunusa ilikuwa hapo awali 30% na baadaye ikashuka hadi 15%.
en-mt: The normal period of presence of symptoms (the period between infection and appearance of symptoms) ranges from one to 14 days; It's usually five days. In an example of uncertainty, the approximation of the share of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later dropped to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: maelezo mengine kuhusu jinsi ugonjwa huu huambukizwa bado yana chunguzwa.
en-mt: Other details about how the disease is transmitted are still being studied.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Ugonjwa huu huaminika kuambukizwa kimsingi wakati wa kuwa karibu na kwa matone yanayotoka wakati wa kukohoa, kupiga chafya, au kuzungumza; na mtu aliyekaribu kuwa mita 1 hadi 2 (futi 3 hadi 6).
en-mt: The disease is believed to be transmitted primarily while being in close proximity and by droplets coming out while coughing, sneezing, or talking; and the nearest person being 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 ft).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Uchunguzi zimetambua kuwa kukohoa bila kufunika mdomo huweza kuwezesha matone kusafiri hadi mita 4.5 (futi 15) hadi mita 8.2 (futi 27).
en-mt: Studies have found that coughing without a mouth covering can enable droplets to travel up to 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Watu wengine wamependekeza kuwa virusi hivi pia huweza kusambazwa kwa matone madogo yanayosalia kwa muda mrefu hewani, yanayoweza kutoka wakati wa mazungumzo.Matone ya kupumua pia huweza kutoka wakati wa kupumua, pamoja na wakati wa kuzungumza, lakini virusi hivi kwa ujumla haziambukizwi kupitia hewa.
en-mt: Some people have suggested that the virus can also be transmitted by small droplets that remain long in the air, which can come out during conversations. Respiratory droplets can also come out during breathing, as well as while talking, but these viruses are generally not transmitted through the air.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Matone hayo huweza kufikia midomo au mapua ya watu walio karibu au kuvutwa hadi mapafu.
en-mt: The droplets can reach the lips or noses of people nearby or be inhaled to the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Taratibu zingine za kimatibabu kama vile kuwekewa mrija na uhuishaji wa moyo na mapafu (CPR) huweza kufanya majimaji ya kupumua kufukizwa hewani na kwa hivyo kusambazwa kupitia hewa.
en-mt: Other medical procedures such as tube and heart and lung reactivation (CPR) can make breathing fluids to be expelled into the air and therefore distributed through the air.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Pia inaweza kusambazwa wakati mtu anagusa sehemu iliyo na virusi, pamoja na ngozi, na kisha kugusa macho yao, pua, au mdomo.
en-mt: It can also be transmitted when someone touches a part containing the virus, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Ilhali kuna mashaka kuwa inaweza kusambazwa na kinyesi, hatari inaaminika kuwa duni.
en-mt: While there are doubts that it can be spread by feces, the risk is believed to be negligible.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Serikali ya Uchina ilipinga uwezekano wa kusambazwa kutoka kinyesi hadi mdomoni ya SARS-CoV-2.Virusi hivi huambukizwa sana siku tatu baada ya kuonekana kwa dalili, ingawa kusambazwa inawezekana kabla ya dalili kuonekana na katika hatua za baadaye ya ugonjwa.
en-mt: The Chinese government disputed the possibility of transmission from feces to the mouth of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is highly contagious three days after the appearance of symptoms, although transmission is possible before symptoms appear and in the later stages of the disease.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Watu wamepimwa na kupatikana chanya kwa ugonjwa hadi siku tatu kabla ya kuonekana kwa dalili inaonyesha kuwa kusambazwa inawezekana kabla dalili nyingi hazijatokea.
en-mt: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before the appearance of symptoms indicates that transmission is possible before most symptoms occur.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Kuna ripoti chache tu ya visa vilivyothibitishwa maabarani vya watu wasioonyesha dalili zozote ilhali wana virusi kuwepo, lakini visa vya watu walioambukizwa na wasioonyesha dalili zimetambuliwa na nchi zingine wakati wanafuatilia watu waliotangamana na wagonjwa.
en-mt: There are only a few reports of laboratory-confirmed cases of people who show no symptoms while they have the virus, but cases of infected and non-symptomatic people have been identified by other countries as they track people who have had contact with patients.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Kituo cha Kuzuia na Kudhibiti Magonjwa cha Ulaya (ECDC) kinataja kwamba ingawa si bayana kikamilifu ilivyo rahisi kwa ugonjwa huu kuenea, mtu mmoja kiujumla huwaambukiza watu wengin wawili au watatu.Virusi vina uwezo wa kusalia vikiwa hai kwa kwenye sehemu mbalimbali kwa muda wa saa hadi siku.
en-mt: The European Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC) says that while it is not fully clear how easy it is for the disease to spread, one person generally infects two or three people. The virus is able to remain alive in various places for hours to days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Haswa, virusi hivi vilipatikana kuwa na uwezo wa kugunduliwa hadi siku tatu kwenye plastiki na chuma cha pua kisichoingia kutu 304, kwa siku moja kwenye kadibodi, na hadi masaa nne kwa shaba.
en-mt: In particular, this virus was found to be detectable for up to three days in plastic and stainless steel not rusting 304, in one day on cardboard, and up to four hours in copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Hii, hata hivyo, hutofautiana kulingana na hali ya unyevunyevu na viwango vya nyuzi joto. Wanyama vipendwa na wanyama wengine wamepatikana na COVID-19.
en-mt: This, however, varies depending on humidity conditions and degrees of warmth. Loved ones and other animals have been diagnosed with COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Hakuna ushahidi kuwa wanyama wanaweza kusambaza virusi hivi kwa binadamu, lakini mamlaka ya Uingereza zinashauri kuosha mikono baada ya kugusa wanyama, kama baada ya kugusa sehemu watu walioambukizwa huenda waligusa.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can transmit the virus to humans, but British authorities advise washing hands after touching animals, as after touching a place infected people may have touched.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu yaliyofungana ya virusi ya korona 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ni virusi geni, ilipatikana kwanza kutoka watu watatu waliokuwa na mchochota wa pafu waliohusiana na visa vya magonjwa sugu ya kupumua Wuhan.
en-mt: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new virus, first found from three people with a lymph node associated with cases of chronic respiratory diseases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Dalili za virusi geni vya SARS-CoV-2 hutokea katika virusi vya korona vinavyohusiana ulimwenguni.Nje ya mwili wa binadamu, virusi hivi huuliwa na sabuni ya matumizi nyumbani, inayovunja ua linalolizingira.SARS-CoV-2 ina uhusiano wa karibu na SARS-CoV ya asili.
en-mt: Symptoms of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses worldwide. Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which breaks down the fence around it. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Inadhaniwa kuwa maambukizi kutoka wanyama hadi binadamu.
en-mt: It is thought to be transmitted from animals to humans.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Uchambuzi wa chembe za urithi imeonyesha kuwa virusi vya korona huungana na chembe cha virusi vya korona Beta, katika jamii ndogo ya virusi vya Sarbe (kizazi B) pamoja na aina mbili kutoka popo.
en-mt: Analysis of the inherited particles has shown that the coronavirus joins with the coronavirus Beta, in a small community of Sarbe virus (generation B) as well as two species from bats.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Ni kufanana kwa 96% katika kiwango cha chembe kwa sampuli zingine ya virusi vya korona katika popo (BatCov RaTG13).
en-mt: It is a 96% similarity in particle level to other coronavirus samples in bats (BatCov RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Katika Februari 2020, watafiti Wachina waligundua kuwa kuna tofauti moja tu ya asidi amino katika sehemu fulani ya utaratibu wa chembe kati ya virusi hivi kutoka kakakuona na vile kutoka binadamu.
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in a certain part of the particle order between this virus from the coagulation and the human one.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Ulinganisho wote wa chembe hadi sasa imegundua kwa hali ya juu 92% wa nyenzo ya chembe inayopatikana katika virusi vya korona ya kakakuona na SARS-CoV-2, ambayo haitoshi kuthibitisha kakakuona kuwa kiumbe wa vimelea wa kati.
en-mt: All particle comparisons have so far found at a high rate 92% of the particulate material found in the cocoa coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is not enough to prove kakaona to be an intermediate parasite organism.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Kuambukizwa kwa virusi hivi huweza kutambuliwa kwa muda kwa kuzingatia dalili, lakini uthibitisho ni kufuatia hatimaye mbinu ya kurejea chembe cha kemikali na mmenyuko mfulilizo (rRT-PCR) ya majimaji yaliyoambukizwa au upigaji picha za kimatibabu ya CT.
en-mt: The infection can be detected over time based on symptoms, but confirmation is following a chemical and chain reaction (rRT-PCR) technique of infected fluid or CT medical imaging.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Uchunguzi unaolinganisha PCR na CT katika Wuhan umependekeza kuwa CT kwa kadri kubwa ni bora kuliko PCR, ingawa si mahususi, na vipengele vyake vya picha kuingiliana na mchochota wa pafu mengine na taratibu za ugonjwa.
en-mt: Studies comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan have suggested that CT in large quantities is superior to PCR, though less specific, with its imaging components interacting with other stimulus and disease mechanisms.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Kufikia Machi 2020, Chuo cha Radiolojia Marekani hupendekeza kuwa "CT haifai kutumiwa kuchuja au kama njia ya kupima ya kwanza kutambua COVID-19".
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to filter or as the first testing method to identify COVID-19".

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: WHO imechapisha itifaki nyingi ya kupima RNA ya SARS-CoV-2, na chapisho la kwanza ikitolewa tarehe 17 Januari.
en-mt: The WHO has published a multi-layered RNA testing protocol for SARS-CoV-2, with the first publication being released on 17 January.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Jaribio linatumia kurejea chembe cha kemikali na mmenyuko mfululizo (rRT-PCR).
en-mt: The test uses chemical particle referencing and chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: Jaribio linaweza kufanywa kwa sampuli za kupumua au za damu.
en-mt: The test can be done with respiratory or blood samples.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Matokeo ujumla hupatikana ndani ya saa hadi siku chache.
en-mt: The results are generally achieved within hours to a few days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Kiujumla jaribio hili hutekelezwa kwa kutumia pamba ndani ya pua ingawa kuchukua sampuli kinywani pia huweza kutumika. Maabara kadhaa na kampuni zinatengeneza jaribio inayolenga damu mwilini, yanayotambua kinga za mwili.
en-mt: This test is generally carried out using cotton inside the nose although taking samples in the mouth can also be used. Several labs and companies are developing a blood-based test that detects the body's immune systems.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Kufikia 6 Aprili 2020, hakuna yoyote ya haya iliyothibitishwa kuwa halisi kuidhinishwa kwa matumizi na wengi.
en-mt: As of 6 April 2020, none of these have been authentically approved for use by the majority.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: Marekani jaribio la damu imeundwa na Cellex imeidhinishwa kwa matumizi ya dharura na maabara yaliyoidhinishwa pekee.
en-mt: The U.S. blood test is designed and Cellex is approved for emergency use by accredited laboratories only.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: Sifa za picha za radiolojia na picha za kimatibabu vya kompyuta (CT) ya watu ambao wameambukizwa ni pamoja na sehemu ya mapafu yenye shinikizo duni yasiyo na uwiano na kukosekana kwa mkusanyiko wa majimaji kati ya ukuta wa kifua na mapafu.
en-mt: Characteristics of radiological imaging and computerized medical imaging (CT) of individuals who have been infected include a portion of the lungs with poor unbalanced pressure and the absence of fluid accumulation between the chest wall and the lungs.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: Chama cha Radiolojia ya Italia inakusanya hifadhidata ya kimataifa mtandaoni ya matokeo ya picha za kimatibabu ya visa vilivyothibitishwa.
en-mt: The Italian Radiology Association is compiling an international online database of medical imaging results of confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Kutokana na kulandana na maambukizi mengine kama vile adenovirus, kutoa taswira bila kuthibitisha kwa njia ya PCR ina upungufu wa masuala mahususi katika kutambua COVID-19.
en-mt: Due to the synchronization of other infections such as adenovirus, visualizing without PCR verification falls short of specific issues in diagnosing COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Uchunguzi mkubwa Uchina ililinganisha matokeo ya picha ya kifua ya CT na ya PCR na kuonyesha kuwa ingawa picha za kimatibabu si maalum ya maambukizi, ni ya haraka na bora, kuonyesha kuzingatiwa kwake kama kifaa cha kuchuja watu katika maeneo ya janga.
en-mt: A major study in China compared the results of CT and PCR chest imaging and showed that although medical imaging is not infection-specific, it is faster and better, demonstrating its adherence as a filtering device for people in pandemic areas.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Programu za mtandaoni zilizoundwa na akili isiyo ya asili zimeundwa kugundua vipengele vya picha za kimatibabu ya virusi na picha za matibabu na CT.
en-mt: Online applications created by non-native intelligence are designed to detect aspects of viral medical imaging and medical and CT images.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Mikakati ya kuzuia kusambaza kwa ugonjwa ni pamoja na kudumisha usafi wa kibinafsi kwa ujumla, kuosha mikono, kuzuia kushika macho, pua, au mdomo na mikono ambayo haijaoshwa, na kukohoa au kupiga chafya kwenye tishu na kuweka tishu chafu moja kwa moja ndani ya chombo cha taka.
en-mt: Strategies to prevent the spread of the disease include maintaining general personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding holding eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing on tissues and placing dirty tissue directly into a waste container.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Wale ambao huenda wameambukizwa tayari wameshauriwa kuvaa barakoa ya kimatibabu hadharani.
en-mt: Those who may have been infected are already advised to wear a medical mask in public.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Hatua za kudumisha umbali pia hupendekezwa kuzuia usambazaji.Serikali nyingi zimeweka vizuizi au kushauri dhidi ya safari yoyote isiyo muhimu kuelekea na kutoka nchi na maeneo zilizoathirika na kuzuka kwa ugonjwa.
en-mt: Measures to maintain distance are also recommended to prevent distribution. Many governments have imposed restrictions or advised against any non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Hata hivyo, virusi hivi vimefikia hatua ya kusambaa katika jamii katika sehemu kadhaa ulimwenguni.
en-mt: However, the virus has reached the point of spreading in communities in several parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Hii inamaanisha kwamba virusi vinaenea ndani ya jumuiya na baadhi ya wanajumuiya hawafahamu ni wapi au jinsi walivyoambukizwa.Watoa huduma za matibabu waliomtibu mtu ambaye huenda wameambukizwa wanapendekezewa kutumia tahadhari za kawaida, tahadhari za waligusana na ulinzi wa jicho.Kufuatilia watu waliogusana ni njia muhimu ya mamlaka ya afya kubaini chanzo cha maambukizi na kuzuia usambazaji zaidi.
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading within the community and some members of the community have no idea where or how they were infected. Medical providers who have treated someone who may have been infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions and eye protection. Tracing contact tracing is an important way for health authorities to identify the source of infection and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Matumizi ya data ya eneo kutoka simu za rununu na serikali kwa matumizi haya imechochea wasiwasi kuhusu faragha, na shirika la Amnesty International na zaidi ya mashirika 100 mengine kutoa tangazo wakitaka kuwekwa kwa mipaka kwa ufuatiliaji kama huu.
en-mt: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this use has fuelled concerns about privacy, with Amnesty International and more than 100 other organisations issuing an announcement calling for limits on such surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Programu tofauti ya simu za rununu zimetekelezwa au kupendekezwa kwa matumizi ya hiari, na kufikia Aprili 7, 2020, zaidi ya vikundi kumi na mbili ya wataalam walikuwa wanaunda suluhisho yanayolinda faragha, kama vile kutumia Bluetooth kutuma umbali wa mtumizi na simu za rununu zingine.
en-mt: Different mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups were developing solutions that protect privacy, such as using Bluetooth to send user distances and other smartphones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Watumizi kisha wanapokea ujumbe ikiwa wamekuwa karibu na yeyote ambaye amepimwa na kupatikana na COVID-19.Uongo inaenea kuhusu jinsi ya kuzuia maambukizi; kwa mfano, kusafisha pua na kusukutua na michanganyiko ya kusafisha kinywa si fanifu.
en-mt: Users then receive a message if they have been in close proximity to anyone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Lies abound about how to prevent infection; for example, nose cleaning and rinsing and mouth cleaning combinations are not effective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Hakuna chanjo ya COVID-19, ingawa mashirika mengi wana shughulika kutengeneza moja.
en-mt: There is no vaccine for COVID-19, although many organizations are busy developing one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Inapendekezwa kuosha mikono ili kuzuia kuenea kwa ugonjwa.
en-mt: It is recommended to wash hands to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC inapendekeza watu waoshe mikono yao mara kwa mara kwa kutumia sabuni na maji kwa angalau sekunde ishirini, hasa baada ya kuenda chooni au ikiwa mikono yako yaonekana kuwa chafu; kabla ya kula; baada ya kupenga makamasi, kukohoa, au kupiga chafya.
en-mt: The CDC recommends people wash their hands regularly with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or if your hands appear dirty; before eating; after sneezing, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Hii ni kwa sababu nje ya mwili ya binadamu, virusi hivi huuliwa na sabuni ya matumizi nyumbani, ambayo hulipua povu yake ya ulinzi.
en-mt: This is because outside the human body, this virus is killed by household soap, which blows up its protective foam.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC inapendekeza zaidi kutumia kioevu cha mkononi yenye pombe cha kuua viini vya magonjwa chenye angalau asilimia 60 ya pombe kwa kiasi wakati sabuni na maji hazipatikani kwa urahisi.
en-mt: The CDC further recommends using an alcohol-based disinfectant liquid containing at least 60 percent alcohol in volume when soap and water are not readily available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO inashauri watu kutoshika macho, pua, au mdomo na mikono ambayo haijaoshwa.
en-mt: The WHO advises people not to hold their eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Sehemu zinazotumika huweza kusafishwa na kuua virusi kwa kutumia kemikali tofauti (katika dakika moja ya kutumia kemikali kwa sehemu iliyo na chuma cha pua kisichoingia kutu), pamoja na 62-71% ethanoli, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrojeni peroxide, na 0.2-7.5%povidone-iodine.
en-mt: Active parts can be cleaned and disinfected by using different chemicals (within one minute of applying chemicals to a component containing stainless steel that does not rust), including 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2-7.5%povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Suluhu nyingine, kama vile benzalkonium chloride na chrohexidine gluconate, hazijafanikiwa sana.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, have not been very successful.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC inapendekeza kuwa ikiwa kisa cha COVID inashukiwa au imethibitishwa katika jengo kama vile ofisi au shule za kuwatunza watoto, kila sehemu kama ofisi, bafu, sebule, vifaa za elektroniki kama kompyuta bapa, viguso, kibodi, rimoti, na mashine ya ATM zilizotumiwa na watu wagonjwa, yapaswa kusafishwa na dawa za kuua viini.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that if a case of COVID is suspected or confirmed in a building such as offices or childcare schools, every place like offices, bathrooms, living room, electronic devices like flat computers, faces, keyboards, remotes, and ATMs used by sick people, should be cleaned with disinfectants.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Mashirika ya afya zilipendekeza kuwa watu wafunike midomo na mapua kwa kutumia kiwiko iliyokunjwa au tishu wakati wanakohoa au kupiga chafya, na kutupa tishu yoyote mara moja.
en-mt: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouths and noses with a folded elbow or tissue when they cough or sneeze, and dispose of any tissue immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Barakoa ya kimatibabu hupendekezwa kwa wale ambao huenda wameambukizwa, kwa vile kuvaa barakoa huweza kudhibiti kiasi na umbali wa kusafiri kwa matone ya kupumua inayosambazwa unapozungumza, kupiga chafya, na kukohoa.
en-mt: A medical mask is recommended for those who may have been infected, as wearing a mask can control the amount and distance traveled by respiratory droplets transmitted while talking, sneezing, and coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: WHO imetoa maagizo ya wakati na jinsi ya kutumia barakoa.
en-mt: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa Stephen Griffin, mwanasayansi wa virusi katika Chuo Kikuu cha Leeds, "Kuvaa barakoa inaweza kupunguza uwezo [wa] watu kugusa uso yao, ambacho ni chanzo kubwa ya maambukizi bila usafi bora wa mikono. "Barakoa pia zimependekezwa kwa matumizi na wale wanaotunza yeyote ambaye anaweza kuwa na ugonjwa huu.
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virus scientist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can limit the ability [of] people to touch their face, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene." Masks are also recommended for use by those caring for anyone who may have the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: WHO inapendekeza kuvaa barakoa na watu wenye afya njema ikiwa tu wako hatarini, kama vile wale wanaotunza mtu aliye na COVID-19, ingawa wamekiri pia kuwa kuvaa barakoa huweza kusaidia watu kugusa nyuso zao.
en-mt: The WHO recommends wearing masks with healthy people only if they are at risk, such as those caring for someone with COVID-19, although they have also acknowledged that wearing masks can help people touch their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Nchi kadhaa zimeanza kuhimiza matumizi ya barakoa na watu wa umma.
en-mt: Several states have begun encouraging the use of masks by members of the public.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Marekani, CDC inapendekeza kuvaa barakoa isiyo ya kimatibabu bali iliyotengenezwa kwa kitambaa.Uchina imependekeza hasa matumizi ya barakoa ya kimatibabu zinazoweza kutupwa na watu walio na afya njema wa umma, hasa unapokaribia (mita 1 (futi 3) au kidogo) na watu wengine.
en-mt: In the US, the CDC recommends wearing a non-medical mask but made of cloth. China has specifically recommended the use of medical masks that can be discarded by healthy members of the public, especially when approached (1 meter (3 feet) or less) by other people.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Hong Kong inapendekeza kuvaa kwa barakoa ya kimatibabu unapotumia usafiri wa umma au kukaa sehemu ambapo kuna watu wengi.
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends wearing a medical mask when using public transport or sitting in a place where there are many people.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Maafisa wa afya Thailand wanahimiza watu kutengeneza barakoa kwa kutumia vitambaa nyumbani na kuviosha kila siku.
en-mt: Thai health officials are encouraging people to make masks with cloths at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Jamhuri ya Czech na Slovakia zilipiga marufuku kwenda nje hadharani bila kuvaa baragoa au kufunika mapua na mdomo yako.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a bra or covering your nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Tarehe 16 Machi, Vietnam iliomba kila mtu kuvaa baragoa wakati wanaenda maeneo hadharani ili kujilinda na wengineo.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam asked everyone to wear a mask when they go to public places to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Serikali ya Austria iliamrisha kila mtu anayeingia dukani lazima avae barakoa.
en-mt: The Austrian government ordered everyone who enters the store must wear a mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Israeli imeuliza wakazi wote kuvaa barakoa wakiwa hadharani.
en-mt: Israel has asked all residents to wear masks in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Taiwan, ambayo imekuwa ikizalisha barakoa milioni kumi kila siku tangu katikati ya mwezi Machi, ilihitaji abiria kwenye treni na basi za jiji hadi jiji kuvaa barakoa za uso mnamo tarehe 1.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing 10 million face masks daily since mid-March, required passengers on trains and city-to-city buses to wear face masks on the 1st date.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Panama imeifanya kuwa lazima kuvaa baragoa kila uendapo nje, ilhali pia inapendekeza utengenezaji wa baragoa nyumbani kwa wale ambao hawawezi kununua baragoa.
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory to wear baragoa whenever you go out, while it also recommends making baragoa at home for those who can't afford to buy baragoa.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Barakoa zimetumiwa sana Japan, Korea Kusini, Malaysia, na Singapore.
en-mt: Masks have been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Kukaa mbali ya jamii (pia inajulikana kama kutotangamana na watu) ni pamoja na vitendo vya kuthibiti maambukizi zinazonuiwa kupunguza usambazaji wa ugonjwa kwa kupunguza kugusana kati ya watu.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as non-contact with people) includes infection control practices intended to reduce the spread of the disease by reducing contact between people.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Mbinu ni pamoja na; vizuizi ya safari; kufungwa kwa shule, sehemu za kazi, viwanja, sinema, au maduka.
en-mt: Methods include; travel restrictions; the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, cinemas, or shops.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Watu wanaweza kufuata mbinu za kukaa mbali na jamii kwa kukaa nyumbani, kupunguza safari, kutoenda sehemu yenye watu wengi, kusalimiana bila kugusana, na kudumisha umbali na watu wengine.
en-mt: People can follow social distancing methods by staying home, limiting travel, not going to a crowded place, greeting each other without touch, and maintaining distance from other people.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Serikali nyingi sasa wameamrisha au kupendekeza kutotangamana na watu katika maeneo zilizoathirika na kuzuka kwa ugonjwa.
en-mt: Many governments have now ordered or recommended no contact with people in areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Ukubwa wa mkusanyiko wa watu inayopendekezwa na mashirika ya serikali ya US na mashirika ya afya ilipunguzwa haraka kutoka watu 250 (ikiwa hakuwepo na maambukizi ya COVID-19 katika eneo fulani) hadi watu 50, na baadaye hadi watu 10.
en-mt: The size of the gathering recommended by US government agencies and health agencies was quickly reduced from 250 people (if there was no COVID-19 infection in a particular area) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Tarehe 22 Machi 2020, Ujerumani ilipiga marufuku mkusanyiko wa umma zaidi ya watu wawili.Watu wazee na walw walio na hali za afya kama vile kisukari, ugonjwa wa moyo, ugonjwa wa kupumua, shinikizo la damu, na mfumo wa kinga ya mwili iliyoathirika huwa na hatari kubwa ya ugonjwa mahututi na matatizo na wameshauriwa na CDC kukaa nyumbani mara kadhaa iwezekanavyo katika sehemu ya kuzuka kwa ugonjwa katika jamii.Kuelekea mwisho wa Machi 2020, WHO na mashirika mengine ya afya walianza kubadilisha neno "kutotangamana na watu" na "kudumisha umbali na watu", kufafanua kuwa lengo ni kupunguza kugusana moja kwa moja ilhali ukidumisha uhusiano wa kijamii, ikiwa mtandaoni au kwa umbali.
en-mt: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned a public gathering of more than two people. Older and lw people with underlying health conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure, and compromised immune system have an increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as often as possible in the wake of outbreaks in the community. Towards the end of March 2020, WHO and other health organizations began to change the term "non-contact" to "maintain distance from people", clarifying that the goal is to reduce direct contact while maintaining social connection, whether online or at a distance.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Matumizi ya neno "kukaa mbali ya jamii" yamesababisha mintaarafu kwamba watu wanapaswa kujihusisha kwa kujitenga kijamii kikamilifu, kuliko kuwahimiza kuendelea kugusana na wengine kupitia njia mbadala.Baadhi ya mamlaka zimetoa miongozo ya afya ya ngono ya kutumia wakati wa janga kubwa.
en-mt: The use of the term "social distancing" has led to the suggestion that people should engage in full social distancing, rather than encouraging them to keep in touch with others through alternative means. Some jurisdictions have issued sexual health guidelines to use during a major pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Haya ni pamoja na mapendekezo kujamiana tu na mtu unayeishi naye, ambaye hana virusi au dalili ya virusi.
en-mt: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who has no virus or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Kujitenga-mwenyewe nyumbani imependekezwa kwa wale waliopatikana na COVID-19 na wale wanaoshuku kuwa wameambukizwa.
en-mt: Self-isolation at home is recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Mashirika ya afya zimetoa maagizo ya kina ya kujitenga-mwenyewe nyumbani kwa njia inayofaa.Serikali nyingi zimeagiza au kupendekeza karantini ya watu wanaoishi katika maeneo yaliyoathirika.
en-mt: Health organizations have issued detailed instructions for self-isolation at home in an appropriate manner. Many governments have ordered or recommended the quarantine of people living in affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Maagizo makali kuhusu kujiweka karantini yametolewa kwa wale walio katika vikundi vilivyo katika hatari kubwa.
en-mt: Strict instructions about quarantine have been issued to those in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Wale ambao huenda wamekuwa na mtu aliyena COVID-19 na wale ambao wamesafiri hivi karibuni kwenda nchi au eneo iliyo na usambazaji kubwa wameshauriwa kujiweka karantini kwa siku 14 kutoka wakati wa mwisho inawezekana walikuwa na aliyeambukizwa.
en-mt: Those who may have had someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently traveled to a country or area with high prevalence are advised to quarantine for 14 days from the last time it is possible they had an infected.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Mikakati katika uthibiti wa kuzuka kwa ugonjwa ni kuzuia kuongezeka au kukandamiza, na kuepukana.
en-mt: Strategies in disease outbreak control are to prevent escalation or suppression, and avoidance.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Kudhibitiwa kunaendeshwa katika awamu za mapema za mkurupuko na kunalenga kufuatilia na kuwatenga watu walioambukizwa pamoja na kuleta hatua nyingine za kudhibiti maambukizi na chanjo ili kukomesha ugonjwa kuenea kwa watu wengine.
en-mt: Containment is being run in the early phases of the outbreak and is aimed at tracking and isolating infected people as well as bringing in other infection control and vaccination measures to stop the disease spreading to other people.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Ikiwa haiwezekani tena kudhibiti maenezi ya ugonjwa , jitihada basi zinahamishwa katika awamu ya kuepukana: hatua zinachukuliwa ili kupunguza kuenea na kuepukana na athari zake kwenye mfumo wa tiba ya afya na jamii.
en-mt: If it is no longer possible to control the spread of the disease, efforts are then moved into the avoidance phase: measures are taken to reduce the spread and avoid its impact on the health and social treatment system.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Mchanganyiko wa hatua za kuzuia kuongezeka na kuepukana huweza kufanywa pamoja.
en-mt: A combination of escalation and avoidance measures can be done together.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Kukandamiza huitaji hatua ngumu ili kubadilisha janga kubwa kwa kupunguza nambari msingi wa uzalishaji kuwa chini ya 1.Sehemu ya kukabiliana na ugonjwa ya kuambukizwa ni kujaribu kupunguza kilele cha mlipuko, inayojulikana kama kusawazisha mlipuko wa janga.
en-mt: Suppression necessitates complex measures to reverse a major epidemic by reducing the number base of production to less than 1.The contagious disease response component is trying to reduce the peak of the outbreak, known as balancing the epidemic outbreak.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Hii hupunguza hatari ya huduma za afya kulemewa na hutoa muda zaidi kwa chanjo na matibabu kutengenezwa.
en-mt: This reduces the risk of healthcare being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Mikakati isiyo ya kifamasia inayoweza kudhibiti mkurupuko huu ni pamoja na hatua za kuzuia kibinafsi kama vile kuosha mikono, kuvaa barakoa za uso na kujiweka kwenye karantini; hatua za jumuiya zinazolenga kukaa mbali kijamii kama vile shule kufungwa na kukatishwa kwa matukio ya halaiki kukutana hadharani; mahusisho ya jumuiya ili kuhimiza kukubalika na kushiriki katika mikakati kama hiyo; pamoja na hatua za kimazingira kama vile kusafisha maeneo.Hatua kali zaidi zinazolenga kudhibiti mkurupuko zilichukuliwa nchini China pindi tu makali ya mkurupuko yalikuwa wazi, kama vile kuweka jiji nzima katika karantini na kuweka marufuku madhubuti dhidi ya usafiri.
en-mt: Non-pharmacological strategies that can control this outbreak include personal preventive measures such as washing hands, wearing face masks and quarantine; community measures aimed at social distancing such as school closures and cancellation of mass events to meet in public; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such strategies; as well as environmental measures such as cleaning areas. More stringent measures aimed at controlling the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak was clear, such as putting the entire city under quarantine and imposing a strict ban on travel.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Nchini zingine pia zimetekeleza hatua mbalimbali zinazolenga kupunguza kuenea kwa virusi.
en-mt: Other countries have also implemented various measures aimed at reducing the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Korea Kusini ilianzisha kupimwa kwa umma na karantini za maeneo, na kutoa tahadhari kwa usafiri ya watu walioambukizwa.
en-mt: South Korea introduced public testing and local quarantines, and alerted the travel of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Singapore ilitoa msaada wa kifedha kwa wale walioambukizwa na waliojiweka karantini na kutoza faini kubwa kwa wale waliokosa kufanya hivyo.
en-mt: Singapore provided financial assistance to those infected and quarantined and imposed heavy fines on those who did not.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Taiwan iliongeza utengenezaji wa barakoa za uso na kutoza faini kwa kuhodhi bidhaa za kimatibabu.
en-mt: Taiwan increased the production of face masks and fined for hoarding medical products.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Sera bora za kuepukana na ugonjwa huweza kupunguza kutakikana kwa huduma za kimatibabu wakati wa mlipuko kwa 2/3 na vifo kwa nusu, lakini bado kusababisha vifo mamia ya maelfu na mifumo ya afya kulemewa.
en-mt: Better disease avoidance policies can reduce the need for medical care during an outbreak by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still lead to hundreds of thousands of deaths and overwhelmed health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Kukandamiza hupendelewa lakini huhitaji kudumishwa wakati wote vile virusi vinazidi kuenea katika idadi ya watu (au mpaka chanjo ipatikane, hiyo ikija kwanza), au kusambazwa ama sivyo huibuka tena haraka wakati hatua hulegezwa.
en-mt: Suppression is preferred but needs to be maintained at all times as the virus becomes more prevalent in the population (or until a vaccine is available, that comes first), or distributed or else it quickly re-emerges when measures are relaxed.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Mikakati ya muda mrefu ya kukandamiza janga husababisha gharama ya kijamii na kiuchumi.
en-mt: Long-term strategies for suppressing the pandemic result in a social and economic cost.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Hakuna dawa ya kinzavirusi iliyoidhinishwa ya COVID-19, lakini juhudi ya kuzitengeneza zinaendelea, pamoja na kupima kwa dawa zilizopo.
en-mt: There are no approved antiretroviral drugs for COVID-19, but efforts to develop them are ongoing, including testing for existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Kutumia dawa zinunuliwazo bila maagizo ya daktari, kunywa maji, na kupumzika huweza kusaidia kupunguza dalili.
en-mt: Taking medications purchased without a doctor's prescription, drinking water, and relaxing can help alleviate symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Kulingana na ukali, tiba ya kuongezwa hewa, dripu, na msaada wa kupumua huweza kuhitajika.
en-mt: Depending on the severity, air additive, drip therapy, and respiratory support may be required.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Utumizi wa dawa za kujenga misuli huweza kuzorotesha matokeo.
en-mt: The use of muscle building drugs can derail the results.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Kemikali kadhaa ambazo hapo awali ziliidhinishwa kwa matibabu ya magonjwa mengine ya virusi zinachunguzwa kwa matumizi kutibu COVID-19.
en-mt: Several chemicals that were previously approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are being studied for use to treat COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: WHO pia ilitaja kwamba "baadhi ya suluhu za kienyeji na za nyumbani" zinaweza kutoa nafuu kwa dalili zinazosababishwa na SARS-CoV-19.
en-mt: WHO also mentioned that "some local and home-based solutions" could provide relief for symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Kuongeza nafasi na kubadilisha huduma za afya kwa mahitaji ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 inaelezwa na WHO kama hatua ya msingi ya kukabiliana na kuzuka kwa ugonjwa.
en-mt: Increasing space and transforming healthcare to the needs of COVID-19 patients is being described by the WHO as a fundamental step towards responding to disease outbreaks.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC na ofisi ya eneo la Ulaya ya WHO zimetoa miongozo ya hospitali na za huduma ya msingi ya afya ya kuelekeza rasilimali katika viwango kadhaa, pamoja na kuelekeza huduma za maabara kwa kupima COVID-19, kufuta taratibu zilizopangwa iwezekanapo, kukaa mbali na kutenga wagonjwa walio na COVID-19, na kuongeza uwezo wa huduma za utunzaji wa hali ya juu kwa kuwafunza wafanyakazi na kuongeza nambari ya vifaa vya kusaidia kupumua na vitanda.
en-mt: The ECDC and the WHO European regional office have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary health care providers to direct resources at several levels, including directing laboratory services to COVID-19 testing, cancelling planned procedures where possible, staying away from and isolating patients with COVID-19, and increasing capacity for advanced care services by training staff and increasing the number of respiratory aids and beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Kuna nadharia nyingi kuhusu mahali kisa cha kwanza (inayojulikana kama mgonjwa wa kwanza) huenda alitokea.
en-mt: There are many theories about where the first case (known as the first patient) may have originated.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Kisa cha kwanza inayojulikana ya virusi vya korona geni huweza kufuatiliwa hadi tarehe 1 December 2019 Wuhan, Hubei, Uchina.
en-mt: The first known case of the new coronavirus can be traced to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Katika muda wa mwezi moja, nambari ya visa vya virusi vya korona Hubei ziliongezeka polepole.
en-mt: Over the course of a month, Hubei's coronavirus case number gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Haya yalihusishwa na Soko la Jumla la Samaki Huanan, ambayo pia iliuza wanyama walio hai, na nadharia moja ni kuwa virusi vilikuja kupitia mojawapo ya aina ya wanyama hawa; au, kwa namna nyingine, ina chanzo cha kutoka kwa wanyama hadi binadamu.Vikundi vya mchochota wa pafu ambazo chanzo chao haijulikani ilitambuliwa tarehe 26 Desemba na kutibiwa na daktari Zhang Jixian katika Hospitali ya Mkoa ya Hubei, ambaye alijulisha CDC iliyo Wuhan Jianghan tarehe 27 Desemba.
en-mt: These were attributed to the Huanan Fish General Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came through one of these animal species; or, alternatively, it has a source from animal to human. Groups of pafu sculptors whose source is unknown were identified on December 26 and treated by Dr. Zhang Jixian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Tarehe 30 Desemba, kikundi cha madaktari katika Hospitali ya Kati ya Wuhan walitahadharishawenzao ya "virusi vya korona inayofanana na SARS".
en-mt: On December 30th, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned their colleagues of a "coronavirus similar to SARS".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Madaktari wanane kati ya hawa, pamoja na Li Wenliang, walionywa na polisi kwa kueneza uvumi wa uongo, na mwengine, Ai Fen, alikaripiwa na wakubwa wake kwa kutoa maonyo.
en-mt: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were warned by the police for spreading false rumors, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by his superiors for issuing warnings.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Tume ya Afya ya Manispaa ya Wuhan baadaye iliyoa notisi ya umma tarehe 31 Desemba na kujulisha WHO.
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later issued a public notice on December 31 and notified the WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Visa vya kutosha vya mchochota wa pafu visivyojulikana vilikuwa vimeripotiwa kwa mamlaka za afya Wuhan kusababisha uchunguzi mwanzo wa Januari.Katika hatua za mwanzo wa mlipuko, nambari za visa viliongezeka maradufu takriban kila siku saba na nusu.
en-mt: Sufficient cases of the unidentified carcinogens had been reported to Wuhan health authorities to trigger an investigation in early January.In the early stages of the outbreak, case numbers doubled approximately every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Mwanzoni na katikati ya Januari 2020, virusi vilienea hadi mikoa mengine ya Uchina, ikifadhiliwa na usafiri wa Mwaka Mpya wa Kichina na Wuhan kuwa kituo cha usafiri na kituo kuu cha ubadilishanaji wa reli.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, financed by Chinese New Year travel with Wuhan becoming a transit hub and a major rail exchange center.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Tarehe 20 Januari, Uchina iliripoti takribani visa vipya 140 kwa siku, pamoja na watu wawili Beijing na mmoja katika Shenzhen.
en-mt: On Jan. 20, China reported about 140 new cases a day, including two in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Baadaye, data rasmi zinaonyesha kuwa watu 6,174 walikuwa wana dalili tayari kufikia 20 Januari 2020.Kufikia 26 Machi, Marekani imezidi Uchina na Italia na nambari ya juu zaidi ya visa vilivyothibitishwa duniani.Kufikia 9 Aprili 2020, zaidi ya visa milioni 1.61 zimeripotiwa ulimwenguni kote; zaidi ya watu 97,000 wamefariki na zaidi ya watu 364,000 wamepona.
en-mt: Subsequently, official data showed that 6,174 people were symptomatic already as of 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the US has surpassed China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; More than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Takriban nchi 200 na jumuiya zimekuwa na angalau kisa moja.
en-mt: Nearly 200 countries and communities have had at least one case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Kutokana na janga kubwa Ulaya, nchi nyingi katika Eneo la Schengen zimezuia safari kati yao na kuweka udhibiti mipakani.
en-mt: In the wake of Europe's devastating pandemic, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted travel between them and imposed border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Majibu ya kitaifa yamejumuisha hatua za kudhibiti kama vile karantini (zinazofahamika kama amri za kukaa nyumbani, amri za kubarizi mahali au kufungwa kwa shughuli za kawaida kwa muda) na kafyu.Kufikia tarehe 2 Aprili, takriban watu milioni 300 au karibu 90% ya idadi hiyo iko chini ya aina fulani ya kufungiwa shughuli za kawaida nchini Marekani, zaidi ya watu milioni 50 wamefungiwa shughuli za kawaida nchini Ufilipino na takribani watu milioni 59 wamefungiwa shughuli za kawaida nchini Afrika Kusini na watu bilioni 1.3 wamefungiwa shughuli za kawaida nchini India.
en-mt: The national response has included control measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders or temporary shutdowns) and kafyu. As of April 2, approximately 300 million people or nearly 90% of the population are under some form of normal activity lockdown in the United States, over 50 million people have been shut down in the Philippines and about 59 million people have been shut down in South Africa and 1.3 billion people have been shut down from normal activities in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Mnamo 26 Machi, watu bilioni 1.7 ulimwenguni walikuwa chini ya kufungwa kwa shighuli za kawaida kwa muda, ambayo iliongezeka hadi watu bilioni 2.6 siku mbili baadaye-takribani theluthi ya watu duniani.
en-mt: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under a temporary lockdown, which rose to 2.6 billion people two days later—roughly a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Kisa cha kwanza iliyothibitishwa ya COVID-19 imefuatiliwa nyuma hadi 1 Desemba 2019 Wuhan; ripoti moja ambayo isiyothibitishwa inadai kuwa kisa cha kwanza ilikuwa mnamo 17 Novemba.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 Wuhan; One unconfirmed report claims the first case was on 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Daktari Zhang Jixian alitazama vikundi vya ugonjwa wa mchochota wa pafu ambazo chanzo chao hakijulikani mnamo 26 Desemba, kufuatia hii hospitali yake iliwajulisha CDC ya Wuhan Jianhan mnamo 27 Desemba.
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian looked at clusters of pafu strains whose source was unknown on 26 December, following which his hospital notified the Wuhan Jianhan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Vipimo vya awali vya sampuli za wagonjwa mnamo tarehe 27 Disemba 2019 viliashiria kuwepo kwa virusi vya korona vinavyofanana na SARS.
en-mt: Initial tests of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a novel coronavirus similar to SARS.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Notisi ya umma ilitolewa na Tume ya Afya ya Minispaa ya Wuhan mnamo 31 Desemba.
en-mt: A public notice was issued by the Wuhan Minispaa Health Commission on 31 December.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: WHO ilijulishwa siku hiyo.
en-mt: The WHO was notified that day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Taarifa hizi zilipotokea, madaktari Wuhan walionywa na polisi kwa "kueneza uvumi" kuhusu mlipuko.
en-mt: When this news broke, Wuhan doctors were warned by police for "spreading rumors" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Tume ya Taifa ya Afya ya Uchina mwanzoni walidai kuwa hakukuwa "ushahidi wazi" ya kuenea kati ya binadamu hadi binadamu.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was "no clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kuelekea mwisho wa Januari, serikali ya Uchina ilianzisha kampeni kali ambayo baadaye ilielezwa na katibu mkuu wa Chama cha Kikomunisti ya Uchina Xi Jinping kama "vita ya watu" kudhibiti kuenea kwa virusi.
en-mt: Towards the end of January, the Chinese government launched a fierce campaign that was later described by Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Kwa kile kimeelezwa kama "karantini kubwa zaidi katika historia ya binadamu", kuzuia kuingia na kutoka eneo hilo ilitangazwa mnamo 23 Januari ikakatiza safari kuingia na kutoka Wuhan, amabyo iliendelezwa hadi miji kwa jumla 15 Hubei, na kuathiri watu kwa jumla takriban milioni 57.
en-mt: In what has been described as the "largest quarantine in human history", the blockade of entry and exit was announced on 23 January to cut off travel to and from Wuhan, which was extended to 15 cities in Hubei, affecting an estimated 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Gari za kibinafsi zilipigwa marufuku mjini.
en-mt: Private cars were banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Sherehe za Mwaka Mpya ya Kichina (25 Januari) zilikatishwa katika maeneo mengi.
en-mt: Chinese New Year celebrations (25 January) were canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Mamlaka pia zilitangaza kujenga kwa hospitali ya muda, Hospitali ya Huoshenshan, ambayo ilikamilika katika siku 10.
en-mt: Authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Hospitali nyingine ilijengwa baadaye, Hospitali ya Leishenshan, kuhudumia wagonjwa wa ziada.
en-mt: Another hospital was built later, Leishenshan Hospital, to cater for additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Zaidi ya hospitali mpya zilizojengwa, Uchina pia ilibadilisha majengo 14 mengine Wuhan, kama vile ukumbi wa mikutano na viwanja, kuwa hospitali za muda.Mnamo 26 Januari, serikali ilianzisha hatua zaidi kudhibiti mlipuko wa COVID-19, pamoja na kutoa vyeti vya afaya ya usafiri kwa wasafiri na kuongeza muda wa likizo ya Sherehe ya Masika.
en-mt: In addition to the newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other buildings in Wuhan, such as conference halls and stadiums, into temporary hospitals. On 26 January, the government introduced further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing travel certificate to travellers and extending the holiday of the Spring Festival.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Vyuo vikuu na shule kote nchini zilifungwa pia.
en-mt: Universities and schools across the country were also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Maeneo ya Hong Kong na Macau yaliweka hatua kadhaa, hasa kuhusiana na shule na vyuo vikuu.
en-mt: The Hong Kong and Macau areas imposed a number of measures, particularly in relation to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Hatua za kufanya kazi kutoka nyumbani ziliwekwa katika maeneo kadhaa Uchina.
en-mt: Measures to work from home were put in place in several places in China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Vikwazo za usafiri ziliwekwa nadni na nje ya Hubei.
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed on and off Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Usafiri wa umma ulibadilishwa, na majumba ya makumbusho kote Uchina zilifungwa kwa muda.
en-mt: Public transport was replaced, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Udhibiti wa kutembea kwa umma ulitekelezwa katika miji mingi, na imekadiriwa kwamba takriban watu milioni 760 (zaidi ya nusu ya idadi ya watu) walikabiliwa na namna fulani ya vikwazo vya kutokuwa nje.Baada ya mkurupuko huu kuingia katika awamu ya kilimwengu mnamo Machi, Mamlaka ya Uchina zilichukua hatua madhubuti ili kuzuia virusi "kuletwa" kutoka nchi zingine.
