en-mt: Public walking controls were implemented in many cities, and it has been estimated that approximately 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of no-out restrictions. After this outbreak entered a global phase in March, Chinese authorities took concrete steps to prevent the virus from being "imported" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Kwa mfano, Beijing imeweka siku 14 za karantini ya lazima kwa watu wote waliosafiri kutoka nchi za kigeni wanaoingia jijini humo.Tarehe 23 Machi, ni kisa kimoja pekee ndicho kilienea ndani katika bara ya China katika siku tano za kabla, katika kisa hiki ilikuwa ni kupitia mtu aliyesafiri kutoka Istanbul akirejea Guangzhou.
en-mt: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine on all foreigners entering the city. On March 23rd, only one case had spread inside mainland China in the previous five days, in this case it was through someone who had travelled from Istanbul returning to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Mnamo 24 Machi 2020, Waziri Mkuu wa Uchina Li Keqiang aliripoti kuwa kuenea kwa usambazaji nchini ilikuwa imekatizwa kimsingi na mkurupuko ilikuwa imedhibitiwa Uchina.
en-mt: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of supply in the country had been fundamentally disrupted and the outbreak had been controlled in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Siku hiyo vikwazo za usafiri zililegezwa Hubei, kando na Wuhan, miezi miwili baada ya kufungwa kwa shughuli kwa muda iliwekwa. Wizara ya Mambo ya Kigeni ya Uchina ilitangaza tarehe 26 Machi 2020 kuwa kibali cha kuingia kwa wenye visa au vibali ya kuishi huko zitasimamishwa kutoka 28 Machi kuendelea, bila kutoa sababu maalum ni wakati gani sera hii itakoma.
en-mt: On that day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, besides Wuhan, two months after a temporary lockdown was imposed. China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry permits for visa holders or residence permits will be suspended from 28 March onwards, without giving a specific reason as to when this policy will cease.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Wale wanaotaka kuingia Uchina watatakiwa kuomba visa katika ubalozi au ofisi ya balozi mdogo.
en-mt: Those who wish to enter China will be required to apply for a visa at the consulate or consulate's office.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Serikali ya Uchina ilihimiza biashara na viwanda kufunguwa mnamo 30 Machi, na kutoa msaada wa kifedha kuimarisha biashara.Kamati ya Serikali ilitangaza siku ya majonzi kuanzia na muda wa ukimya wa dakika tatu saa 4:00 4 Aprili, ikisadifiana na Sherehe ya Qingming, ingawa serikali ya kati iliwaomba familia kuomboleza mtandaoni kuzuia kutokea tena kwa mkurupuko wa COVID-19.
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and industries to open on 30 March, and offered financial support to boost trade. The Government Committee declared a day of mourning beginning with a three-minute moment of silence at 4:00 4 April, coinciding with the Qingming Ceremony, although the central government asked families to mourn online to prevent a recurrence of the COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: COVID-19 ilithibitishwa kuenea hadi Korea Kusini mnamo 20 Januari 2020 kutoka Uchina.
en-mt: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Shirika la afya ya nchi ilitangaza kuongezeka kubwa katika visa vilivyothibitishwa mnamo 20 Februari, ikihusishwa pakubwa na mkutano Daegu la kundi mpya ya kidini inayojulikana kama Kanisa la Yesu ya Shincheonji.
en-mt: The country's health agency announced a major spike in confirmed cases on 20 February, strongly linked to the Daegu congregation of a new religious group known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Waumini wa Shincheonji waliozuru Daegu kutoka Wuhan walishukiwa kuwa chanzo cha mkurupuko.
en-mt: Shincheonji believers who visited Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the source of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Kufikia 22 Februari, kati ya wafuasi 9,336 wa kanisa, 1,261 au karibu 13% waliripoti dalili.Korea Kusini ilitangaza tahadahari ya hali ya juu zaidi mnamo 23 Februari 2020.
en-mt: As of Feb. 22, of the church's 9,336 followers, 1,261 or nearly 13% reported symptoms. South Korea announced a more advanced lockdown on 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Mnamo 28 Februari, zaidi ya visa 2,000 vilivyothibitishwa viliripotiwa Korea, vikiongezeka hadi 3,150 mnamo 29 Februari.
en-mt: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Makao makuu yote ya kijeshi nchini Korea Kusini yaliwekwa kwenye karantini baada ya vipimo kuthibitisha kwamba wanajeshi watatu walikuwa na virusi.
en-mt: All military headquarters in South Korea were placed under quarantine after tests confirmed that three soldiers had the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Ratiba za mashirika ya ndege ziliathiriwa na kwa hivyo zilibadilishwa.Korea Kusini ilianzisha kilichozingatiwa mradi mkubwa na uliopangwa vizuri sana duniani kupima watu kwa virusi, na kutenga yeyote aliyeathiriwa pamoja na kufuatilia na kuweka karantini wale waliopatana nao.
en-mt: The airlines' schedules were compromised and were therefore changed. South Korea launched what is considered the world's largest and best-planned project to test people for the virus, isolate anyone affected as well as trace and quarantine those they have come into contact with.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Mbinu za kupima zilikuwa pamoja na kujiripoti ukiwa na dalili na wageni wa kimataifa wanaofika kupitia programu ya simu, kupimwa kwa kupitia vituo kwa virusi na matokeo kupatikana siku ifuatayo, na kuongeza uwezo wa kupima kuwezesha hadi watu 20,000 kupimwa kila siku.
en-mt: Testing methods included self-reporting with symptoms by international visitors arriving via a mobile app, testing through stations for the virus and results being available the following day, and increasing testing capacity to enable up to 20,000 people to be tested daily.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Mradi wa Korea Kusini inazingatiwa kufaulu katika kudhibiti mlipuko licha ya kutokarantini miji nzima.Jamii ya Korea Kusini hapo awali ilikuwa na kambi tofauti kuhusiana na itikio la Rais Moon Jae-in kwa hali hatari.
en-mt: South Korea's project is considered successful in containing the outbreak despite not quarantine across cities. South Korean society has previously had different camps over President Moon Jae-in's reaction to dangerous situations.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Wakorea wengi walitia sahihi maombi rasmi zilizotaka kuondolewa mamlakani kwa Moon dhidi ya walichosema kuwa serikali kushughulikia vibaya mkurupuko, au kusifu mwitikio wake.
en-mt: Many Koreans signed formal petitions calling for Moon's ouster against what they said was the government's mishandling of the outbreak, or praised his response.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Mnamo 23 Machi, iliripotiwa kuwa Korea Kusini ilikuwa na nambari ya visa chache kwa siku katika wiki nne.
en-mt: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the fewest visa number per day in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Mnamo 29 Machi iliripotiwa kuwa kuanzia 1 Aprili wageni wote wa kimataifa wanaoingia watawekwa karantini kwa wiki mbili.
en-mt: On 29 March it was reported that from 1 April all incoming international visitors would be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Kulingana na ripoti za vyombo vya habari mnamo 1 Aprili, Korea Kusini imepokea maombi ya msaada wa kupima virusi kutoka nchi 121 tofauti.
en-mt: According to media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Irani iliripoti kisa chake cha kwanza ya maambukizi iliyothibitishwa ya SARS-CoV-2 mnamo 19 Februari Qom, ambapo, kulingana na Wizara ya Afya na Elimu ya Afya, watu wawili walifariki baadaye siku hiyo.
en-mt: Iran reported its first confirmed case of SARS-CoV-2 infection on 19 February Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Health Education, two people died later that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Hatua za mwanzoni zilizotangazwa na serikali ilikuwa pamoja na kufutwa kwa tamasha na matukio mengine ya kitamaduni, matukio ya michezo, na maombi ya Ijumaa, na kufungwa kwa vyuo vikuu, taasisi ya masomo ya ziada, na shule.
en-mt: The initial measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and the closure of universities, institutions of extracurricular studies, and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Irani ilitenga rial trilioni tano kupambana na virusi.
en-mt: Iran has set aside 5 trillion rials to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Rais Hassan Rouhani alisema mnamo 26 Februari 2020 kuwa hapakuwa na mipango kukarantini maeneo yaliyoathirika na mkurupuko, na ni watu binafsi tu watakoawekwa karantini.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine the areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Mipango ya kupunguza usafiri kati ya miji zilitangazwa mnamo Machi, ingawa msongamano mkubwa wa magari kati ya miji kabla ya Mwaka Mpya ya Uajemi Nowruz iliendelea.
en-mt: Plans to reduce travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic jams between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Hekalu za Shia Qom zilibaki wazi kwa wasafiri hadi 16 Machi 2020.Irani ilikuwa kituo cha kuenea kwa virusi baada ya Uchina mnamo Februari.
en-mt: Shia Qom temples remained open to travelers until 16 March 2020.Iran was the center of viral spread after China in February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Huku kukiwa madai ya kuficha kiwango cha mkurupuko Irani, zaidi ya nchi kumi zilifuatilia visa vyao kurudi hadi Irani kufikia 28 Februari, kuonyesha kuwa kiwango cha mkurupuko huenda ikawa mbaya zaidi kuliko visa 388 vilivyoripotiwa na serikali ya Irani kufikia tarehe hiyo.
en-mt: With allegations of concealment of the rate of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries traced their cases back to Iran by February 28, indicating that the rate of the outbreak may be worse than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government as of that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Bunge la Irani ilifungwa, na washiriki 23 kati ya 290 waliripotiwa kuwa na virusi mnamo 3 Machi.
en-mt: Iran's parliament was shut down, and 23 of the 290 participants were reported to have tested positive on 3 March.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Mnamo 12 Machi, Shirika la Haki za Kibinadamu ilihimiza mamlaka ya jela ya Irani kuwaachilia bila masharti wanaotetea haki za kibinadamu waliokamatwa kwa upinzani wa amani, na pia kuachilia kwa muda wafungwa wote wanaostahili.
en-mt: On March 12, the Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release human rights defenders arrested for peaceful resistance, as well as to temporarily release all eligible detainees.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Ilisema kuwa kuna hatari kubwa ya virusi kuenea katika mashirika zilizofungwa kama vituo vya vizuizi, ambayo pia hazikuwa na huduma za afya za kutosha.
en-mt: It said there was a high risk of the virus spreading in closed organisations like detention centres, which also did not have adequate health care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Mnamo 15 Machi, serikali ya Irani ilitangaza vifo 100 katika siku moja, nambari ya juu zaidi iliyorekodiwa nchini tangu mkurupuko ulianza.
en-mt: On 15 March, the Iranian government announced 100 deaths in a single day, the highest number recorded in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Angalau wanasiasa 12 na maafisa wa serikali wanaohudumu au wa zamani walishakufa kutoka na ungonjwa huu kufikia mwezi tarehe 17 Machi.
en-mt: At least 12 politicians and serving or former government officials had died from the disease as of March 17.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 23 Machi, Iran ilikuwa inasajli visa 50 vipya kila saa na kifo kimoja kipya kila baada ya dakika kumi kutokana na virusi vya korona.
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran was registering 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes from the coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Kulingana na ofisa wa WHO, kunawezekana kuwa visa tano zaidi Irani kuliko vinavyoripotiwa.
en-mt: According to a WHO official, there are probably five more cases in Iran than are reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Pia inapendekezwa kwamba vikwazo vya Marekani dhidi ya Iran vinaweza kuathiri uwezo wa nchi hiyo wa kifedha kushughulikia mkurupuko wa virusi.
en-mt: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran could affect the country's financial capacity to handle the virus outbreak.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: Kamishna Mkuu wa Umoja wa Mataifa wa Haki za Kibinadamu ametaka vikwazo vya kiuchumi kulegezwa kwa mataifa zilizoathiriwa sana na janga hili, pamoja ikiwamo Irani.
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for economic sanctions to be eased for countries hit hard by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Mkurupuko ilithibitishwa kuenea hadi Italia mnamo 31 Januari, wakati watalii Wachina wawili walipimwa na kupatikana na SARS-CoV-2 Roma.
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed to spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Visa vilianza kuongezeka sana, ambayo ilifanya serikali ya Italia kusimamisha ndege zote zinazoingia na kutoka Uchina na kutangaza hali ya dharura.
en-mt: Cases began to rise dramatically, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights coming in and out of China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Kikundi isiyohusiana na visa vya COVID-19 iligunduliwa baadaye, ikianza na visa 16 vilivyothibitishwa Lombardy mnamo 21 Februari.Mnamo 22 Februari, Tume ya Wachungaji ilitangaza sheria mpya kudhibiti mkurupuko, pamoja na kukarantini zaidi ya watu 50,000 kutoka munispaa 11 tofauti Italia Kaskazini.
en-mt: An unrelated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later discovered, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Pastoral Commission announced new rules to control the outbreak, including quarantine of more than 50,000 people from 11 different munispaa in Northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Waziri Mkuu Giuseppe Conte alisema, "Katika maeneo ya mkurupuko, kuingia na kutoka haitakuwepo.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak zones, entry and exit will not be there.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Kusimamisha ya kazi na shughuli na matukio ya michezo imeagizwa tayari katika maeneo haya."Mnamo 4 Machi, serikali ya Italia iliagiza kufungwa kabisa kwa shule zote na vyuo vikuu nchini wakati Italia ilifikia vifo 100.
en-mt: Suspension of functions and activities and sporting events has been ordered already in these areas." On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the complete closure of all schools and universities in the country as Italy reached 100 deaths.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Matukio ya michezo yote kubwa, ikiwamo mechi za kandanda za Serie A, zilikuwa zichezwe bila shabiki kuwepo hadi Aprili, lakini mnamo 9 Machi, michezo yote ilisimamishwa kabisa kwa angalau mwezi moja.
en-mt: Events for all major games, including Serie A football matches, were to be played without fan presence until April, but on 9 March, all games were suspended permanently for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Mnamo 11 Machi, Waziri Mkuu Conte aliagiza kuachishwa kwa takriban shughuli zote za kiuchumi isipokuwa maduka makubwa na maduka ya dawa.Mnamo 6 Machi, Taasisi ya Anesthesia ya Italia, Analgeisa, Kuhuisha na Uchungaji wa Hali ya Juu (SIAARTI) mapendekezo yaliyochapishwa ya maadili ya kiafya kuhusu itifaki ya kuchuja wagonjwa inayoweza kutumika.
en-mt: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered the cessation of almost all economic activities except supermarkets and pharmacies. On 6 March, the Italian Institute of Anesthesia, Analgeisa, Revitalization and Advanced Caring (SIAARTI) published recommendations for health ethics regarding a usable patient filtration protocol.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo 19 Machi, Italia ilipita Uchina kama nchi iliyo na vifo vinavyohusiana na virusi vya korona zaidi ulimwenguni baada ya kuripoti vifo 3,405 kutoka janga hili.
en-mt: On 19 March, Italy passed China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 deaths from the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Mnamo 22 Machi, iliripotiwa kuwa Urusi ilituma ndege tisa ya kijeshi na vifaa vya kimatibabu kuelekea Italia.
en-mt: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military aircraft and medical supplies to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Kufikia 5 Aprili, kulikuwa na visa 128,948 vilivyothibitishwa, vifo 15,887, na wagonjwa waliopona 21,815 Italia, na mengi ya visa hivyo zikitokea eneo la Lombardy.
en-mt: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recovered cases in Italy, with most of those cases occurring in Lombardy.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Ripoti moja ya CNN ilionyesha kuwa mchanganyiko wa idadi ya watu wengi walio wazee na kutoweza kupima wote walio na virusi hadi sasa huenda inachangia idadi kubwa ya vifo.
en-mt: One CNN report indicated that a combination of a large elderly population and not being able to test all those with the virus so far may be contributing to the high death toll.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Mwitikio wa Uingereza kwa virusi ilitokea kwanza kama mojawapo wa zilizo legevu zaidi katika nchi zilizoathirika, na hadi 18 Machi 2020, serikali ya Uingereza haikuweka hatua yoyote ya kutotangamana kwa watu au karantini kubwa kwa raia wake.
en-mt: The UK's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed in the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the UK government did not impose any social distancing measures or a major quarantine on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Kwa sababu hiyo, serikali ililaumiwa kwa mwonekano wa kulegea katika harakati ya kushughulika na wasiwasi iliyokabiliwa na umma.Mnamo 16 Machi, Waziri Mkuu Boris Johnson alitoa tangazo akishauri dhidi ya kusafiri kusikohitajika na kutangamana kijamii, alipendekeza watu wafanye kazi kutoka nyumbani inapowezekana na kuepuka maeneo kama vilabu, hoteli, na sinema.
en-mt: As a result, the government was blamed for a loose look in the anxiety dealing movement faced by the public. On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued an announcement advising against unwanted travel and social distancing, suggested people work from home where possible and avoid places like clubs, hotels, and cinemas.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Mnamo 20 Machi, serikali ilitangaza kuwa vituo vyote vya kustarehe kama vile vilabu na ukumbi wa kufanyia mazoezi zitafungwa mara moja, na kutoa ahadi kulipa hadi 80% ya mshahara ya wafanyakazi hadi kiwango cha £2,500 kila mwezi kuzuia ukosefu wa kazi katika hali hatari.Mnamo 23 Machi, Waziri Mkuu alitangaza hatua madhubuti ya kutotangamana na watu, kupiga marufuku mikutano zaidi ya watu wawili na kuwekwa vikwazo vya usafiri na shughuli za nje pia ambazo waliona kuwa muhimu.
en-mt: On 20 March, the government announced that all staging centres such as clubs and gyms would be closed immediately, and offered to pay up to 80% of workers' wages up to the £2,500 monthly threshold to prevent unemployment in dangerous conditions. On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced a strict social distancing measure, a ban on more than two people's meetings and the imposition of restrictions on travel and outdoor activities as well which they deemed necessary.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Tofauti na hatua za awali, vidhibiti hivi viliweza kutekelezwa na polisi kupitia utoaji wa faini na kutawanywa kwa hadhara.
en-mt: Unlike previous measures, these controls were enforceable by the police through the issuance of fines and public dispersal.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Biashara kadhaa ziliagizwa kufunga, isipokuwa biashara zilizoonwa kuwa "muhimu", pamoja na maduka makubwa, maduka ya dawa, benki, duka za vifaa vya ujenzi, vituo vya mafuta, na gereji.
en-mt: Several businesses were ordered to close, except businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, building equipment stores, petrol stations, and garages.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Mnamo 20 Januari, kisa cha kwanza ya COVID-19 ilithibitishwa katika jiji la Pasifiki Kaskazini Magharibi ya Washington katika mwanaume aliyekuwa amerudi kutoka Wuhan mnamo 15 Januari.
en-mt: On 20 January, the first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest city of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Timu ya Virusi vya Korona ya Ikulu ya Marekani ilianzishwa mnamo 29 Januari.
en-mt: The White House Coronavirus Team was established on 29 January.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Mnamo 31 Januari, utawala wa Trump ilitangaza hali ya dharura ya umma, na kuweka vikwazo ya kuingia kwa wasafiri kutoka Uchina.
en-mt: On Jan. 31, the Trump administration declared a public emergency, imposing restrictions on entry of travelers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Mnamo 28 Januari 2020, Kituo cha Kudhibiti Magonjwa—taasisi inayoongoza ya afya ya umma ya serikali ya Marekani—ilitangaza walikuwa wametengeneza kifaa chao cha kupima.
en-mt: On 28 January 2020, the Centers for Disease Control—the U.S. government's leading public health institution—announced they had developed their own testing kit.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Licha ya kufanya hivyo, Marekani ilikuwa na mwanzo wa polepole kwa vipimo, ambayo ilificha kiwango halisi ya mkurupuko wakati huo.
en-mt: Despite doing so, the U.S. had a slow start to the tests, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Vipimo viliharibiwa na vifaa vyenye hitilafu vilivyotengenezwa na serikali la shirikisho mnamo Februari, ukosefu wa kibali cha serikali la shirikisho ya vifaa visivyokuwa vya serikali (na wasomi, kampuni na hospitali) hadi mwisho wa Februari, na vigezo vizuizi ya watu kustahili kupimwa hadi mwanzoni mwa Machi (agizo la daktari ilihitajika hapo baadaye).
en-mt: Tests were marred by faulty devices developed by the federal government in February, the lack of federal approval of non-government equipment (by academics, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restricted criteria for people to be eligible for testing until the beginning of March (a doctor's order was required later).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Kufikia 27 Februari, Gazeti ya Washington Post iliripoti chini ya vipimo 4,000 zilikuwa zimefanywa Marekani.
en-mt: As of Feb. 27, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Kufikia 13 Machi, Atlantiki iliripoti chini ya vipimo 14,000 zilizokuwa zimefanywa.
en-mt: By 13 March, the Atlantic reported fewer than 14,000 tests had been conducted.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Mnamo 22 Machi, chombo cha habari ya Associated Press iliripoti: "Watu wengi ambao wana dalili na agizo la daktari wamesubiri kwa masaa au siku nyingi kupimwa."Baada ya kifo cha kwanza Marekani iliripotiwa katika jimbo la Washington mnamo 29 Februari, Gavana Jay Inslee alitangaza hali ya dharura, kitendo kilichofuatwa na majimbo mengine.
en-mt: On March 22, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited for hours or days to get tested." After the first U.S. death was reported in Washington state on Feb. 29, Gov. Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an act followed by other states.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Shule katika eneo la Seattle zilikatiza madarasa mnamo 3 Machi, na kufikia katikati ya Machi, shule kote nchini zilikuwa zinafungwa.Mnamo 6 Machi 2020, Marekani ilishauriwa kuhusu makadirio ya athari ya virusi vya korana geni katika nchi na kikundi cha madaktari wakutabiri magonjwa katika Taasisi ya Imperial Uingereza.
en-mt: Schools in the Seattle area interrupted classes on March 3, and by mid-March, schools across the country were closing. On 6 March 2020, the United States was consulted about the estimated impact of the novel coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at the Imperial Institute UK.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Siku hiyo Rais Trump alitia sahihi Sheria ya Matumizi ya Ziada ya Mwitikio na Matayarisho ya Virusi vya Korona, ambayo ilitoa bilioni $8.3 katika ufadhili wa dharura kwa mashirika ya shirikisho kushughulika na mkurupuko.
en-mt: That day, President Trump signed the Supplemental Response and Preparedness Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding to federal agencies dealing with the outbreak.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Mashirika yaliweka vikwazo vya usafiri ya wafanyakazi, ikakatiza kongamano, na kuhimiza wafanyakazi kufanya kazi kutoka nyumbani.
en-mt: Organizations imposed restrictions on workers' travel, interrupted the conference, and encouraged employees to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Matukio ya michezo na msimu zilikatizwa.Mnamo 11 Machi, Trump alitangaza vikwazo vya usafiri ya nchi nyingi Ulaya, isipokuwa Uingereza, kwa siku 30, kutokea 13 Machi.
en-mt: Sporting events and the season were interrupted. On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions on most European countries, except the UK, for 30 days, from 13 March.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Siku ifuatayo, aliongeza vikwazo kujumuisha Uingereza na
en-mt: The following day, he added restrictions to include England and

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Mnamo 13 Machi, alitangaza hali ya dharura la taifa, ambayo ilifanya ufadhili wa jimbo kupatikana kushughulikia hali ya hatari.
en-mt: On 13 March, he declared a state of national emergency, which made provincial funding available to address the state of emergency.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kuanzia 15 Machi, biashara kadhaa zilifungwa au kupunguza masaa ya shughuli kote Marekani kujaribu kupunguza kuenea kwa virusi.
en-mt: Starting March 15, several businesses closed or reduced hours of operations across the United States to try to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Kufikia 17 Machi, janga hili ilikuwa imethibitishwa katika majimbo yote 50 na katika Wilaya ya Columbia.Mnamo 23 Machi, iliripotiwa kuwa Jiji la New York ilikuwa na visa 10.700 ya virusi vya korona, zaidi ya nambari ya jumla ya visa Korea Kusini.
en-mt: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10.700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Mnamo 25 Machi, gavana alisema kuwa kutotangamana na watu ilionekana kufanya kazi, kwa vile makadirio ya visa kuongezeka maradufu ilipunguka kutoka siku 2.0 hadi siku 4.7.
en-mt: On March 25, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as the estimate of cases doubling fell from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Kufikia 28 Machi, kulikuwa visa vilivyothibitishwa 32,308 Jiji la New York, na watu 672 walikuwa wamefariki kutoka virusi.Mnamo 26 Machi, Marekani iliripotiwa kuwa na visa zaidi vilivyothibitishwa vya maambukizi ya virusi vya korona kuliko nchi yoyote ile duniani, ikuwemo Uchina na Italia.Kufikia 8 Aprili, visa 400,335 vimethibitishwa Marekani, na watu 12,841 wamefariki.
en-mt: As of March 28, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus. On 26 March, the United States reported having more confirmed cases of coronavirus than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Kulingana na ripoti ya vyombo vya habari tarehe 30 Machi, Rais Trump wa Marekani aliamua kuongeza miongozo ya watu kukaa mbali kijamii hadi tarehe 30 Aprili.
en-mt: According to a press release on March 30, President Trump decided to extend social distancing guidelines until April 30th.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Siku hiyo, USNS Comfort, meli ambayo ni hospitali iliyo na vitanda 1000, ilitia nanga New York.
en-mt: On that day, USNS Comfort, a 1,000-bed hospital ship, docked in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Mnamo 3 Aprili, Marekani ilikuwa imerekodi vifo 884 kutokana na virusi vya korona katika muda wa masaa 24.
en-mt: On April 3, the United States had recorded 884 deaths from coronavirus in 24 hours.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Katika jimbo la New York visa vilikuwa zaidi ya watu 100,000 mnamo 3 Aprili.Ikulu ya Marekani imeshutumiwa kwa kutotilia maanani tishio na kudhibiti ujumbe ya maafisa wa afya na wanasayansi kusimamia taarifa ya umma na machapisho yanayohusiana na virusi na ofisi ya Naibu wa Rais Mike Pence.
en-mt: In New York state, the number of cases was more than 100,000 on April 3, the White House has been accused of not paying attention to the threat and controlling the messaging of health officials and scientists to manage public information and virus-related publications by Vice President Mike Pence's office.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Kibali ya jumla cha usimamizi wa hali ya hatari imegawanyika kufuatia ufuasi wa vyama.
en-mt: The overall clearance of risk management has been split following partisan partisanship.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Baadhi ya maafisa wa Marekani na watoa maoni walisuta hatua ya Marekani ya kutegemea ununuzi wa bidhaa muhimu, ikiwa ni pamoja na bidhaa muhimu za kimatibabu kutoka China.
en-mt: Some U.S. officials and commentators scoffed at the U.S. reliance on purchases of essential commodities, including essential medical products from China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Uchambuzi wa mitindo ya usafiri kwa ndege ilitumiwa kuweka kwenye ramani na kutabiri mitindo ya kuenea na ilichapishwa katika Jarida la Usafiri wa Kimatibabu katikati ya Januari 2020.
en-mt: Analysis of transport patterns by aircraft was used to map and predict prevalent trends and was published in the Journal of Medical Travel in mid-January 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Kulingana na taarifa ya 2018 kutoka Chama cha Usafiri kwa Ndege, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, na Taipei ilikuwa na kiwango kubwa ya wasafiri kutoka Wuhan.
en-mt: According to a 2018 report from the Association for Transport by Airlines, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the highest number of travelers from Wuhan.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Dubai, Sydney, na Melbourne pia ziliripotiwa kama vituo vipendavyo ya watu wanaosafiri kutoka Wuhan.
en-mt: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as their favorite destinations for people traveling from Wuhan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bali iliripotiwa kama mahali iliyo na uwezo duni kati ya vituo vipendavyo zaidi 20 ya miji katika matayarisho, ilhali miji Australia zilidhaniwa kuwa na matayarisho nzuri.Australia ilitoa Mpango wa Mwitikio wa Hali ya Dharura ya Virusi vya Korona Geni (COVID-19) mnamo 7 February.
en-mt: Rather, it was reported as a place with poor capacity among the 20 most desirable urban centres in preparation, while cities in Australia were thought to have good preparations. Australia released its Coronavirus (COVID-19) Emergency Response Plan on 7 February.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Ilisema kuwa mengi ilikuwa bado kugunduliwa kuhusu COVID-19, na kuwa Australia ingesisitiza udhibiti wa mipaka na mawasiliano katika itikio yake kwa janga kubwa.
en-mt: It said much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border controls and contacts in its response to a major pandemic.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Mnamo 21 Machi, hali ya dharura ya kibiologia ya binadamu ilitangazwa Australia.
en-mt: On 21 March, a human biochemical emergency was declared in Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Kwa sababu ya karantini fanifu ya usafiri wa umma Wuhan na Hubei, nchi kadhaa zimepanga kuhamisha raia wao na wafanyakazi wa balozi zao kutoka eneo hilo, kimsingi kutumia ndege zilizokodiwa za nchi husika, na mamlaka ya Uchina wakitoa kibali.
en-mt: Because of the quarantine on public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and embassy staff from the area, primarily using chartered flights of the respective countries, with Chinese authorities granting permission.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Kanada, Marekani, Japani, Uhindi, Sri Lanka, Australia, Ufaransa, Argentina, Ujerumani, na Thailand walikuwa kati ya nchi za kwanza kupanga uhamisho wa raia wao.
en-mt: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first countries to arrange the transfer of their citizens.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: Pakistan imesema kuwa haitahamisha raia wake wowote kutoka Uchina.
en-mt: Pakistan has said it will not extradite any of its citizens from China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Mnamo 7 Februari, Brazil ilihamisha watu kutoka Brazil 34 au watu wa familia zaidi ya hao watu wanne kutoka Polandi, Mchina, na raia kutoka Uhindi.
en-mt: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or more family members of those four people from Poland, a Chinese, and a citizen from India.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Raia wa Polandi, Uchina, na Uhindi walishuka Polandi, ambapo ndege ya Brazil ilisimama kabla ya kufuata
en-mt: Polish, Chinese, and Indian citizens descended on Poland, where the Brazilian plane stopped before following

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Raia wa Brazil walioenda Wuhan waliwekwa karantini katika kituo cha kijeshi karibu na Brasília.
en-mt: Brazilians who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Siku hiyo, Wanakanada 215 (176 kutoka kwenye ndege ya kwanza na 39 kutoka kwenye ndege ya pili iliyotolewa rasmi ya serikali ya Marekani) waliokolewa kutoka Wuhan hadi CFB Trenton ili wawekwe kwenye karantini kwa muda wa wiki mbili.
en-mt: On that day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first flight and 39 from the second officially released U.S. government flight) were rescued from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Mnamo 11 Februari, ndege nyingine iliyo na Wakanada 185 kutoka Wuhan ilifika CFB Trenton.
en-mt: On 11 February, another flight with 185 Canadians from Wuhan reached CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Mamlaka ya Australia ilihamisha raia 277 mnamo 3 na 4 Februari hadi Kituo cha Kizuizi ya Christmas Island, ambayo ilifanywa kuwa kituo cha karantini, ambako walibaki kwa siku 14.
en-mt: Australian authorities transferred 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which was made a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Ndege ya kuwahamisha raia wa New Zealand ilifika Auckland mnamo 5 Februari; abiria wake (wakiwemo wengine kutoka Australia na Pasifiki) waliwekwa karantini katika kituo cha jeshi la wanamaji Whangaparoa, kaskazini wa Auckland.
en-mt: A New Zealand evacuation plane reached Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at Naval Station Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Mnamo 15 Februari, Marekani ilitangaza kuwa ingehamisha Wamerikani walioabiri meli ya starehe ya Diamond Princess.
en-mt: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate the Americans aboard the Diamond Princess pleasure ship.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Mnamo 21 February, ndege iliyokuwa imebeba abiria 129 Wakanada ambao walikuwa wamehamishwa kutoka Diamond Princess walifika Trenton, Ontario.
en-mt: On February 21, a plane carrying 129 Canadians who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess arrived in Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Mwanzoni wa Machi, serikali ya Uhindi ilianza kuhamisha raia wake kutoka Irani.Mnamo 14 Machi ndege ya Shirika la ndege Afrika Kusini iliyokodishwa na serikali ya Afrika Kusini iliwarudisha nyumbani raia wa Afrika Kusini 112.
en-mt: At the beginning of March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African airliner chartered by the South African government sent 112 South Africans home.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Uchujaji wa kimatibabu ilifanywa kabla ya kuondoka, na Waafrika Kusini wanne waliokuwa wanaonyesha dalili za virusi vya korona waliachwa nyuma kupunguza hatari.
en-mt: Medical filtration was carried out before departure, and four South Africans who were showing symptoms of coronavirus were left behind to reduce the risk.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Waafrika Kusini waliokuwa hawana ugonjwa ndiyo waliorejeshwa nyumbani pekee.
en-mt: Disease-free South Africans were the only ones sent home.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Matokeo ya vipimo ya Waafrika Kusini, wakiwemo wafanyakazi wa ndege, marubani, wafanyakazi wa hoteli, polisi na askari waliohusika katika misheni ya kibinadamu ambao, kama hatua ya kujikinga, walibaki chini ya uangalizi na katika karantini kwa muda wa siku 14 katika Hoteli ya The Ranch.
en-mt: The test results of South Africans, including flight crews, pilots, hotel workers, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a protective measure, remained under surveillance and in quarantine for 14 days at The Ranch.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo 20 Machi, Marekani ilianza kuondoa jeshi lake kiasi kutoka Iraki kutokana na janga.
en-mt: On March 20, the United States began withdrawing its military from Iraq due to the disaster.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Mnamo 5 Februari, wizara ya mambo ya kigeni ya Uchina ilisema kuwa nchi 21 (zikiwemo Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad na Tobago, Misri, na Irani) walituma msaada Uchina.
en-mt: On 5 February, China's foreign ministry said that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Baadhi ya wanafunzi wa Uchina katika vyuo vikuu Marekani waliungana kusaidia kutuma msaada katika sehemu zilizoathiriwa na virusi Uchina, na kikundi ya pamoja katika sehemu kadhaa Chicago inasemekana waliweza kutuma barakoa 50,000 za N95 kwa hospitali katika mkoa wa Hubei mnamo 30 Januari.Shirika la msaada wa kibinadamu Direct Relief, wakishirikiana na FedEx, walituma barakoa za uso 200,000 pamoja na vifaa za kujikinga za kibinafsi, zikiwemo glavu na gauni, kupitia ndege ya dharura hadi kwenye Hospitali ya Muungano wa Wuhan kufikia 30 Januari.
en-mt: Some Chinese students at U.S. universities teamed up to help send aid to virus-hit parts of China, and a joint group in several parts Chicago is said to have been able to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in partnership with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with personal protective equipment,  including gloves and gowns, via emergency flight to Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Mnamo 5 Februari, Bill na Melinda Gates walitangaza msaada wa milioni $100 kwa WHO kufadhili utafiti wa chanjo na juhudi za matibabu pamoja na kukinga "idadi ya watu walio hatarini Afrika na Asia Kusini".
en-mt: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million grant to WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts as well as to protect "vulnerable populations in Africa and South Asia".

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: Interaksyon iliripoti kuwa serikali ya Uchina ilitoa msaada wa barakoa 200,000 kuelekea Ufilipino mnamo 6 Februari, baada ya Seneta Richard Gordon alisafirisha barakoa milioni 3.16 hadi Wuhan.
en-mt: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on Feb. 6, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Tarehe 19 Februari, Shirika la Msalaba Mwekundu la Singapore lilitangaza kwamba litatuma dola milioni 2.26 za msaada nchini China.
en-mt: On February 19, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million in aid to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: Japan ilitoa msaada wa barakoa za uso milioni moja kuelekea Wuhan, Uturuki ilituma vifaa vya kimatibabu, Urusi ilituma zaidi ya tani 13 ya zana za kimatibabu kuelekea Wuhan, Malaysia iltangaza msaada wa glavu za kimatibabu milioni 18 kuelekea Uchina, Ujerumani ilituma zana tofauti za kimatibabu zikiwemo suti za Hazmat 10,000, na Marekani iltoa msaada wa tani 17.8 ya zana za kimatibabu kuelekea Uchina na kuahidi msaada wa kifedha ya ziada ya milioni $100 kwa nchi zilizoathirika.Baada ya visa Uchina vilionekana kupungua, nchi hiyo imekuwa ikituma msaada kwa nchi tofauti zilizopatwa na janga.
en-mt: Japan donated 1 million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey sent medical supplies, Russia sent more than 13 tons of medical equipment to Wuhan, Malaysia announced 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany sent 10,000 different medical tools including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical tools to China and pledged additional financial assistance of $100 million to the country. affected. After cases in China appeared to be declining, the country has been sending aid to different countries hit by the pandemic.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Mnamo Machi, Uchina, Cuba, na Urusi walituma zana za kimatibabu na wataalam kusaidia Italia kukabiliana na mkurupuko wa virusi vya korona.
en-mt: In March, China, Cuba, and Russia sent medical tools and experts to help Italy deal with the coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: Mfanyabiashara Jack Ma alituma vifaa vya kupima virusi milioni 1.1, barakoa za uso milioni 6, na suti za kujikinga 60,000 kuelekea Addis Ababa, Ethiopia kwa kusambazwa na Muungano wa Afrika.
en-mt: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million virus test kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Baadaye alituma vifaa vya kupima virusi 5,000, barakoa za uso 100,000 na vifaa za kusaidia kupumua 5 kuelekea Panama.
en-mt: He later sent 5,000 virus test kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 breathing aids to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: Ma pia alitoa msaada wa zana za kimatibabu kuelekea Kanada. Uholanzi, Uhispania, Uturuki, Georgia na Jamhuri ya Czech walitoa hisia zao kuhusu barakoa zilizotengenezwa Uchina na vifaa vya kupima virusi.
en-mt: Ma also donated medical tools to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia and the Czech Republic voiced their feelings about Chinese-made masks and virus test kits.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Kwa mfano, Uhispania iliondoa vifaa vya kupima virusi 58,000 vilivyotengenezwa Uchina vilivyokuwa na kiwango cha usahihi wa 30%, wakati huo, Uholanzi ilirejesha barakoa za uso 600,000 za Uchina ambazo zilikuwa na hitilafu.
en-mt: For example, Spain removed 58,000 Chinese-made virus test kits that had a 30% accuracy rate, while the Netherlands restored 600,000 Chinese face masks that were faulty.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: Nchi ya Ubelgiji ilirejesha barakoa 100,000 ambazo haziwezi kutumika, ambazo zilidhaniwa zilitoka nchini China, lakini ukweli ni kwamba zilitoka nchini Kolombia.
en-mt: Belgium returned 100,000 unusable masks, which were thought to have originated in China, but the fact is they came from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Kwa upande mwingine, msaada wa Uchina imepokewa vizuri katika sehemu za Marekani ya Kilatini na Afrika.Tarehe 2 Aprili, Benki ya Dunia ilianzisha shughuli za msaada wa dharura kwa nchi zinazoendelea.
en-mt: On the other hand, Chinese assistance has been well received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On April 2, the World Bank initiated emergency assistance activities for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: WHO ilipongeza juhudi za mamlaka za Uchina kusimamia na kudhibiti janga hili.
en-mt: The WHO praised the efforts of Chinese authorities to manage and contain the epidemic.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: WHO ilionyesha tofauti kati ya mkurupuko wa SARS 2002–2004, ambapo mamlaka ya Uchina zililaumiwa kwa usiri iliyozuia juhudi za kinga na udhibiti, na hali ya hatari ya sasa ambapo serikali ya kati "imetoa taarifa za mara kwa mara kuzuia wasiwasi kabla ya likizo ya Mwaka Mpya wa Kichina".
en-mt: The WHO highlighted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, in which Chinese authorities were blamed for secrecy that hampered prevention and containment efforts, and the current state of emergency in which the central government "issued regular statements to prevent concerns ahead of the Chinese New Year holiday".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Tarehe 23 Januari, kama itikio kwa uamuzi wa mamlaka ya kati kutekeleza vikwazo vya usafiri Wuhan, mwakilishi wa WHO Gauden Galea alisema kuwa ilhali ilikuwa "kwa hakika si pendekezo WHO ilitoa", ilikuwa pia "ishara muhimu wa kujitolea kudhibiti janga hili mahali ambapo imeenea sana". Tarehe 30 Januari, kufuatia uthibitisho wa kuambukizwa kati ya binadamu nje ya Uchina na kuongezeka katika nambari ya visa katika nchi zingine, WHO ilitangaza mkurupuko huu kuwa Dharura ya Kimataifa ya Afya ya Umma (PHEIC), PHEIC ya sita kutokea hatua ya kwanza kuwekwa wakati wa janga la mafua la nguruwe ya 2009.
en-mt: On 23 January, as a reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement travel restrictions on Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea said that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO made", it was also "an important sign of commitment to controlling the epidemic in a place where it is so widespread". On 30 January, following confirmation of human transmission outside China and a rise in the number of cases in other countries, WHO declared this outbreak a Global Public Health Emergency (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC to occur at the first stage to be put in place during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa WHO Tedros Adhanom alisema kuwa PHEIC ilitokana na "hatari ya kuenea duniani, hasa katika nchi za pato duni na za kati ya jamii bila mifumo ya afya bora.
en-mt: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that PHEIC was "at risk of spreading globally, especially in low-income and middle-class countries without quality health systems."

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Kwa itikio kuhusu utekelezaji wa vikwazao vya usafiri, Tedros alisema kuwa "hakuna sababu kwa hatua ambazo zinaathiri usafiri wa kimataifa na biashara" na kuwa "WHO haipendekezi kupunguza biashara na usafiri."
en-mt: In response to the implementation of travel restrictions, Tedros said that "there is no justification for measures that affect international travel and trade" and that "WHO does not recommend limiting trade and travel."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Tarehe 5 Februari, WHO iliomba jumuiya ya kimataifa kwa mchango wa milioni $675 kufadhili matayarisho ya kina katika nchi zenye mapato duni, akitaja haraka inayohitajika kusaidia nchi ambazo "hazina mifumo ya kutambua watu walioambukizwa na virusi, hata kama ingetokea".
en-mt: On February 5, the WHO appealed to the international community for a $675 million donation to fund comprehensive preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency needed to help countries that "do not have systems to identify people infected with the virus, even if it did occur".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: Tedros alitoa taarifa zaidi akisema kuwa "tuko na nguvu tu kama kiungo chetu dhaifu" na kuhimiza jumuiya ya kimataifa "kuwekeza leo au kulipa zaidi baadaye".Tarehe 11 Februari, WHO katika mkutano na waandishi wa habari walithibitisha COVID-19 kama jina la ugonjwa.
en-mt: Tedros issued a further statement saying that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urging the international community to "invest today or pay more later". On February 11th, the WHO in a press conference confirmed COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: Siku hiyo, Tedros alisema kuwa Katibu Mkuu wa UN António Guterres alikubali kutoa "mamlaka ya mfumo yote ya UN katika itikio".
en-mt: On that day, Tedros said that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to give the "entire UN system authority in response".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: Timu ya Kudhibiti Hali ya Hatari ya UN ilianzishwa kwa sababu hiyo, na kuruhusu ushirikiano wa itikio la Umoja wa Mataifa,
en-mt: The UN Emergency Management Team was established for this reason, allowing for the cooperation of the UN response,

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Tarehe 14 Februari, Timu ya Misheni iliyoongozwa na WHO na Uchina ilianzishwa kutoa wataalam wa kimataifa na wa WHO Uchina kusaidia katika udhibiti wa taifa na kutathmini :kiwango na usambazaji wa ugonjwa" kwa kusimamia warsha na mikutano na taasisi muhimu za taifa na kutembelea maeneo tofauti kutathmini "athari za shughuli za mwitikio katika viwango vya mikoa na kitaifa, ikiwemo sehemu za vijijini na mijini.Tarehe 25 Februari, WHO ilitangaza kuwa "ulimwengu yafaa kufanya zaidi na kujitayarisha kwa uwezekano wa kuwepo kwa janga la virusi vya korona," wakisema kuwa ilhali ilikuwa bado mapema kuliita janga, nchi hata hivyo zinafaa kuwa katika "hali ya kuwa tayari".
en-mt: On 14 February, a Mission Team led by WHO and China was established to provide international and WHO China experts to assist in national control and assess :the extent and distribution of the disease" by managing workshops and meetings with key national institutions and visiting different areas to assess "the impact of response activities at the provincial and national levels,  including rural and urban areas. On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more and prepare for the possibility of a coronavirus pandemic," saying that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries nevertheless should be in "a state of readiness."

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: Kama itikio kwa mkurupuko unaoendelea Irani, WHO ilituma Timu ya Misheni ya Pamoja huko kutathmini hali.Tarehe 28 Februari, ofisa wa WHO walisema kuwa utathmini wa tishio la virusi vya korona katika kiwango cha kimataifa itaongezwa kutoka "juu" hadi "juu zaidi", kiwango cha juu zaidi cha tahadhari na utathmini wa hatari.
en-mt: As a reaction to the ongoing outbreak in Iran, WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation. On 28 February, a WHO official said that coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be increased from "high" to "highest", the highest alert level and risk assessment.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: Mike Ryan, mkurugenzi mkuu wa mpango wa WHO wa hali ya dharura za afya, alitoa onyo katika taarifa kuwa "Hii ni uhalisia wa mambo kwa kila serikali katika sayari: Amkeni.
en-mt: Mike Ryan, director-general of WHO's health emergencies program, issued a warning in a statement that "This is the reality of things for every government on the planet: Wake up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: Virusi huenda vipo njiani na unapaswa kuwa tayari," akihimiza kuwa hatua za itikio zinazofaa huweza kusaidia dunia kuzuia "hali mbaya zaidi".
en-mt: The virus is probably on its way and you should be ready," urging that appropriate response measures can help the world prevent "the worst-case scenario".

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ryan aliendelea kusema kuwa data za sasa haikuhalisisha ofisa wa afya ya umma kutangaza janga la kimataifa, wakisema kuwa tangazo kama hilo litamaanisha "tunakubali kimsingi kuwa kila binadamu katika sayari wataweza kuambukizwa na virusi hivyo."
en-mt: Ryan went on to say that the current data did not justify a public health official declaring a global pandemic, saying that such an announcement would mean "we basically accept that every human on the planet will be able to be infected by the virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Tarehe 11 Machi, WHO ilitangaza mkurupuko wa virusi vya korona kuwa janga.
en-mt: On March 11, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: Mkurugenzi Mkuu alisema kuwa WHO "ilikuwa na wasiwasi mkubwa na viwango vya kuenea na ukali wa ugonjwa, na via viwango vya kutisha ya kutoshughulika".WHO imepata lawama nyingi kwa kile kinachoonekana kama kutoshughulikia vyema janga, pamoja na kuchelewa kutangaza hali ya dharura ya afya ya umma na uainishaji wa virusi kama janga.
en-mt: The Director-General said that WHO was "deeply concerned by the prevalence and severity of the disease, and by the alarming levels of inaction". The WHO has received much of the blame for what is seen as a failure to properly respond to the pandemic, including delays in declaring a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: Lawama ilikuwa pamoja na ombi kwa Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa WHO Tedros Adhanom kujiuzulu, iliyotiwa sahihi na watu 733,000 kufikia 6 Aprili.
en-mt: The petition included a petition for WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to resign, signed by 733,000 people by 6 April.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Tarehe 26 Machi 2020, wataalam wengi wa haki za kibinadamu wa UN walisisitiza kuheshimu haki za kila binadamu katika janga la COVID-19.
en-mt: On 26 March 2020, many UN human rights experts stressed respect for every human rights in the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: Kikundi cha wataalam ilisema kuwa kila mtu ana haki ya mikakati ya kuokoa maisha na serikali ina jukumu hili.
en-mt: The expert group said that everyone has the right to life-saving strategies and the government has this responsibility.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: Kikundi hicho ilisisitiza kuwa ukosefu wa rasilimali au bima ya afya haipaswi kuwa sababu ya ubaguzi dhidi ya kikundi maalum.
en-mt: The group stressed that lack of resources or health insurance should not be a reason for discrimination against a specific group.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Wataalam hao walisisitiza kuwa kila mtu ana haki za afya, wakiwemo watu walemavu, walio katika vikundi ya watu wachache, watu wazee, watu waliohamishwa nchini, wasio na makazi, wanaoishi katika hali ya umaskini, walio kizuizini, pamoja na wakimbizi na vikundi vingine wanaohitaji msaada wa serikali.
en-mt: The experts stressed that everyone has health rights, including disabled people, minority groups, elderly people, internally displaced persons, the homeless, the living in poverty, the detained, as well as refugees and other groups in need of government assistance.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
