sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Kama vile sabuni, jivu pia ni bidhaa ya kuuwa viini kwa sababu ikichanganywa na maji, hutengeneza mchanganyiko wa alkalini.
en-mt: Like soap, ash is also a disinfectant product because when mixed with water, it creates an alkaline mixture.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO hupendekeza jivu au mchanga kama bidhaa mbadala za sabuni wakati sabuni haipatikani.
en-mt: WHO recommends ash or sand as alternative soap products when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Mbinu ya kuosha mikono kwa njia sahihi inayopendekezwa na Vituo vya Kuzuia na Kudhibiti Ugonjwa vya Marekani kwa ajili ya kuzua kusambaa kwa ugonjwa ni pamoja na hatua zifuatazo:
en-mt: The proper hand washing method recommended by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for detecting the spread of the disease includes the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Tumia maji vuguvugu kuosha mikono au maji baridi yanayotiririka.
en-mt: Use warm water to wash your hands or cool running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Maji yanayotiririka hupendekezwa kwa sababu besheni tuli zinaweza kuwa na uchafu, ingawa halijoto ya maji haionekani kuwa na tofauti.
en-mt: Flowing water is recommended because static basins can be contaminated, although water temperatures don't seem to make a difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Sugua mikono kwa kutumia kiwango tosha cha sabuni, ikiwa ni pamoja na sehemu za nyuma za mikono, katikati ya vidole na hata chini ya makucha.
en-mt: Rub hands with a reasonable amount of soap, including the back of the hands, between the fingers and even under the scalp.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Sabuni huondoa vijidudu kwenye ngozi, na tafiti zinaonyesha kwamba watu wana tabia ya kuosha mikono yao vyema zaidi wakitumia sabuni kuliko maji pekee.
en-mt: Soap removes germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands better using soap than water alone.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Sugua kwa angalau sekunde 20.
en-mt: Stick for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Kusugua husababisha msuguano, ambao husaidia kuondoa vijidudu kwenye ngozi na kusugua kwa muda mrefu zaidi huondoa hata vijidudu vingi zaidi.
en-mt: Rubbing causes friction, which helps remove germs from the skin and the longer rubbing removes even more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Suuza vyema ukitumia maji yanayotiririka.
en-mt: Wash well with running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Kusuuza kwenye besheni kunaweza kuchafua mikono tena.
en-mt: Rubbing on a basin can dirty hands again.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Kausha maji kwa kutumia taulo safi au uruhusu ikauke kwenye hewa.
en-mt: Dry the water with a clean towel or let it dry in the air.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Mikono ambayo ina majimaji na unyevu inaweza kuchafuka tena kwa urahisi.Sehemu ambazo mara nyingi husahaulika ni kidole gumba, kifundo cha mkono, maeneo katikati ya vidole na chini ya makucha.
en-mt: Hands that are hydraulic and moist can get easily re-stained. The parts that are often forgotten are the thumb, wrist, areas between the fingers and under the claws.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Makucha bandia na rangi za kupaka makucha zinaweka kubeba viini.
en-mt: Artificial wrinkles and paintbrushes keep carrying germs.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Mafuta ya kulainisha ngozi hupendekezwa mara kwa mara ili kusaidia mikono kutokauka; ngozi iliyokauka inaweza kusababisha uharibifu wa ngozi unaoweza kusababisha ongezeko la hatari ya kusambaa kwa maambukizi.
en-mt: Skin lubricating oil is recommended regularly to help hands from drying; Dry skin can cause skin damage that can lead to increased risk of infection spread.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Chaguo za bei ya chini zinaweza kutengenezwa ili kuwezesha kuosha mikono mahali maji ya mfereji na/au sabuni haipatikani kwa mfano kumwaga maji kutoka kwenye kibuyu chenye mashimo yanayofaa na/au kutumia jivu ikihitajika katika mataifa yanaendelea.Katika hali ambapo hakuna maji ya kutosha (kama vile shule na maeneo ya mashinani katika mataifa yanayoendelea), kuna suluhu za kuhifadhi maji, kama vile "mifereji ya utunzi" na chaguo zingine za gharama ya chini.
en-mt: Low-cost options can be developed to facilitate handwashing where canal water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a shed with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing nations. In cases where there is not enough water (such as schools and rural areas in developing nations), there are solutions to conserve water, such as "drainage canals" and other low-cost options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Mfereji wa kuning'inia ni teknolojia rahisi inayotumia jagi iliyofungwa kwa kamba na kidude kinachoendeshwa kwa miguu ili kumwaga maji kidogo mkononi na kwenye sabuni ya kipande.
en-mt: A hanging canal is a simple technology that uses a rope-wrapped javelin and a foot-operated gadget to pour a little water on the hand and onto a piece soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Kupanguza mikono kwa njia inayofaa ni sehemu muhimu ya mchakato wa kusafisha mikono, lakini mjadala unaendelea kuhusu njia zinazofaa zaidi za kupanguza mikono katika maeneo ya kuoshea ya umma.
en-mt: Proper hand brushing is an important part of the hand-washing process, but debate continues about the most appropriate ways to disinfect hands in public washrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Utafiti mkubwa unaokua unapendekeza kuwa taulo za karatasi ni njia safi zaidi kuliko vikausha mikono vya stima vilivyo ndani ya bafu nyingi.
en-mt: A growing body of research suggests that paper towels are way cleaner than hand-dryers located in most bathrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Mwaka wa 2008, utafiti ulifanywa na Chuo Kikuu cha Westminster, London, na kufadhiliwa na sekta ya watengenezaji taulo za karatasi Maonyesho ya Karatasi Shashi ya Ulaya, ili kulinganisha viwango vya usafi vinavyotolewa na taulo za karatasi, vikausha mikono vya hewa vuguvugu na vikausha mikono vya kisasa zaidi vya hewa aina ya jet-air.
en-mt: In 2008, a study was carried out by the University of Westminster, London, and funded by the paper towel manufacturer sector of the European Paper Fair, to compare the hygiene standards offered by paper towels, warm air dryers and more modern jet-air hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Baada ya kuosha na kukausha mikono kwa kutumia kikausha mikono kwa hewa vuguvugu, idadi ya jumla ya bakteria ilipatikana kuongezeka kwa wastani kwenye vidole kwa 194% kiganjani kwa 254%.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands using a hand dryer with warm air, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the fingers by 194% in the palm by 254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Kukausha mikono kwa kikaushi cha jet-air kulisababisha kuongezeka kwa wastani kwa idadi ya jumla ya bakteria kwenye vidole kwa 42% na kwenye viganja kwa 15%.
en-mt: Hand drying with a jet-air dryer resulted in a moderate increase in the total number of bacteria on the fingers by 42% and on the palms by 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Baada ya kuosha na kukausha mikono kwa tishu, idadi ya jumla ya bakteria ilipungua kwa wastani kwenye vidole kwa hadi 76%na kiganjani kwa hadi 77%.Wanasayansi hao pia walifanya majaribio ili kubaini iwapo kulikuwa na uwezekano wa uchafuzi wa watumiaji wa bafu zingine na mazingira ya bafu kutokana na kila aina ya mbinu ya kukausha mikono.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands with tissues, the total number of bacteria decreased on average on the fingers by up to 76% and in the palm by up to 77%. The scientists also conducted experiments to determine whether there was a possibility of contamination by users of other bathrooms and bathtub environments as a result of all sorts of hand drying techniques.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Mashine ya kukausha, inayotoa hewa ya kitengo kwa kasi inayodaiwa kuwa 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), ilikuwa na uwezo wa kupuliza viini kutoka mikononi na kitengo na uwezekano wa kuchafua watumiaji wengine wa bafu na mazingira ya bafu hadi mita 2.
en-mt: The drying machine, providing unit air at a speed claimed to be 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of spraying disinfectant from the hands and unit and potentially contaminating other users of the bathtub and bathtub environment up to 2 meters.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Matumizi ya kikausha mikono cha hewa vuguvugu hueneza viini hadi umbali wa mita 0.25 kutoka kwenye mashine hiyo.
en-mt: The use of a warm air dryer spreads germs up to 0.25 metres away from the machine.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Tishu hazikuonyesha maenezi ya mno ya viini.Mwaka wa 2005, utafiti uliofanywa na TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, mbinu tofauti za kukausha mikono zilitathminiwa.
en-mt: The tissues did not show excessive germ spread. In 2005, a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different methods of hand drying were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Mabadiliko yafuatayo katika idadi ya bakteria baada ya kukausha mikono yalishuhudiwa:
en-mt: The following changes in bacterial population after hand drying were witnessed:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Kunao watengenezaji wengi wa bidhaa za kupangusa mikono maji, na bidhaa hizi za kukausha mikono zimelinganishwa dhidi ya kutumia tishu.
en-mt: There are many manufacturers of hand drying products, and these hand drying products have been compared against using tissue.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Kuosha mikono kwa kutumia tishu ya mikono yenye kioevu cha kuua vijidudu ni njia mbadala wakati unasafiri na hakuna sabuni na maji.
en-mt: Washing hands using hand tissue containing disinfectant liquid is an alternative when traveling with no soap and water.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: Kioevu cha kuua vijidudu cha mikono kinafaa kuwa na angalau 60% ya pombe.
en-mt: Hand disinfectant liquid should contain at least 60% alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Kuosha mikono kimatibabu kukawa jambo la lazima muda mrefu baada ya mtaalamu kutoka Hungary, Ignaz Semmelweis kugundua ufanisi wake (mwaka wa 1846) katika kuzuia magonjwa katika mazingira ya hospitalini.
en-mt: Medical handwashing became mandatory long after Hungarian expert Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in hospital settings.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Kuna vifaa vya kielektroniki vinavyotumika kutoa majibu ya kuwakumbusha wafanyakazi wa hospitalini kuosha mikono yao wanaposahau.
en-mt: There are electronic devices used to provide answers to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Utafiti mmoja umepata kupungua kwa viwango vya maambukizi kutokana na matumizi yake.
en-mt: One study has found a decrease in infection rates due to its use.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Kuosha mikono kunapendekezwa kuwa kwa sekunde 15 kimatibabu, kwa kutumia kiwango tosha cha sabuni na maji au mafuta ya kusugua kila sehemu ya mikono.
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended for 15 seconds medically, using a sufficient amount of soap and water or oil to scrub each part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Mikono inapaswa kusuguliwa kwa pamoja kwa kufungamanisha vidole.
en-mt: Hands should be rubbed together by tying the fingers together.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Iwapo kuna uchafu chini ya makucha, brashi laini inaweza kutumika kuuondoa.
en-mt: If there is dirt under the claws, a soft brush can be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Kwa sababu vijidudu vinaweza kusalia kwenye maji yaliyo mkononi, ni muhimu kusuuza vyema na kukausha mikono kwa taulo safi.
en-mt: Because germs can remain in the water on hand, it is important to rinse thoroughly and dry hands with clean towels.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Baada ya kupangusa, tishu hizi zinafaa kutumiwa kufunga maji (na kufungua mlango wowote wa kutoka nje kama inatakikana).
en-mt: After rinsing, these tissues should be used to close the water (and open any exit door if needed).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Hii huzuia kuambukiza tena mikono kutokana na sehemu hizo.
en-mt: This prevents re-infection of hands from those parts.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Madhumuni ya kuosha mikono katika sehemu ya huduma za afya ni ili kuondoa viini vya magonjwa ("vijidudu") na kuzuia kuvisambaza.
en-mt: The purpose of hand washing in the health care section is to eliminate pathogens ("microbes") and prevent spreading them.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Jarida la The New England linaripoti kuwa ukosefu wa kuosha mikono unasalia katika viwango visivyokubalika katika mazingira mengi ya kimatibabu, huku idadi kubwa ya madaktari na wauguzi wakisahau kila mara kuosha mikono yao kabla ya kuwagusa wagonjwa na hivyo kusambaza viini.
en-mt: The New England Journal reports that the lack of hand washing remains at unacceptable levels in many medical settings, with increasing numbers of doctors and nurses regularly forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients and thus spreading germs.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Utafiti mmoja ulionyesha kwamba kuosha mikono ipasavyo na taratibu zingine rahisi zinaweza kupunguza kiwango cha maambukizi ya mtitiriko wa damu yanayohusiana na katheta kwa 66.Shirika la Afya Duniani limchapisha jedwali linaloonyesha njia za kawaida za kuosha na kusugua mikono katika sekta za matibabu.
en-mt: One study showed that proper handwashing and other simple procedures can reduce the rate of catheter-related blood flow infections by 66.The World Health Organization published a table showing the most common methods of washing and handwashing in medical sectors.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Mwongozo rasimu wa usafi wa mikono wa shirika pia unaweza unaweza kupatikana katika tovuti ya shirika kwa maoni ya umma.
en-mt: The organization's draft manual of hand hygiene can also be found at the agency's website for public comment.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Uchunguzi unaohusiana ulifanywa na Whitby na waandishi wengine.
en-mt: Related observations were made by Whitby and other authors.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Vifaa vya kibiashara vinaweza kupima na kuthibitisha usafi wa mikono, ikiwa maonyesho ya kufuata sheria inahitajika.
en-mt: Commercial facilities can test and verify hand hygiene, if a demonstration of compliance with the law is required.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani lina "Nyakati Tano" za kuosha mikono:
en-mt: The World Health Organization has "Five Habits" of Hand Washing:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: baada ya kuwa katika uwezekano wa kugusa damu/viowevu vya mwili
en-mt: after exposure to blood/body fluids

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: kabla ya jukumu linaloweza kuambukiza bakteria, na
en-mt: before the role that can infect bacteria, and

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: baada ya kumhudumia mgonjwa. Kuongezwa kwa kemikali za kuua bakteria kwa sabuni (sabuni "yenye dawa" au "yenye viua-viini") huwezesha bidhaa inayotumika kuosha mikono kuweza kuua bakteria.
en-mt: after taking care of the patient. The addition of bacterial disinfectants to soap ("spray-infected" or "disinfectant") enables the product used to wash hands to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Kitendo kama hicho cha kuua bakteriaviini kinaweza kuhitajika kabla ya kufanya upasuaji au katika mandhari ambayo viini ambavyo ni sugu kwa dawa za kuzuia na kuua bakteria vipo kwa wingi.Ili 'kusugua' mikono yako kwa upasuaji, ni muhimu kuwa na mfereji unaoweza kufunguliwa na kufungwa bila kuushika kwa mikono, kiasi cha kloroeksidini au myeyusho wa iodini, taulo zilizofishwa vimelea za kupangusa mikono baada ya kuosha, na brashi iliyofishwa vimelea ya kusugua na kifaa kingine kilichofishwa vimelea cha kusafisha chini ya makucha.
en-mt: Such an act of killing bacteria may be required before surgery or in a landscape where germs that are resistant to antibiotic and bacterial killing are present in abundance. In order to 'rub' your hands surgically, it is necessary to have a trench that can be opened and closed without holding it by hand, a chloroxine or iodine smelter, a towel with a disinfectant to wash hands after washing, and a disinfectant brush to scrub and other disinfectant cleaning device under the scalps.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Vito vyote vinafaa kutolewa.
en-mt: All items should be provided.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Utaratibu huu huhitaji kuosha mikono na kigasha cha mikono hadi kwenye kiwiko, kwa kawaida kwa dakika 2-6.
en-mt: This procedure requires washing hands with a hand to elbow to elbow, usually for 2-6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Muda mrefu wa kusugua wa (dakika 10) hauhitajiki.
en-mt: A long rinse time of (10 minutes) is not required.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Wakati unasuuza, lazima yaliyo kwenye kigasha cha mkono yazuiliwe kutiririka nyuma na kurudi tena kwa mkono.
en-mt: When you are rinsing, the contents of the hand must be prevented from flowing back and forth in the hand.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Baada ya muda wa kuosha mikono ikukamilika, mikono hupanguswa kwa nguo iliyofishwa vimelea na gauni ya upasuaji kuvaliwa.
en-mt: After the handwashing is complete, the hands are swabbed with a disinfectant cloth and a surgical gown worn.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Ili kupunguza usambazaji wa vijidudu, ni vyema kuosha mikono au kutumia kemikali ya kuua baktria kabla na baada ya kuhudumia mgonjwa.
en-mt: To reduce the spread of germs, it is advisable to wash hands or use a disinfectant before and after taking care of the patient.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Kwa udhibiti wa maambukizi yanayosababishwa na bakteria katika hospitali, imegunduliwa kuwa faida kubwa zaidi kutoka kuosha mikono ilitokea katika 20% ya kwanza ya kuosha, na kuwa faida duni ilipatikana wakati kiwango cha kuosha mikono kiliongezwa zaidi ya 35%.
en-mt: For the control of bacterial-caused infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest gain from hand washing occurred in the first 20% of washing, and that the poorest benefit was achieved when the amount of handwashing was increased more than 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Kuosha kwa sabuni pekee husababisha usambazaji zaidi ya mara tatu wa kiwango cha ugonjwa unaoambukizwa na bakteria unaoenezwa kwa chakula ikilinganishwa na kuosha na sabuni yenye kemikali ya kuua bakteria.Ikilinganishwa na kusugua mikono kwa kutumia mchanganyiko ulio na pombe na kuosha mikono kwa sabuni iliyo na kemikali za kuua bakteria kwa muda wa wastani wa sekunde 30 yote yalionyesha kuwa kusugua mikono kwa mchanganyiko ulio na pombe kulipunguza maambukizi ya bakteria kwa 26% zaidi kuliko sabuni yenye kemikali ya kuua bakteria.
en-mt: Washing with soap alone results in more than three times the rate of bacteria-borne illness transmitted by food compared to washing with a detergent containing a bacteria-killing chemical. Compared to rubbing hands using alcohol-infused mixture and washing hands with detergent containing bacterial disinfectants for an average duration of 30 seconds both showed that rubbing hands with alcohol-infused mixture reduced bacterial infections by 26% more than detergent containing bacterial disinfectant.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Lakini sabuni na maji hufaa zaidi kuliko mchanganyiko wa kusugua mikono wenye pombe kwa kupunguza virusi vya homa ya mafua vya H1N1 A na chembe za Clostrridium difficile kutoka kwa mikono.Mikakati ya kuboresha usafi wa mikono katika mandhari ya huduma ya afya inaweza kuhusisha elimu ya wafanyakazi kuhusu kuosha mikono, kuongeza kupatikana kwa mchanganyiko wa kusugua mikino ulio na pombe, na makumbusho yaliyoandikwa na ya kusemwa kwa wafanyakazi.
en-mt: But soap and water are more effective than alcohol-based hand-rubber blends by reducing H1N1 A-type influenza virus and Clostrridium difficile particles from the hands. Strategies to improve hand hygiene in the healthcare landscape may involve employee education about hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-infused hand-washing mixes, and written and spoken reminders for staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Kuna hitaji la utafiti zaidi katika ipi kati ya mikakati haya yana ufanisi katika mandhari tofauti ya huduma ya afya.
en-mt: There is a need for more research into which of these strategies are effective in different healthcare landscapes.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Katika nchi zinazoendelea, kuosha mikono kwa sabuni kunatambulika kama kifaa chenye gharama ya chini, kilicho muhimu katika kuwa na afya njema, na hata lishe bora.
en-mt: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a low-cost, essential tool for maintaining good health, and even good nutrition.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Hata hivyo, ukosefu wa maji yanayotegemeka, vifaa vya kuosha mikono au sabuni katika nyumba za watu, shuleni na maeneo ya kazi ni changamoto katika kutimiza tabia ya ulimwengu ya kuosha mikono.
en-mt: However, the lack of reliable water, hand washing facilities or soap in people's homes, schools and workplaces is a challenge in fulfilling the global habit of hand washing.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Kwa mfano, vijijini vingi vyetu barani Afrika maeneo ya kuosha mikono karibu na kila choo ya kibinafsi au ya umma ni machache, hata ingawa njia za bei nafuu zipo za kujenga vituo vya kuosha mikono.
en-mt: For example, many of our villages in Africa handwashing areas near every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheaper ways exist to build handwashing stations.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Hata hivyo, viwango vya chini vya kuosha mikono pia vinaweza kuwa matokeo ya tabia ya kuzoea bali si kwa sababu ya kukosekana kwa sabuni au maji.
en-mt: However, low handwashing rates may also be the result of habituation but not due to the absence of soap or water.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Ukuzaji na utetezi wa kuosha mikono kwa sabuni unaweza kuathiri maamuzi ya sera, kuongeza ufahamu kuhusu manufaa ya kunawa mikono na kusababisha mabadiliko ya tabia ya muda mrefu ya watu.
en-mt: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to changes in people's long-term behavior.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Ili hii ifanye kazi kwa ufanisi, ufuatiliaji na tathmini ni muhimu.
en-mt: In order for this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are essential.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa utaratibu wa tafiti 70 ulipata kuwa mbinu zinazohusisha jamii hufaa katika kuongeza kuosha kwa mikono katika LMIC, huku kampeni za kuhimiza jamii kubadilisha tabia zikifaa kwa kiwango cha chini.Mfano moja wa ukuzaji wa kuosha mikono katika shule ni "Mbinu ya Nyota Tatu" ya UNICEF inayohimiza shule kuchukua hatua rahisi, zenye gharama ya chini ili kuhakikisha kuwa wanafunzi wanaosha mikono yao kwa sabuni, kati ya mahitaji mengine ya usafi.
en-mt: A systematic study of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective in increasing hand washing in LMICs, while campaigns to encourage communities to change behaviour are effective at a minimum. One example of the promotion of hand washing in schools is UNICEF's "Three Star Method" that encourages schools to take simple, low-cost measures to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygiene requirements.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Wakati viwango vya chini vimetimizwa, shule zinaweza kusonga kutoka nyota moja hadi mwishowe nyota tatu.
en-mt: When minimum standards are met, schools can move from one star to eventually three stars.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Kujenga vituo vya kuosha mikono kunaweza kuwa sehemu ya kampeni za kukuza kuosha mikono zinazoendelezwa ili kupunguza magonjwa na vifo vya watoto.
en-mt: Building handwashing stations could be part of the handwashing promotion campaigns being developed to reduce child morbidity and mortality.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Siku ya Kuosha Mikono ya Dunia ni mfano mwingine wa kampeni ya kuongeza ufahamu inayojaribu kuleta mabadiliko ya tabia.Kutokana na janga kuu la virusi vya korona la 2019-20, UNICEF iliboresha kutumika kwa emoji ya kunawa mikono.
en-mt: World Hand Washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign trying to bring about behavioral change. Due to the major coronavirus pandemic of 2019-20, UNICEF improved the use of handwashing emoji.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Idadi ndogo ya uchunguzi imezingatia gharama nafuu kwa jumla ya kuosha mikono katika nchi zinazoendelea kwa uhusiano na kipimo cha DALY.
en-mt: A small number of studies have focused on the cost-effectiveness overall of hand washing in developing countries in relation to the DALY measurement.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Hata hivyo, uchunguzi moja hupendekeza kuwa kuhimiza kuosha kwa mikono kwa kutumia sabuni huwa na gharama nafuu sana kuliko mikakati mingine ya maji na usafi.
en-mt: However, one study suggests that encouraging hand washing using soap tends to be less costly than other water and hygiene strategies.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Umuhimu wa kuosha mikono kwa afya ya binadamu - hasa kwa watu katika hali ya hatari kama vile kina mama ambao wamejifungua au askari waliopata majeraha katika hospitali - uligunduliwa kwanza katikati mwa karne ya 19 na watangulizi wawili wa usafi wa mikono: daktari kutoka Hungary kwa jina Ignaz Semmelweis amabye alifanya kazi Vienna, Australia na Florence Nightingale, Mwiingereza "mwanzilishi wa uuguzi wa kisasa".
en-mt: The importance of hand washing for human health - especially for people in dangerous situations such as mothers who have given birth or soldiers who have suffered injuries in hospitals - was first discovered in the mid-19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: a Hungarian doctor named Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Australia and Florence Nightingale,  A British "pioneer of modern nursing".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Wakati huo watu wengi bado waliamini kuwa maambukizi yalisababishwa na harufu mbaya iliyojulikana kama miasmas.
en-mt: At that time many people still believed that the infection was caused by a fragrance known as miasmas.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Mnamo muda wa 1980, mikurupuko iliyosababishwa kupitia vyakula na maambukizi yaliyohusiana na huduma za afya ilifanya Kituo cha Uthibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa ya Marekani kuendeleza kikamilifu usafi wa mikono kama njia muhimu ya kuzuia kuenea kwa maambukizi.
en-mt: In the 1980s, outbreaks caused through foodstuffs and healthcare-related infections made the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention actively promote hand hygiene as an essential means of preventing the spread of infection.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Mkurupuko wa homa ya mafua mnamo 2009 na janga la COVID-19 mnamo 2020 ulisabababisha kuongezeka kwa ufahamu katika nchi nyingi wa umuhimu wa kuosha mikono kwa kutumia sabuni ili kujilinda kutokana na magonjwa ya kuambukizwa kama hayo.
en-mt: The flu outbreak in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of hand washing using soap to protect themselves from such contagious diseases.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Kwa mfano, mabango yaliyoandikwa "mbinu sahihi za kuosha mikono" yalibandikwa karibu na sinki za kuosha mikono katika vyoo vya umma na katika vyoo vya majengo ya ofisi na viwanja vya ndege nchini Ujerumani.
en-mt: For example, posters labeled "proper handwashing techniques" were pasted around hand-washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Kifungu "kuosha mikono yako kutoka kwa" jambo, humaanisha kutangaza kwa mtu kutotaka kuchukua jukumu la jambo au kujiunga na wengine katika jambo isiyo halali au ya kimaadili.
en-mt: The phrase "wash your hands from" matter, means declaring to one not wanting to take responsibility for a matter or join others in an illegal or immoral affair.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Kinatoka katika kifungu cha bibilia katika Mathayo ambapo Pilato aliosha mikono yake kutoka kwa uamuzi wa kusulubisha Yesu Kristo, lakini kimekuwa kifungu kinachotumika pakubwa katika baadhi ya jamii za Uingereza.
en-mt: It comes from a biblical passage in Matthew where Pilate washed his hands from the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but it has become a phrase widely used in some British communities.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Katika Macbeth ya Shakespeare, Binti Macbeth anaanza kuosha mikono yake kwa shurutisho ili kujaribu kusafisha doa inayodhaniwa, akiashiria dhamiri ya hatia kuhusu uhalifu aliotenda na kumshawishi mumewe kutenda.
en-mt: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Daughter Macbeth begins washing her hands in a huff to try to clear the supposed stain, implying a guilty conscience about the crime she committed and convincing her husband to act.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Imegunduliwa pia kuwa watu, baada ya kukumbuka au kutafakari matendo yasiyo na maadili, huonekana kuosha mikono zaidi kuliko wengine, na huonekana kuthamini vifaa vya kuosha mikono zaidi.
en-mt: It has also been found that people, after remembering or contemplating immoral actions, appear to wash hands more than others, and seem to value hand-washing devices more.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Zaidi ya hayo, wale wanaokubaliwa kuosha mikono yao baada ya kutafakari mambo kama hayo huwa na uwezekano wa chini wa kujihusisha katika vitendo vingine vya kulipia upungufu kwa "utakaso", kama vile kujitolea.
en-mt: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after contemplating such things tend to be less likely to engage in other acts of paying for shortfalls by "purification", such as volunteering.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Dini huagiza kuosha mikono kwa sababu ya usafi na kama ishara. Kuosha mikono kama ishara, kuosha mikono kwa kutumia maji bila sabuni, ni sehemu ya ibada ya kuosha mikono katika dini nyingi, ikiwemo Imani ya Bahá'í , Uhindu, tevilah na netilat yadayim katika Uyahudi, Lavabo katika Ukristo, na Wudhu katika Uislamu.Dini pia huagiza kuosha mikono kwa usafi, hasa baada ya vitendo fulani.
en-mt: Religion mandates washing hands for the sake of hygiene and as a symbol. Washing hands as a symbol, washing hands with water without soap, is part of the ritual of hand washing in many religions, including the Bahá'í Faith , Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.The religion also mandates cleanly washing of hands, especially after certain practices.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Uhindu, Uyahudi na Uislamu huagiza kuosha mikono baada ya kutumia choo.
en-mt: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing hands after using the toilet.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Na, Uhindu, Dini ya Buddha, Dini ya Sikh, Uyahudi na Uislamu huagiza kuosha mikono kabla ya na kila baada ya kula chakula.
en-mt: And, Hinduism, Buddhist Religion, Sikh Religion, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Vidhibiti vya hatari kazini ya COVID-19
en-mt: COVID-19 risk management

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Vidhibiti vya hatari kazini vya COVID-19 ni matumizi ya mbinu za usalama kazini na afya ya kudhibiti hatari katika kuzuia ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: COVID-19 occupational risk controls are the application of occupational safety and health risk management techniques in the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Vidhibiti vinavyofaa vya hatari kazini hulingana na sehemu ya kazi na kazi unaotekelezwa, inayofuata utathmini wa hatari ya chanzo cha kuwemo hatarini, kiwango cha ugonjwa katika jamii, na sababu za hatari ya wafanyakazi ambao huenda wanaweza kuambukizwa COVID-19.
en-mt: Appropriate occupational risk controls correspond to the workplace and the work being carried out, following an assessment of the risk of the source of exposure, the level of illness in the community, and the risk factors of workers who may be infected with COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa Utawala wa Usalama wa Kikazi na Afya ya Marekani (OSHA), kazi za kuwemo hatarini chache zina kutangamana na watu kikazi mara chache na umma na wafanyakazi wengine, na hatua msingi za kuzuia maambukizi zinapendekezwa, ikiwa ni pamoja na kuosha mikono, kuhimiza wafanyakazi kukaa nyumbani ikiwa ni wagonjwa, adabu ya kupumua, na kudumisha usafi wa utaratibu na kusafisha kwa dawa mandhari ya kazi.
en-mt: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low-risk occupations have few contact with the public and other workers, and basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if sick, breathing modesty, and maintaining systematic hygiene and disinfecting the workplace.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Kazi za kuwemo hatarini kwa kiwango cha wastani ni pamoja na zile zinazohitaji kutangamana mara kwa mara au karibu na watu ambao hawajulikani au kushukiwa kuwa na COVID-19, lakini huwezekana wameambukizwa kutokana na usambazaji unaoendelea wa jamii au usafiri wa kimataifa.
en-mt: Moderate risk occupations include those requiring frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected to have COVID-19, but are likely to have been infected as a result of ongoing community transmission or international travel.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Hii inajumuisha wafanyakazi ambao hutangamana na umma kwa ujumla kama vile shuleni, mandhari ya kazi yenye idadi ya watu wengi, na sehemu kadhaa ya biashara rejareja yenye watu wengi.
en-mt: This includes workers who interact with the general public such as at schools, a crowded work landscape, and several parts of a crowded retail business.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Vidhibiti vya hatari kwa kikundi hiki, zaidi ya hatua msingi za kuzuia maambukizi, inajumuisha uingizaji hewa kwa kutumia chujio ya hewa ya hali ya juu, vizuizi vya kupiga chafya, na kuwa na vifaa vya kujikinga kibinafsi kupatikana ikiwa mtu aliye na COVID-19 hupatikana.
en-mt: Risk controls for this group, beyond basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using a state-of-the-art air filter, sneezing restrictions, and having personal protective equipment available if someone with COVID-19 is found.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA inachukulia wafanyakazi wa afya na wa vyumba vya kuhifadhia maiti kuwemo hatarini na watu wanaojulikana au kushukiwa kuwa na COVID-19 kuwa katika hatari kubwa ya kuwemo hatarini, ambayo inaongezeka kuwa hatarini zaidi ikiwa wafanyakazi hufanya utaratibu zinazotoa erosoli katika, au kukusanya na kushughulikia violezo, vinavyojulikana au kushukiwa kutoka kwa mtu aliye na COVID-19.
en-mt: OSHA considers health and restroom workers to be at risk and people known or suspected to have COVID-19 to be at high risk, which is further endangered if workers perform procedures that release aerosols in, or collect and handle templates, known or suspected from a person with COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Udhibiti wa hatari zinazofaa wafanyakazi hawa hujumuisha udhibiti za uhandisi kama vile vyumba vilivyo na hewa iliyo kiwango cha chini na mazingira, na vifaa vya kujikinga kibinafsi vinavyofaa kazi inayofanywa.
en-mt: Controls for appropriate hazards these workers include engineering controls such as rooms with low-level air and environment, and personal protective equipment suitable for the work being performed.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Mikurupuko ya COVID-19 inaweza kuwa na madhara nyingi katika maeneo ya kazi.
en-mt: COVID-19 outbreaks can have multiple effects in the workplace.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Wafanyakazi huweza kukosa kazi kutokana na kuwa wagonjwa, kuhitaji kutunza wengine, au kwa woga wa kuweza kuwa hatarini.
en-mt: Workers may be unable to work due to being sick, needing to care for others, or for fear of being at risk.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Mitindo ya biashara huweza kubadilika, katika aina ya bidhaa zinazohitajika, na njia za kupata bidhaa hizo (kama vile kununua bidhaa nyakati ambapo hakuna watu wengi au kupitia upelekaji au huduma za kupitia ukiwa garini).
en-mt: Business styles can change, both in the type of goods needed, and ways of obtaining those goods (such as buying goods in times when there are not many people or through delivery or services to go through the car).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Mwisho, usafirishaji wa bidhaa kutoka maeneo zilizoathirika vibaya na COVID-19 huweza kukatizwa.Mipango ya matayarisho na mwitikio wa ugonjwa wa kuambukizwa huweza kutumiwa kuongoza hatua za ulinzi.
en-mt: Lastly, the movement of goods from areas hit hard by COVID-19 may be disrupted. Preparedness plans and response to infectious disease can be used to guide protection measures.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Mipango hushughulikia viwango vya hatari vinavyohusiana na sehemu za kazi tofauti na kazi zinazofanywa, ikijumuisha sababu za kuwa hatarini, hali ya uwezekano wa kuathiriwa kutokana na sehemu za nyumbani na jamii, na hali ya hatari ya wafanyakazi binafsi kama vile uzee au hali za kimatibabu sugu.
en-mt: The plans address risk levels associated with workplaces as opposed to the work being performed, including risk factors, potential vulnerability due to home and community placements, and individual workers' risk factors such as old age or chronic medical conditions.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Zinaorodhesha pia udhibiti zinazofaa kukabiliana na hatari hizo, na mipango ya dharura kwa hali zinazoweza kutokea kufuatia mkurupuko.
en-mt: They also list appropriate controls to deal with those risks, and contingency plans for potential situations following an outbreak.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Matayarisho ya magonjwa ya kuambukizwa na mipango ya mwitikio huweza kufuata mapendekezo ya taifa au eneo fulani.
en-mt: Infectious disease preparations and response plans may follow the recommendations of a specific nation or region.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Malengo ya mwitikio kwa mkurupuko hujumuisha kupunguza usambazaji kati ya wafanyakazi, kulinda watu ambao wako hatarini zaidi kwa matatizo sugu ya kimatibabu, kudumisha operesheni za biashara, na kupunguza athari mbaya kwa mashirika mengine na wanaohusika katika kusafirisha bidhaa.
en-mt: Response goals for the outbreak include reducing supply among workers, protecting people who are most vulnerable to chronic medical problems, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse impacts on other organizations and those involved in transporting goods.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Ukali wa ugonjwa katika jamii ambapo biashara iko huathiri mwitikio unaochukuliwa.
en-mt: The severity of the disease in the community where the business is located affects the response taken.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Mfumo wa viwango ya udhibiti wa hatari ni mfumo unaotumiwa sana katika usalama wa kikazi na afya kuweka katika vikundi udhibiti wa hatari kulingana na ufanisi.
en-mt: The risk management standards system is a widely used system in occupational safety and health to group risk controls based on effectiveness.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Mahali ambapo hatari za COVID-19 haziwezi kukomeshwa, udhibiti zinazofaa zaidi ni za uhandisi, zikifuatiwa na udhibiti za utawala, na mwisho vifaa vya kujikinga kibinafsi.
en-mt: Where the risks of COVID-19 cannot be ruled out, the most appropriate controls are engineering, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Udhibiti za uhandisi zinahusisha kutenga wafanyakazi kutoka hatari zinazohusiana na kazi bila kutegemea tabia ya wafanyakazi, na inaweza kuwa yenye suluhisho yenye gharama nafuu kutekeleza.
en-mt: Engineering controls involve isolating workers from work-related hazards independent of workers' behavior, and can be cost-effective solutions to implement.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Udhibiti wa utawala ni mabadiliko katika sera za kazi au utaratibu zinazohitaji hatua na mfanyakazi au mwajira.
en-mt: Administrative control is a change in labor policy or procedure that requires action by an employee or a seasonalist.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Vifaa vya kujikinga kibinafsi (PPE) zinazingatiwa kuwa matokeo duni kuliko udhibiti za uhandisi na utawala, lakini huweza kuzuia baadhi ya matukio ya kuwepo hatarini.
en-mt: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered to be a poorer outcome than engineering and administrative controls, but it can prevent some cases of being at risk.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Aina zote za PPE lazima zichaguliwe kulingana na hatari kwa mfanyakazi, na kuvaliwa vyema inavyotakikana (k.m., mashine za kusaidia kupumua), kila wakati na kuvaliwa vizuri, kukaguliwa mara kwa mara, kudumishwa, na kubadilishwa, inavyotakikana, na kuondolewa vizuri, kusafishwa, na kuwekwa au kutupwa kuzuia maambukizi.
en-mt: All types of PPE must be selected according to the risk to the employee, and worn as best as needed (e.g., ventilators), always well worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as needed, and properly removed, sanitized, and placed or disposed of to prevent infection.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa Utawala wa Usalama wa Kikazi na Afya (OSHA) ya Marekani, kazi za kuwemo hatarini chache zina kutangamana na watu kikazi na umma na wafanyakazi wengine.
en-mt: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low-risk jobs are in contact with the public and other workers.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Hatua msingi za kuzuia maambukizi zilizopendekezwa kwa mandhari za kazi zote inajumuisha kuosha kwa mikono mara kwa mara na vizuri, kuhimiza wafanyakazi kubaki nyumbani ikiwa ni wagonjwa, adabu ya kupumua ikiwemo kufunika kikohozi na kupiga chafya, kutoa tishu na pipa za takataka, kujitayarisha kwa kufanya kazi kutoka nyumbani au kufanya kazi kwa zamu zilizolegezwa kama inahitajika, kuwashauri wafanyakazi kutotumia vifaa vya wengine, na kudumisha usafishaji wa uratibu na kusafisha kwa dawa ya mandhari ya kazi.
en-mt: The basic infection prevention measures recommended for all work themes include regular and proper hand washing, encouraging employees to stay home if sick, breathing modesty including covering coughs and sneezing, emptying tissues and trash bins, preparing for working from home or working in relaxed shifts as needed,  advising employees not to use others' equipment, and maintain coordinated cleaning and disinfecting of the work landscape.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Kugundua haraka na kutengwa kwa watu ambao wanakisiwa kuwa na maambukizi ni hatua muhimu katika kulinda wafanyakazi, wateja, wageni, na wengine katika sehemu ya kazi.
en-mt: Rapid detection and isolation of people who are suspected to be infected is an important step in protecting employees, customers, visitors, and others in the workplace.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Kituo cha Udhibiti na Uzuiaji wa Magonjwa ya Marekani (CDC) inapendekeza kuwa wafanyakazi walio na dalili za ugonjwa sugu ya kupumua wanafaa kukaa nyumbani hadi hawana hali ya joto jingi, dalili za hali ya joto jingi, na dalili zozote zingine kwa angalau masaa 24 bila utumizi wa madawa ya kupunguza hali ya joto jingi au kukabiliana na dalili, na kuwa sera za likizo ya ugonjwa zinzobadilika kulingana na hali, kuwaruhusu wafanyakazi kukaa nyumbani kumhudumia mshiriki wa familia ambaye ni mgonjwa, na kuwa wafanyakazi wanafahamu sera hizi.
en-mt: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that workers with symptoms of chronic respiratory illness should stay home until they do not have high temperatures, symptoms of high temperature, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of antiretroviral drugs or to deal with symptoms.  and that sick leave policies change depending on circumstances, allowing employees to stay home to care for a family member who is sick, and that employees are aware of these policies.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Kwa mujibu wa OSHA, kazi za kuwa hatarini kwa kiwango cha wastani inajumuisha zile ambazo zinahitaji kutangamana na watu mara kwa mara au kuwa karibu na watu kati ya futi sita (mita 1.8) ambao hawajulikani au kushukiwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19, lakini huenda wameambukizwa na SARS-CoV-2 kutokana na usambazaji unaoendelea wa kijamii karibu na eneo la biashara, au kwa sababu mtu huyo amesafiri kimataifa hivi karibuni hadi eneo iliyo na usambazaji mkubwa wa COVID-19.
en-mt: According to OSHA, moderate-risk occupations include those that require frequent contact or close contact with people within six feet (1.8 meters) who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may have been infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing social transmission around the business area,  or because the person has recently traveled internationally to an area with a high COVID-19 supply.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Hii inajumuisha wafanyakazi ambao hutangamana na umma kwa jumla kama vile katika shule, mandhari ya kazi yenye watu wengi, na sehemu zingine za biashara rejereja yenye watu wengi.Vidhibiti vya uhandisi kwa hii na vikundi vyenye uwezekano mkubwa ya maambukizi inajumuisha kuweka chujio za hewa ya hali ya juu, kuongeza viwango vya uingizaji hewa, kuweka vizuizi kama vile vizuizi angavu za kupiga chafya, na kuweka dirisha la kupitia kwa unapoendesha gari kwa huduma ya wateja.Udhibiti za utawala kwa kikundi hiki na vingine vilivyo hatarini ni pamoja na kuhimiza wafanyakazi wagonjwa kukaa nyumbani, kubadilisha mikutano ya uso kwa uso na mawasiliano kwa njia za kimtandao, kuanzisha kufanya kazi kwa zamu zilizolegezwa, kukatiza safari zisizohitajika katika maeneo yaliyo na mkurupuko unaoendelea wa COVID-19, kutunga mipango ya mawasiliano ya dharura ikiwemo jukwaa la kujibu maswali ya wafanyakazi, kutoa elimu na mafunzo ya sasa kuhusu hali za hatari ya COVID-19 na tabia za kujikinga, kufunza wafanyakazi wanaohitaji kutumia nguo na vifaa vya kujikinga jinsi ya kuzitumia, kutoa rasilimali na mandhari ya kazi inayosisitiza usafi wa kibinafsi, kuosha mikono mara kwa mara, kupunguza ufikivu wa wateja na umma kwa sehamu ya kazi, na kubandika ishara kuhusu kuosha mikono na hatua zingine za kuzuia COVID-19.Kulingana na kazi inayofanywa, wafanyakazi walio na kiwango cha wastani chache ya maambukizi huenda wakahitaji kuvaa vifaa vya kijikinga kibinafsi ikiwemo baadhi ya mchanganyiko wa glavu, gauni, kizuizi cha uso au barakoa ya uso, au miwani.
en-mt: This includes workers who interact with the general public such as in schools, crowded work landscapes, and other parts of a crowded retail business. Engineering controls for this and the most likely transmission groups include putting in high-quality air filters, increasing ventilation levels, setting barriers such as bright sneeze barriers, and setting a through-out window for when driving for customer service. Administrative controls for this and other vulnerable groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with online contacts, introducing relaxed shifts, interrupting unwanted travel in areas with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, enacting emergency communication plans including a forum to answer staff questions,  provide current education and training on COVID-19 risk situations and protective behaviors, train employees in need of using clothing and protective equipment how to use them, provide resources and work themes that emphasize personal hygiene, wash hands frequently, limit customer and public access to work space, and paste signs about hand washing and other COVID-19 prevention measures. Depending on the work being done, workers with moderate to few infection levels may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, gowns, a face restraint or face mask, or glasses.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Ni nadra kwa wafanyakazi katika kikundi hiki cha hatari huhitaji kutumia mashine ya kusaidia kupumua.
en-mt: It is rare for workers in this high-risk group to require the use of a breathing aid machine.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Ikiwa mtu anakuwa mgonjwa katika ndege, uthabiti vyema kulinda wafanyakazi na abiria wengine hujumuisha kutenga mtu mgonjwa na wengine kwa umbali wa futi 6, kuchagua mfanyakazi mmoja wa ndege kushughulikia mgonjwa, na kumpa barakoa ya uso mgonjwa au kumwomba mgonjwa kufunika mdomo na mapua yao na tishu anapokohoa au kupiga chafya.
en-mt: If a person becomes ill on a flight, consistency better to protect the crew and other passengers includes isolating the sick person and others at a distance of 6 feet, selecting one flight attendant to handle the patient, and giving the patient a face mask or asking the patient to cover their mouth and nose with tissue when they cough or sneeze.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Wafanyakazi wa ndege wanafaa kuvaa glavu za kimatibabu unazoweza kutupa wanapohudumia abiria mgonjwa au kugusa majimaji ya mwili au sehemu ambazo huenda zimeambukizwa, na ikiwezekana vifaa zaidi vya kujikinga kibinafsi ikiwa abiria mgonjwa ana joto jingi, anakohoa sana, au ugumu wa kupumua.
en-mt: Flight crew members should wear medical gloves you can throw away when caring for a sick passenger or touching bodily fluids or surfaces that may have been infected, and preferably more personal protective equipment if a sick passenger has high temperatures, coughs heavily, or difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Glavu na zana zingine zinazotupwa baada ya matumizi hazifai kutupwa katika mifuko maalum ya kubeba takataka ya hospitali, na sehemu zilizoambukizwa zinafaa zipanguzwe na kusafishwa kwa dawa baadaye.Kwa usafirishaji wa meli, ikiwemo meli za kifahari na vyombo vingine za abiria, vidhibiti vya hatari ni pamoja na kuairisha safari ikiwa wewe ni mgonjwa, na kujitenga na kujulisha kituo cha afya chomboni mara moja ikiwa mtu ana hali ya joto au dalili zingine wakati yuko chomboni.
en-mt: Gloves and other tools discarded after use should not be discarded in special hospital trash carrier bags, and infected parts should be disinfected and cleaned for medication afterward. For shipping, including luxury ships and other passenger vessels, risk controls include airboarding if you are sick, and isolating and notifying the health center on the vessel immediately if a person has a temperature or other symptoms while on the vessel.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Inafaa, ufuatiliaji wa kimatibabu kufanyika katika chumba cha mtu aliyejitengwa.Kwa shule na majengo ya kulinda watoto, CDC inapendekeza kufungwa kwa muda kupangusa au kusafisha kwa dawa ikiwa mtu aliyeambukizwa amekuwa katika jengo shuleni bila kujali usambazaji wa kijamii.
en-mt: It is appropriate, medical monitoring to be done in a secluded person's room. For schools and buildings to protect children, the CDC recommends temporary lockdowns to disinfect or disinfect if an infected person has been in a building at a school regardless of social transmission.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Wakati ambapo kuna usambazaji chache hadi wastani ya kijamii, mbinu za kutotangamana na watu zinaweza kutekelezwa kama vile kukatisha safari za elimu, mikutano, na mkusanyiko mengine makubwa kama vile vipindi vya michezo au mafunzo ya kwanya au milo katika mikahawa, kuongeza nafasi kati ya madawati, kulegeza nyakati za kufika na kuondoka, kupunguza idadi ya wageni wasiohitajika, na kutumia eneo tofauti ya ofisi ya afya kwa watoto ambao wana dalili kama za homa ya mafua.
en-mt: At a time when there is limited to average social distribution, social distancing methods can be implemented such as cancelling educational trips, meetings, and other large gatherings such as sports or training sessions or meals in restaurants, increasing the space between desks, relaxing arrival and departure times, reducing the number of unwanted guests,  and using a separate health office area for children who have flu-like symptoms.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: Wakati kuna maambukizi makubwa katika jamii, kwa kuongea mikakati ya kutokaribiana, kufungwa kwa muda zaidi wa shule kunaweza kuzingatiwa. Kwa wahudumu wa kutekeleza sheria wanaofanya kazi za shughuli za kila siku, hatari iliyopo inazingatiwa kuwa iko chini na CDC.
en-mt: When there is significant transmission in the community, speaking of distancing strategies, further school closures may be considered. For law enforcement personnel working on day-to-day operations, the existing risk is considered low by the CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Maafisa wa kutekeleza sheria ambao ni lazima wawasiliane na watu waliothibitishwa au kushukiwa kuwa na COVID-19 wanapendekezwa kufuata maelekezo yale kama ya mafundi wa matibabu ya dharura, pamoja na vifaa halisi vya kujikinga.
en-mt: Law enforcement officers who must contact people who have been confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same instructions as emergency medical technicians, including actual personal protective equipment.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: Ikiwa kutakuwa na mgusano wa karibu wakati wa kuchukuliwa, wafanyakazi wanapaswa kusafisha na kutakasa mkanda na vifaa vyao vya kazi kabla ya kuvitumia tena kwa kutumia kinyunyizi au kipanguzaji cha kusafisha cha nyumbani, na wafuate taratibu za kawaida za kufanya kazi na utupaji wa PPE na vya kuweka na kufua nguo.
en-mt: If there is a close contact when taken, workers should clean and sanitize their work tape and equipment before reusing them using a sprinkler or home cleaning respirator, and follow standard working procedures with PPE disposal and for setting and laundry.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: Osha inawachukulia wafanyakazi wengine na wafanyakazi wa chumba cha kuhifadhia maiti kuwa katika hatari ya juu au katika kategoria ya hatari ya juu ya kuambukizwa.
en-mt: Osha considers other employees and mortuary workers to be at high risk or in the category of high risk of infection.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kazi ambazo zina hatari ya juu zinajumuisha utoaji wa huduma za afya, msaada, maabara, wafanyakazi wa kusafirisha matibabu ambao wamegusana na wagonjwa wanaojulikana au wanaoshukiwa wa COVID-19.
en-mt: Occupations that are high-risk include health care delivery, support, laboratory, medical transport personnel who have had contact with known or suspected COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kazi hizi zinakuwa zenye hatari kubwa ya kuambukizwa ikiwa wafanyakazi wanatekeleza taratibu za kuzalisha aerosoli, au kukusanya au kushughulikia sampiuli kutoka kwa wagonjwa wanaojulikana au kushukiwa wa COVID-19.
en-mt: These jobs become highly susceptible to infection if workers are performing aerosol-producing procedures, or collecting or handling samples from known or suspected COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Taratibu za kuzalisha aerosoli zinajumuisha kuingiza mrija katika umio, bronkoskopi, baadhi ya taratibu na uchunguzi wa meno, au ukusanyaji wa sampuli kwa kudunga,
en-mt: Aerosol-producing procedures include inserting a tube in esophage, broncose, some procedures and dental examination, or sample collection by injecting,

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Kazi zenye hatari ya juu ya maambuzi za chumba cha kuhifadhia maiti zinajumuisha wafanyakazi wanaohusika katika kuandaa miili ya watu waliojulikana au kushukiwa kuwa na viwa vya COVID-19 wakati wa kuaga kwao; hizi zinakuwa kazi zenye hatari ya juu ya maambukizi ikiwa watatekeleza uchunguzi wa maiti. Vidhibiti vya ziada vya uhandisi vya makundi haya ya hatari ni pamoja na vyumba vya kuwatenga wagonjwa vyenye wagonjwa wanaojulikana au kushukiwa kuwa na COVID-19, ikiwa ni pamoja na wakati taratibu za kuzalisha aerosoli zinapotekelezwa.
en-mt: High-risk functions of mortuary insemination include personnel engaged in preparing bodies of persons known or suspected to have COVID-19 at the time of their farewell; these become tasks with a higher risk of infection if they carry out a mortuary examination.
